loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Divina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years now. Divina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 57 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lorna has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, soaps, tea bags, rice, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soaps, tea bags, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soaps, tea bags,  and wheat flour.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 37-year-old man. He is married and blessed with three children, two of whom are attending school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development and financial management.

Charles does carpentry and is borrowing a Kiva loan to to buy carpentry materials so that he can produce quality products for his customers. This will help him earn more customers, and hence, more income. He says that will help him meet his family’s demands by providing better clothing and a balanced diet, as well as paying tuition fees for his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials for his carpentry business to boost his income and pay tuition fees for his children.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 32-year-old lady, married and blessed with 2 children, one of whom is attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 so as to benefit from its training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

Mary operates a grocery store. In addition, she works as a school kitchen attendant to supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables and hence add stock to her grocery store. This will enable her meet her customer’s demands as well as earn more income. With increased income, she will be able to pay for her child’s tuition fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables, and hence add stock to her grocery store and earn more income to pay for her child's education.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, age 43, is married to an Overseas Filipino Worker. They've been blessed with three children. She sells gallons of mineral water and liquid petroleum gas (LPG) in their village. She has done this for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 500 a day. She also has a tailoring business for additional income. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses and school fees for their children. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase LPG tanks, and gallons of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavlyuda was born in 1957. She is married and has 3 children. She lives with her family in Tajikistan. Her husband is a pensioner.

Mavlyuda is very hardworking woman and she works in a café as an assistant cook. Mavlyuda has worked in this field since 2007. She is a very good-hearted and kind woman.

Mavlyuda is ill now and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been engaged in a business selling water for many years now. She sells mineral water to her neighbors and local dwellers in her area.

She is married and has eight children, two of whom attend school. Her income goes for food and school expenses. Her husband has an income that also helps to meet the family's daily needs.

She faces a shortage of funds at the moment, preventing her from expanding her business. Maria decided to join Kiva's field partner CEVI to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan to invest in mineral water. That could help her sell more and improve her earnings, enabling her to invest in other possible business opportunities.

Maria is grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy mineral water.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as intelligent.

Anna operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

Anna will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business and cater to family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselyn is 20 years old now.

Roselyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in the market.

Roselyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena works hard to support her family. Ma. Elena is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Elena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business such as vegetables, fish, noodles, spices, etc.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for ten years now.

Ma. Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business such as vegetables, fish, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a single mother of seven children, who do not all attend school. She lives at her house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Martha operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In addition she also operates a livestock farming business that brings in another source of income. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport

loans.name: Avelinda

texts.en:
Avelinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Avelinda is 30 years old and has one child in school.

Avelinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

Avelinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Asia Bano

texts.en:
Meet Asia Bano from Pakistan! She is married and has five children. She has requested a loan for her husband; he conducts a food stall for offering burgers to the common people of his area in the evening.

He has been changing his menu from time to time according to weather, climate and taste. Nowadays, he wants to offer burgers; for this is reason, he is in need of eggs, spices, oil, onions, cauliflower and tomato ketchup. Earlier he was selling alu chat (Pakistani food), which is cheaper than burgers. He does not have enough cash in hand to buy ingredients for offering the next food item.

Therefore, Asia Bano has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can easily buy the described ingredients.

Asia Bano is the age of 36 and is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients usable in burgers for her husband's food stall.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana has been involved in business activities since 2002. She started her business with her own working capital of US $100. Joana has a kiosk in front in her house. She is happy to do this because it has become her business activity.

Joana is now requesting a loan of US $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more traditional items such as sugar, sardines, glue, slippers, noodles, eggs, cigarettes, balm, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can expand her business in the future, and her income can increase.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sardines, glue, slippers, noodles, eggs, cigarettes, balm, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia, de 38 años de edad, solo logro estudiar hasta noveno grado por que sus padres ya no le pudieron ayudar a continuar estudiando, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de los que dos aun viven con ella y una ya formo su  familia, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y solo sus 2 hijos dependen de ella.

Sonia tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa, ella empieza sus labores desde las 6 de la mañana y termina hasta las 6 de la tarde, Ocasionalmente le ayuda una hermana en el negocio. 
 
Sonia utilizara el crédito para comprar maíz y leña y para hacer mejoras en su casa; con ello espera poder mejorar sus fuente de ingreso y poder dar a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida. 

Sonia sueña con tener un negocio mas amplio y buenos ingresos quiere construir su casa de sistema mixto por que donde vive actualmente es de bahareque y ocasionalmente se le dañan las paredes, ademas quiere ver a sus hijos como todos unos profesionales y darles las condiciones que ella no tubo de pequeña.
texts.en:
Sonia, aged 38, only studied up to ninth grade as her parents could no longer help her to continue studying. She is a single mother of three children, two of whom still live with her and one has already started his own family. She now works selling tortillas, with only two of her children as dependants.

Sonia has been selling tortillas for ten years. She runs her business from home. She starts work at six in the morning and finishes at six in the evening. One of her sisters occasionally helps her at work.

Sonia will use the loan to buy corn and firewood and to make improvements to her house. With this, she hopes to be able to improve her sources of income and provide her children with better living conditions.

Sonia dreams of having a bigger business and higher income. She wants to build her house using a combined system, as her current home has mud walls that are occasionally damaged. She also wants to see her children become professionals and provide them with the conditions she did not have when she was young.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood and to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is 29 years old. She is married and she is a businesswomen. She is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop in a kiosk.

Suzana has been involved in business activities since 2012. She started with her own working capital of $150. She is earning a good income from her sales because she is selling where there are a lot of people, so many people like to buy in her kiosk. She is still happy to do her business.

Suzana is taking out this loan because she wants to buy more items such as sugar, aqua, detergents, sardines, cooking oils, coffee, slippers, milk, and also soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, aqua, detergents, sardines, cooking oils, coffee, slippers, milk, as well as soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married lady, 47 years old and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from its training, especially enterprise development and financial management. This enabled her to commercialize her farming activities and increase profits.

Nancy practices mixed farming i.e dairy farming, poultry keeping, and subsistence farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feed and fertilizer to boost the production of her farming activities. This will enable her earn more income.

Nancy is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer to boost farming production and earn more income.

loans.name: Velandia

texts.fr: Velandia, 26 ans, est célibataire. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite entreprise qui vend des matériaux de construction. Elle revend aussi de l’eau en sachet. L’activité marche très bien, elle a beaucoup de clients. Elle souhaite pouvoir profiter au maximum de cette opportunité. Elle demande un prêt pour augmanter son stock de ciment et de fer.
texts.en: Velandia, aged 26, is unmarried. She is the owner of a small enterprise selling construction materials and supplies. She also sells water in pouches. Her business is going very well. She has many customer. Her wish is to be able to take maximum advantage of this opportunity. She is asking for a loan to augment her stock of cement and iron.

loans.use: to augment her stock of cement and iron

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a 31-year-old woman, married and blessed with 2 children, one of which is attending primary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 so as to benefit from its training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

Lydiah buys and sells maize as a business. In addition, she works as a kitchen attendant to supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan buy more maize and hence add stock to her maize selling business. She says that this will help her get more income that she will use to pay for her child’s education fees and also pay her house rent.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more maize, and hence add stock to her maize selling business for more income to pay house rent and her child's school fees.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is a regular Kiva client. She is hardworking and friendly person.

Larisa has been selling women's clothes at the market over 20 years. Larisa is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to purchase women's winter coats. The loan will help Larisa to increase the assortment of her goods and attract new clients.

loans.use: to purchase women's winter coats

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a woman with determination. She is 56 years old, married and has four children: three adults and one-school-aged child. To earn a living, she has a hog raising business while her husband does fishing. They have been doing this to sustain their everyday needs, provide food, and support the needs of their children.

Rosita’s plan in the future is to have other business opportunities to enhance their livelihood. With this, she decided to request a loan for additional capital for her piggery (hog raising business); specifically, she will buy piglets, and feed as well. Aside from this, she will use the money to start a sari-sari (variety) store business. In this way, she will be able to reach her goal of having additional business that will improve their means of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed, and she intends to start a sari-sari (variety) store business with the profits.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
Sobirjon was born in 1966. He is married and has 3 children. His children are non-adults and they are schoolboys. His wife is a nurse and she works in a hospital.

Sobirjon is a wood master. He makes wonderful products such as doors, windows, tables, chairs, etc. He has worked in this field more than 20 years and he has great experience in this field. Sobirjon has some pupils.

Sobirjon is ill now and he needs financial support to buy medicines. Sobirjon is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni with this aim. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be experienced.

Joel operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Joel will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

This is Joel's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be intelligent. He operates a farm where he grows maize. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be floods. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edna is 58 years old now.

Edna has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like pants, dresses, etc.

Edna has been in this business for four years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like pants, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old and has eight children. She is married and has three children who are still in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business, farming fruit bearing trees in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seedlings, fertilizer, etc. for her business.

Rebecca has been business of farming fruit bearing trees for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings, fertilizer, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mercedes Argentina

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 42 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta quinto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar y son las únicas persona que depende económicamente de ellos, en su casa solo vive ella con su esposo y sus hijos.

Mercedes tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas y fresco desde hace 7 años, esta actividad la aprendió de joven con su mama, ella decidió poner este negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, anteriormente era empleada en casa, pero prefirió trabajar por cuenta propia, estas actividades la realiza en su casa y su esposo con su hija mayor son los que le ayudan en esta labor.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una plancha, dos licuadoras y maíz para hacer pupusas, esto le permitirá brindar otros productos como bebidas licuadas y dar un mejor servicio y tener mas clientes ya que se tarda en atender con la cocina de leña.

Mercedes desea hacer crecer su negocio para ayudar a su esposo a que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y ayudarles a que puedan seguir estudiando, este sueño lo podrá lograr con el préstamo ya que tendrá mejor ingresos para hacerlo realidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes, aged 42, studied up to fifth grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have three school-aged children, who are their only financial dependants. She lives with her husband and children.

Mercedes has been running her business selling stuffed tortillas and fresh produce for seven years. She learned this activity when she was young from her mother and decided to set up this business to help her husband with the household expenses. She was previously a household employee but preferred self-employment. She does these activities at home and her husband and oldest daughter help her with this work.

She will use the loan to buy a grill, two blenders and corn for making stuffed tortillas. This will allow her to provide other products such as blended drinks, to provide better service and to have more customers, as the wood-fired oven delays her in attending to them.

Mercedes wants to grow her business to help her husband so that her children have a better quality of life and to help them to continue studying. She will be able to achieve this dream with the loan, as she will have more income with which to make it come true.

loans.use: to buy a grill, two blenders and corn for making stuffed tortillas.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman and has been blessed with two school-going children. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a farming business, selling at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farming business

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda has been involved in a business activity since a few years ago, with her own working capital. She is married, and she is a businesswoman. She is also one of the entrepreneurs, and her business has opened a kiosk. Her husband is in agriculture, so her husband was very supportive of her doing the business.

Now, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with their capital to buy more items according to the people's likes, such as hand and body soaps, tea, rice, biscuits, cigarettes, candies, Aqua, hair oil, soft drinks and other things to sell, because she wants to change her business into a bigger one.

She is very happy with the loan that is offered by Tuba Rai Metin because she can be increasing her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy hand and body soaps, tea, rice, biscuits, cigarettes, candies, Aqua, hair oil, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nuru Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Susan. She is 43 years old, married and blessed with two children who are attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 so as to benefit from its training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

Susan is involved in farming activities; she farms maize, beans, potatoes and onions on her small piece of land. In addition, she also sells second-hand clothes when she is not attending to her farm.

She is borrowing the Kiva loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm. She intends to use the increased profits to buy more second hand clothes for resale. This will greatly increase her income levels and that will enable her support her family.

Susan is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their great support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to increase farming production for increased income. She will use the profits to add stock to her second hand clothes selling business.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.fr: Ernestine vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé dernièrement. Avec lequel, elle a pu développer son activité, augmenter les stocks de marchandises, améliorer les achalandages. Elle a trouvé une maison pour habitation et l'ancienne maison servira seulement de boutique pour que celle-ci soit attirante et présentable. Etant une femme créative, courageuse, débrouillarde, elle va étendre l'activité en proposant d'autres articles. Avec le prêt, elle va encore acheter des sacoches, sacs à dos mais aussi des cires et du miel et les revendre après.Sa mère va lui fournir les nouveaux produits c'est à dire le miel et les cires.
texts.en: Ernestine says thank you very much for the loan you granted her last time. With the loan, she was able to develop her business, increase her inventory of merchandise, and improve customer traffic. She found a house in which to live, and the former house will be used only as a shop, so that it may be attractive and presentable. Being a creative, brave, and resourceful woman, she is going to expand her business by offering other items. With this loan, she is going buy more shoulder bags, handbags, and also some wax and honey to resell later. Her mother will provide new products, that is, the honey and wax.

loans.use: to purchase shoulder bags, handbags, honey, and wax.

loans.name: Sahobitiana Elyse

texts.fr:
Sahobitiana Elyse a 26 ans et est mariée. C'est une femme dynamique et débrouillarde. Elle travaille dur pour pouvoir avancer et s'améliorer dans la vie. Le couple a un enfant non encore  scolarisé. 
Elle tient un magasin général depuis novembre 2013. Avant, elle a travaillé dans une entreprise de zone franche mais  a dû  abandonner ce travail, étant enceinte. Elle a entrepris l’activité actuelle  pour pouvoir subvenir aux  besoins  de son enfant. En raison de ses efforts, le fonds utilisé augmente , elle ne fait plus de crédit à l’approvisionnement. 
Elle a pour objectifs de devenir grossiste en produits de première nécessité  et d’avoir une maison pour elle.
texts.en:
Sahobitiana Elyse is 26 years old and married. She is a dynamic and resourceful woman. She works hard to be able to advance and improve her life. The couple has a child who does not yet attend school.

Sahobitiana Elyse has managed a general store since November 2013. Before, she worked in a free zone enterprise but had to abandon this work, as she was pregnant. She started the current activity to be able to provide for her child's needs.

Thanks to her efforts, the capital used is increasing, she no longer needs to get her supplies on credit. Her objectives are to become a wholesaler of basic necessity products and to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, dried vegetables, healthy drinks, biscuits, etc...

loans.name: Soreyan

texts.en:
Soreyan is 20 years old and single. She is a student from the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting, and is in her second year at a university in the city. Her father is a tuk tuk driver and her mother is a rice farmer.

Because Soreyan is short of finances to cover her tuition fees from the third to the fourth year, she requested a loan. With this loan, she will be able to cover her university fees and earn skills to achieve her future goal. In the future, she is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to save money to build her own house. If she has children, she wants them to study to pursue a bachelor's or master's degree.

loans.use: to cover her tuition fees.

loans.name: Vitaliya

texts.en:
Vitaliya is married, and she has three daughters. Vitaliya has a business where she travels from village to village, selling various items.

Using her previous Kiva loan, Vitaliya purchased school clothes, shoes and stationery. She had nice sales and a good income. Vitaliya always sells goods that are in high demand. Most of the time, people in villages can't easily go to a city to shop. Vitaliya takes goods that they need right to where they are!

This time, Vitaliya is asking for a loan of 80,000 UAH to purchase winter outerwear and shoes. The loan will help her to increase the assortment of goods and serve more people in villages.

loans.use: to purchase winter outwear and shoes.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from Avon like lotion, deodorant, shampoo, lipsticks, etc., to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 28 years now.

Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon like lotion, deodorant, shampoo, lipsticks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Aurilia

texts.en:
Aurilia is married and has 11 children. She works hard to support her family. She sells charcoal in the Philippines. Aurilia earns additional income from raising pigs.

Aurilia is requesting her ninth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana is 60 years old and has fourteen children. Damiana is married and has one child in school.

Damiana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Damiana requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Damiana has been in this business for 3 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Damiana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a livestock raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock for her business.

Salvacion has been in this business for 9 years. Salvacion earns more income from a general store.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Wakili

texts.en:
Wakili is a divorced woman and has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

For the past 20 years, she has operated a farming business, selling at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. In addition she also operates a food selling business that earns her another source of income .

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for her farming business.

loans.name: Berthine

texts.fr:
Berthine a 43 ans, elle est mariée. Son mari l’appuie dans ses activités. Le couple a six enfants, et quatre  restent avoir l'âge d'aller à l'école. 
Elle a 20 années d’expérience dans la vente de soubiques, sacs et nattes. Avant, elle confectionnait des slips et soutiens gorges pour les revendre. C’est son mari qui s’adonnait à la vente ambulante  de produits artisanaux, trop de vente à crédit ont été réalisées. Elle a déployé des efforts pour le développement de l’activité : diversification des produits, augmentation de la quantité et recherche d’un point de vente. Elle  a un point de vente fixe depuis 2005.
L’objectif est de disposer beaucoup plus de fonds propres dans le but d’investir en milieu rural et d’assurer l’éducation des enfants. Le couple projette de construire leur propre maison  pour leur autonomie.
texts.en:
Berthine is 43 years old. She is married. Her husband supports her work. The couple have six children, and four are still [not old enough for school]. For twenty years, Berthine has been selling soubiques, bags, and mats. In the past, she used to make undergarments and girdles to resell. Her husband used to devote his time to selling artisanal products door to door. Too many sales on credit were realized.

Berthine has deployed her energies to develop her business: diversifying her products, increasing the quantity, and seeking sales outlets. She has had a fixed sales outlet since 2005. Her goal is to have a lot more capital of her own with the goal of investing in the rural areas and ensuring her children’s education. The couple plan to build a house of their own to be independent.

loans.use: to purchase mats, soubiques, baskets, and ropes

loans.name: Marie Olga

texts.fr:
Marie Olga a 45 ans. Elle est mariée. Son mari travaille comme maçon mais son revenu est saisonnier. Outre, l’activité d’élevage, son mari l’appui dans l’activité quand il ne travaille pas. Le couple a 5 enfants âgés de 15-13-8-7-6 ans dont 4 scolarisés dans des écoles publiques. L’aîné appui la famille. 
Marie Olga a exercé l’activité de vente de légumes et de fruits depuis 2005. Avant, elle s’adonnait à la vente de charbon de bois, activité qu’elle a abandonnée après la naissance d’un enfant. C'est son mari qui exerçait en premier l’activité de vente de fruits et légumes et elle continuait et avait commencé par une petite quantité de produits dans un seul point de vente. Actuellement, elle dispose de deux points de vente. Marie Olga à un esprit créatif. 
Le couple a comme objectif d’assurer la réussite de leurs enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Marie Olga is 45 years old. She is married. Her husband works as a mason but his income is seasonal. Aside from a livestock rearing activity, her husband helps her in her activity when he is not working. The couple has five children aged 15, 13, 8, 7 and 6 years old, of whom four attend school in public schools. The eldest supports the family.

Marie Olga has been selling vegetables and fruits since 2005. Before, she engaged in charcoal sales, an activity she abandonned after childbirth. Her husband was the one who first sold fruits and vegetables and she took over, she started with a small quantity of products in a single point of sale. Currently, she has two points of sale.

Marie Olga has a creative spirit. The couple's objectives are to ensure their children's success in their studies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables: carrots, tomatoes, potatoes... and fruits: bananas, mangoes, papayas.

loans.name: Heritiana Violette

texts.fr:
Heritiana violette a 33ans et est marié. Le couple à 4 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés. Elle habite dans sa propre maison. 
Elle  est à son 4eme prêt  chez CEFOR pour développer l’activité de vente de sacoches et de sacs. Elle s’est lancée dans cette activité depuis 2009 avec un seul point de vente, actuellement son mari tient également un autre point de vente. 
Son objectif est de multiplier les points de vente par l’ouverture d’un autre point de vente et de pouvoir augmenter son capital afin d’avoir les produits en vogue dans son activité.
texts.en:
Heritiana Violette is 33 years old and is married. The couple has four children of whom three attend school. She lives in her own home. She is on her fourth CEFOR loan to develop her activity of pouch and bag sales. She embarked on this activity since 2009 with a single point of sale, currently her husband also manages another point of sale.

Her objective is to multiply the points of sale by opening another point of sale and to be able to increase her capital so as to have popular products in her activity.

loans.use: to buy pouches, travel bags, ladies' handbags, backpacks.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré en Octobre 2015, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre leurs petits commerces plus rentables. 

Madame Mariama (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 filles et  s’active dans la vente de vêtements.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter différents types de vêtements dans ma capital pour le revendre en détails dans son village et les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et la prise en charge des ses enfants.
texts.en:
Inaugurated in October 2015, this banc villageois is made up of women from the village grouping who adhered to the programme to make their petty trade more profitable.

Mrs Mariama (standing at the extreme right with her right hand raised), is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and mother of two girls and works in clothes sales. With her new loan, she intends to buy different types of clothes in the capital to retail in her village and weekly markets.

With the profits, she intends to help her husband in the management of daily expenses and taking care of her children.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes in the capital to retail in her village and weekly markets.

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Mario es un trabajador y luchador, que tiene 56 años y tres hijos por quienes luchar a diario.
El socio se dedica al servicio de taxi, todos los días sale temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, su deseo es tener un mejor vehículo para poder seguir laborando en el trasporte.
El socio solicito el préstamo para el mantenimiento se auto, el quiere comprar llantas y aceite de carro, para que su herramienta de trabajo no se deteriore  y el pueda realizar su servicio de forma segura.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de pan, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant, venta de golosinas, 
El socio está contento y agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA por el préstamo dado, y se comprometen a pagar sus cuotas en los plazos acordados.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank " SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY (LORD OF MURUHUAY)". This bank is located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

One of the members, Mario, is a hard worker and a fighter. He is 56 years old and has three children for whom he fights every day. He works in the taxi service. He is out early every day from 7 am to 7 pm. He wants to have a better vehicle to continue working in the transport.

Mario requests a loan to maintain his car. He wants to buy tires and motor oil so his working tool does not deteriorate and that he can perform his service safely.

The other members are in the business of selling bread, selling animals, grocery store and restaurant, and selling sweets. Mario is happy and grateful to KIVA investors on the loan and agrees to pay the dues on time.

loans.use: to buy tires and motor oil.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 48 years old and has six children who are in school. Alona is married.

Alona is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Alona requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Alona has been in this business for 3 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmen is 58 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Carmen has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Emalinda

texts.en:
Emalinda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emalinda is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emalinda has a business buying and selling rugs in the Philippines. Emalinda requested a PHP 10500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rugs to sell.

Emalinda has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Emalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rugs to sell.

loans.name: Lourenca

texts.en:
Lourenca is 23 years old and married. She operates a shop selling second-hand clothing in the market, which she has been doing for a few years. She started with her own working capital. She is earning a good income because many people like to buy second-hand clothing as it is cheap and unique compared to new clothes. 

Lourenca requested a loan from Tuba Rai Metin for $700.00, which she will use to purchase short-sleeved shirts, T-shirts, turtlenecks, pants. and other items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase short-sleeved shirts, T-shirts, turtlenecks, pants. and other items to sell.

loans.name: Bodonirina

texts.fr:
Bodonirina a 46ans, elle est mariée à un commercial  d’une station d’essence. Ils ont 3 filles, âgées de 20ans, 18ans et de 3ans. Dont la première en 1ere année, la deuxième en deuxième année en université et la dernière en jardins d’enfants. 
L’activité est la confection de vêtements. L’activité de Bodonirina a déjà existé depuis 1993. Ses parents,  initiateurs  de l’activité lui a influencé à entreprendre la vente de ces produits. Elle en est très passionnée de ce qu'elle entreprend  pour développer l’activité.
Grâce à ses efforts, elle a pu s’acheter une machine industrielle. Elle a pour objectif de devenir aussi  un grossiste en tissus et de réaliser des travaux sur commande.
texts.en:
Bodonirina is 46 years old and married to a worker at a gasoline station. The couple have three girls, aged 20, 18, and 3, of whom the first is a university junior, the second is a university sophomore, and the last is in kindergarten.

Her business involves making clothing. It has been in existence since 1993. Her parents, the initiators of the business, influenced her to take on the selling of these products. She is passionate about doing this, so as to develop the business.

Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to purchase an industrial machine. Her goal is also to become a wholesaler of fabrics and to produce goods by special order.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, and elastics

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María, de 70 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos y no podían mandarla a la escuela, actualmente es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, 1 de ellos es hombre y el resto son mujeres, 2 de sus hijos ya formaron sus propios hogares y con ella viven 2 hijos y 1 nieto y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

María, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace unos 10 años, ella comenta que su mama fue quien le enseño este negocio y la motivo a realizar su propio negocio,  para llegar a donde está su venta tiene que caminar aproximadamente 50 mt. y  trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias. 

María utilizara el préstamo para comprar sandia, plátanos, guineo, tomate, papa y pipianes, etc. ella espera aumentar sus ventas porque con la inversión de este préstamo no le faltara ningún producto.

María, sueña con tener un negocio amplio y con las ganancias que obtenga poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, todo esto lo lograra con el crédito que va a adquirir.
texts.en:
María, aged 70, studied up to second grade as her family had few financial resources and were unable to send her to school. She is now a single mother of four children, one son and the rest daughters. Two of her children have already started their own families and two of her children and one grandchild live with her. These are her only dependants.

María works selling fruit and vegetables. She has been doing this for about ten years. She says that her mother taught her this business and encouraged her to start her own business. She has to walk about 50 m to reach her sales point and she works for eight hours per day on average.

María will use the loan to buy watermelon, plantains, bananas, tomatoes, potatoes and squash, etc. She hopes to increase her sales, because by investing this loan she will not lack any products.

María dreams of having a large business and will be able to use her earnings to provide her family with a better quality of life. She will do all this with the loan she is going to receive.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, plantains, bananas, tomatoes, potatoes and squash, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has six children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business, selling sugar, bread, flour, drinking water, and other items, which she has been doing for seven years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

Mary requested her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes to educate her children to university level. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and other items

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melisa is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Melisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melisa requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, noodles, spices, cooking oil, and more for her food production business.

Melisa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Melisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, noodles, spices, cooking oil, and more for her food production business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 64 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. She operates a fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 13 years.

Teresita requested a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more varieties of fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fish to sell

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada y su esposo es agricultor y albañil, tienen 4 hijos en edad escolar y son las únicas persona que depende económicamente de ellos, en su casa solo vive ella con su esposo y sus hijos.

Patricia, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace 5 años, esta actividad la aprendió en un programa que fue impulsado en su comunidad y decidió dedicarse a esta actividad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, anteriormente se dedicaba a ayudarle a su esposo con las actividades agrícolas, esta granja la tiene en su casa y su esposo junto con sus hijos son los que le ayudan con la crianza de estas aves.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar pollos, concentrado, vacuna y vitaminas, con esto estará incrementando su producción ya que tiene pedidos que le han hecho para la época navideña, 

Patricia desea poder seguir criando la cantidad de pollos que estará incrementando en su granja para mantenerse con ese incremento de sus ingresos y ayudar a que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida y que sus hijos sigan estudiando y lleguen a ser profesionales, este sueño lo podrá realizar con el préstamo que se le otorgara.
texts.en:
Patricia, aged 34, studied up to fifth grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer and construction worker. They have four school-aged children, who are their only financial dependants. She lives with her husband and children.

Patricia has been working raising broiler chickens for five years. She learned this activity through an initiative in her community and decided to work doing this in order to help with household expenses. She previously helped her husband with farming activities. The farm is part of their house, and her husband and their children help her to raise these birds.

The loan will be used to buy chickens, pellets, vaccines and vitamins, which will increase her production, as they have already received orders for the Christmas season.

Patricia wants to be able to continue raising the increasing number of chickens on her farm, in order to maintain the increased income, help her family to have a better quality of life and help her children to keep studying and become professionals. She will be able to achieve this dream with the loan she is being given.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pellets, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Santa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Santa de 36  años  de edad es casada, tiene 04 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 11 años al negocio de venta de cuajada, y leña seca, sus clientes les prefieren por su atención y seriedad al momento de hacer los tratos.
Doña Santa es un mujer emprendedora que ha salido adelante gracias a la ayuda de Dios y su esfuerzo también trabaja de forma conjunta con su esposo ya que el sale a vender la leña en su carro y compra vacas para revenderlas a los destazadores.
Doña Santa está solicitando el préstamo para compra de un lote de madera seca para picar cortarla y revenderla, 300 botellas de leche y espera que con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y comprar un carro mejor del que tiene.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Santa, age 36, is married.  She has four children who depend on her.  She lives with her husband in her home.  For 11 years she has worked in her business selling cheese curds and cured firewood.  Her customers prefer her products because of her attention and seriousness during a transaction.

Santa is an enterprising woman who has gotten ahead thanks to the help of God and her own efforts.  She works in collaboration with her husband, because he goes out to sell the firewood in his car and buys cows to resell to butchers.

Santa is asking for this loan to buy a load of dry wood to chop and resell.  She will also buy 300 bottles of milk, and hopes that with the help of a loan she can improve her income and, in the end, her quality of life.

Her dream is to make improvements on her house and to buy a better car than the one she has.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy wood and 300 bottles of milk for her business.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 40 years old and married. She is from the town of Talibon. She engages in farming, growing and selling rice. 
Her husband is a carpenter. 

Maribeth hopes to acquire pigs to raise. She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and she is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy farm maintenance, such as medicine, and pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm maintenance, such as medicine, and pigs

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food and cutlery. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food and cutlery.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 38 year old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She operates a butcher shop in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Cristina requested a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more meat to sell in the market. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married and has been blessed with two children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a  farming business, selling  at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase seedlings, seeds, and fertilizers for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, seeds, and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane used her previous loan to buy poultry feeds and certified vegetables seeds, which increased production and consequently income used to pay for her family's expenses. 

Jane requested another loan, which she will use to buy manure for her farm thus further boosting production and enabling her to earn more income to continue supporting her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase manure

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been driving a taxi for 19 years. Her husband is responsible to provide for the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to maintain his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Rukhsana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. He will be able to provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Rukhsana also plans to save some of the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Rukhsana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a M-pesa business where he offers mobile phone based money transfer services. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add M-pesa float. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He also owns a barber shop and a beauty salon. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as kind. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to have 5 more shops within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 48-year-old married mother of seven children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Cresencia has a abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. Cresencia requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Cresencia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 58 years old and married with four children, two currently in school. Apolonia works very hard to provide for them.

Apolonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Apolonia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, shampoo, cereals, cooking oil, soft-drinks, and beer.

In the future, Apolonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 58 years old and married with two children.

Carina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Carina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general Store for two years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Carina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Patricio Marcelo

texts.es:
Don Patricio vive en San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, el mismo cuenta varios sitios turísticos y de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tenemos las fiestas del Cantón el 17 de julio en  las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo la gente en este Cantón es muy alegre, amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes. 
El señor Patricio es  un joven de 25 años es soltero, no tienen hijos actualmente vive en casa de sus Padres pero es independiente a pesar de esto no deja de apoyarlos, Don Patricio trabaja en una vulcanizadora y cerrajería del sector desde hace más de un año tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad, sabe que puede salir adelante con este negocio. 
Don Patricio solicita el crédito para iniciar en su propio taller de cerrajería tiene el conocimiento necesario, herramientas y clientes que desean ser atendidos por él,  a esta actividad le dedicará un promedio de 10 horas diarias, Don Patricio agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Patricio lives in San Miguel de los Bancos, Cantón del Amor, where there are several locations for tourism and relaxation that are frequently visited by national and foreign tourists. One of its traditions is the local festivals on July 17, with popular dances and the famous burning of the castle. The people of this district are very happy, friendly and relaxed with all their visitors.

Patricio is a young man aged 25 years. He is single with no children and currently lives in his parents' home. He is independent, but has not stopped supporting them. Patricio has been working at a tyre repair and locksmith in this area for over a year. He is very experienced in this activity and knows that he can move forward with this business.

Patricio is requesting the loan in order to set up his own locksmith's workshop. He has the required knowledge and tools and customers who want him to serve them. He will work for an average of 10 hours per day on this activity. Patricio thanks the Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunity.

loans.use: to set up his own locksmith's shop and support his parents with the household expenses.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is in his mid sixties and a father of one. He has a 29 year old married son who is a father of one. Mark's son works in Greece while his wife and son live with Mark and his wife. He is applying for this loan because he wants to build a vineyard.

Mark has been doing agriculture/livestock for the past twenty years. His family owns only five dynym of agricultural land where they mainly plant fodder for the animals and seasonal veggies' The rest of it is left bare at the moment with the thought of starting a vineyard. In addition, he's got a dairy cow, a young female cow and a pig.

"I have left some bare land where I thought it would be good to have grapevines. If I plant the vines now, on their third year they will produce adequate grapes. I can sell them to families who want to make homemade wines or the local alcoholic drink 'raki' said Mark in the interview in the branch office.

loans.use: to start up a vineyeard

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana works hard to support her family. Sebastiana is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Sebastiana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Sebastiana has been in this business for three years.

Sebastiana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is 38 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons and her husband has been a butcher for the past 20 years,

Her husband is responsible for supporting his entire family and managing the household. Sultana's husband wants to purchase items for his butcher business but due to financial constraints, he is unable to.

Therefore, Sultana has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy cattle for his business. He will then be able to earn maximum profits from his business.

For this financial assistance, Sultana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's butcher business.

loans.name: Umayati

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Umayati, a 49-year-old married woman with two sons and one daughter. For the past three years, Umayati has been selling clothes; her husband is an employee.

Umayati has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Umayati will be able to repay the loan. She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 53-year-old widow and mother of two children. She owns and manages a retail store in her village and has been in business for almost 2 1/2 years. She earns a net income of PHP 700 a day.

Angelita's net income from her store is usually spent on providing daily needs. Due to inadequate capital, she would like to take out a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase frozen foods, cooking oil, sugar, salt, vinegar, soy sauce, and beverages to sell.

She's hoping that her retail store will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase frozen foods, cooking oil, sugar, salt, vinegar, soy sauce, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ledilou

texts.en:
Ledilou is 47 years old and married with two children.  With two children currently in school, Ledilou works very hard to provide for them.

Ledilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, noodles, beer, soft-drinks, canned goods, and coffee to sell.

Ledilou has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, noodles, beers, soft-drinks, canned goods and coffee.

In the future, Ledilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, noodles, beer, soft-drinks, canned goods, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 60 years old. She is a graduate of the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, Faculty of Mathematics. She already has 37 years of work experience as a pedagogue and now she also works at the school as a mathematics teacher. She is a very patient and clever teacher. She is very attentive and careful with each of her pupils in order to help them understand lesson materials and avoid any kind of mistakes. Rita also gives paid private courses in mathematics to a group of pupils who are going to pass entrance exams.

Rita lives with her husband in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. She has a son who lives and works in the Russian Federation and also a daughter, who is married and lives with her family. Rita is asking for this loan of 300,000 AMD as she wants to buy a computer which will be a perfect source of information for her teachingl activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer which will be a perfect source of information for her teaching activities.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
This young and clever man is 26 years old and his name is Karen. He lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region with his brother and parents (they rent a stall where they sell fruits and vegetables). He is a student, studying at the Yerevan State University in the faculty of geography. He is in the paid distance learning department.

Karen is in his last year of studying and he has a lot of work to do for his graduation. He must get prepared for his graduation exams and he must write his diploma. Simultaneously with pursuing his education he also works as a contractual military serviceman.

Karen asks for this loan of 400.000 AMD as he wants to buy a computer. It will be a very important tool for him for his university graduation work. It will help him to write his diploma and get prepared for his exams.

loans.use: to buy a computer to buy a computer to help him to write his diploma and get prepared for his exams.

loans.name: Naxalia

texts.es: La señora Naxalia, es casada y es madre de 7 hijos, actualmente sus dos hijos mayores y su esposo están en Estados Unidos trabajando, comenta la señora Naxalia que el esfuerzo vale la pena, ya que estando ellos en ese país le han ayudado para comprar una casa, el cual cambió por una finca, comenta que sus hijos y su marido la han apoyado bastante para tener sus cosas, y los otros hijos que están en Nicaragua están trabajando la propiedad junto con ella. La señora Naxalia es la que guía el hogar en este momento que no está su marido y en esta propiedad no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que la señora está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en su casa de habitación, este sistema solar vendrá a ser de gran utilidad para todos los miembros del hogar ya que en temporada de corte de café utilizan luz para alumbrarse por las noches cuando están despulpando, además los hijos menores están estudiando y utilizarían la luz para hacer las tareas por las noches, además ya podrían cargar sus celulares para comunicarse con sus hijos y su marido que están fuera del país.
texts.en:
Naxalia is married and is the mother of seven children.  Currently her oldest two children and her husband are working in the United States.  Naxalia says that this challenge is worth the effort because with them working in that country, they have helped her to buy a house, which was traded for a farm.  She says that her children and her husband have supported her quite a bit in order to get the things she has, and her children in Nicaragua are working the property alongside her.  

Naxalia is the head of the home right now since her husband isn’t here.  There isn’t electricity on the property, so she is asking for a loan to buy a solar power system to be installed in her home.  This solar electric system will be incredibly useful for all the members of the family. It is the season in which they cut coffee beans, and they use light to illuminate the area at night when they are de-pulping the beans.  Additionally, her younger children are still in school and they will use the light to do their homework at night.  Also, they can all charge their cell phones to talk with the husband and children who are out of the country.

loans.use: to buy a 200 watt solar energy system with five lighting fixtures and two batteries installed

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is 50 years old and has two children. He has been working as a foreman for 15 years to support his family and cover their living needs. Education is the most important thing for him.

Adnan is the sole breadwinner of his family, with his limited monthly salary. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to pay for his son's Physical Treatment major third-year university tuition fees so that he can continue his studies. He hopes to see his children graduating and working in their domain of study.

loans.use: to pay for his son's third-year university tuition fees

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 33 years old, married to Geofry, and blessed with three children between the ages of 3 and 11. She has been in the timber selling business for five years, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KSH.

This is Jackline's first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, and she intends to buy more timber for resale. She anticipates being able to pay school fees for their children from the expanded business. Jackline dreams of becoming the best business lady in Kapsabet.

loans.use: to purchase trees for processing timber

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for 25 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Jameela has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Jameela's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Jameela also plans to have savings from the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Jameela is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is a 42-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two children, and pensioner parents-in-law in Khobi district. The family is involved in agricultural activities.

Inga wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of flour and will resell it at a higher price. This will give her a stable income, and she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Inga awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a trade in flour.

loans.name: Anih

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Anih, who is a 41-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. Anih has a small shop and her husband has a car wash. He has also been renting a sound system for ten years. 

Anih has asked for a loan of 3,000,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation facilities at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Anih will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation facilities at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Voleak

texts.en:
Voleak, 18, was an outstanding student when she was in high school. She is currently studying at university to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting. Voleak resides with her parents in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Her parents are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue. 

To pay for her tuition fees from first to the fourth year, Voleak is applying for a loan of  2,000 USD. When she finishes her bachelor's degree, Voleak is going to find a good job with reasonable salary. She also wants to build a new house for her family and, if she has children, she wants her them to study to pursue bachelor's degrees as well.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees from first to fourth year.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla, aged 56, is married to a farmer and they're blessed with one child. She owns a retail store in their village and plans to open it again this month.

That's why she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase chips, cooking oil, sugar, salt, diapers, biscuits, canned goods, beverages, and many more items to sell.

She is also into direct sales of personal use products to have an additional income. She's been in this business for almost 34 years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. She's hoping that her store will continue to grow profitably.

loans.use: to purchase chips, cooking oil, sugar, salt, diapers, biscuits, canned goods, beverages, and many more items to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Halima will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Maria will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wonderful family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be industrious.

Dorothy operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 15 years, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more ingredients for the preparation of food. Dorothy hopes that she will be successful in the future. This is Dorothy's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and she will use the anticipated profits to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to stock more ingredients for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 38-year-old married woman with four children who are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF. She has been in this business for 2 years, and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, bread, etc.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as coffee, detergent, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, bread, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is 43 years old and married with six children. With three of her children in school, Eleuteria works very hard to provide for them.

Eleuteria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store such as bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Eleuteria has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store such as bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Reyna Evelyn

texts.es:
Reyna, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada, su esposo trabaja como jefe de personal en una granja y sus hijos estudian.

Reyna, tiene tres años de tener una tienda, porque de este modo puede atender su casa y a sus hijos y tener su fuente de ingresos, en el negocio le ayuda su hijo menor.
 
Reyna, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos rinso, azúcar, carne, pollo, golosinas, etc.
