Sus sueños es ampliar su negocio y tener un negocio más grande para tener mejores ganacias y mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Reyna, 27 years old, studied through 8th grade. She is married; her husband works as the manager of a farm and her children are students.

Reyna has had a store for three years. This way she can take care of her home and her children and have her own source of income. Her youngest son helps her with her business.

Reyna needs the loan to buy Rinso products (laundry detergent), sugar, meat, chicken, sweets, etc.

Her dream is to expand her business and have a bigger business in order to have better profits and better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy Rinso products (laundry detergent), sugar, meat, chicken, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Chann is a 21-year-old single freshman who is from Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Chann is studying accounting at a university in the city. Chann’s family members are rice farmers. They totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for her tuition fees.

Due to a shortage of money to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, she has decided to secure a loan. With the loan, Chann will graduate successfully with skills for her future job. After graduation, she wants a good job with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to help her family. She also wants to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Tunas Baru Group

texts.en:
Tunas Baru group is composed of 5 women and chaired by Arni, (in the middle) a 31-year-old woman. Arni is married to Kosmas, a 37-year-old man who worked as an employee. They are blessed with 4 children; their ages are between 3 to 11 years old and three go to school. 

Arni has been running a kiosk business for 8 years. With this business Arni can support her husband particularly in managing their living needs. As a mother, Arni also cares to her children’s education. She hopes to save some money for their education in the future.  

She has planned to improve her business. She thinks that if more products are sold that she can generate more income so that she can save some money for her children. Moreover there are demands from the customers for currently incomplete items such as rice, noodles, sugar, kerosene, and wheat. Therefore, along with 4 women Arni formed the Tunas Baru group and requested a loan totaling IDR 10,000,000 from Kiva through TLM.  She is thankful for Kiva who always focuses on the small entrepreneurs in the world.  She believes the loan will be beneficial for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock  such as rice, noodles, sugar, kerosene, and wheat to add to her kiosk

loans.name: Zamin

texts.en:
Zamin is a farmer, and he is 29 years old. He is married and has a daughter. The family members are IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli City; they now live in the village of Gazakhlar in the Fuzuli region.

Zamin has been in the animal breeding business for three years. He sells yogurt and farm cheese in local stores. Zamin is a very hardworking person. He learned his business from his father.

Now he needs a loan of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to buy two cows in order to expand his business. Zamin is thankful to Komak Credit Union and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to expand his business

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar was born in the year 1965. She is a kind woman, and she lives with her family together in a house located in the north of Tajikistan.

Sanavbar has a higher education. She works in a local school as an English teacher. Sanavbar is one of the best teachers, as she has great experience in this field. Sanavbar has worked more than 30 years.

She is asking for a loan because she is ill. Sanavbar is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 48 years old supporting seven people in her family, she sells fish, a business she has been doing for the last 20 years and gets a monthly income of KES 35,000.

Anna has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more stock. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Esther will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be polite.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, soft drinks, and other items. Caroline has been involved in this business for 10 years, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy more sugar, bread, flour, soft drinks and other items to sell. Her business goal is to have more businesses within 5 years. Caroline hopes that she will have an improved standard of living in the future. She will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, flour, soft drinks, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 27 years old, married to Josephat, and blessed with one 9-year-old child.

She has been in the tea farming business for 8 years, and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KSH. This is Eunice's third loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she intends to purchase fertilizer and tea for sale.

Eunice anticipates purchasing a dairy cow from the expanded business profits. She hopes to engage in zero grazing to boost her earnings in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and tea for sale

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as obedient. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her family's challenge to be lack of enough water. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Aracely Isabel

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos, En este Cantón vive y trabaja en una hostería  la señora Aracely una mujer luchadora, de 24 años ella vive en unión libre fruto de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 4, 7 y 8 años  ellos estudian y es por ellos que se esfuerzan cada día. 
Ella y su esposo trabajan en una hostería y desean emprender en una pequeña granja porcina, tienen construidas dos chancheras casi listas para funcionar, aprendió de esta actividad junto a su esposo quien antes ya trabajaba en una finca porcina, le dedicarán  un promedio de 4 horas diarias entre su trabajo y su granja de cerdos, con esta inversión lo que ella espera es que su nivel de vida mejore ya que podrá lograr un mejor ingreso económico  para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 
La señora Aracely agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos. In this canton, Aracely lives and works in a hostel. She is a hard-working woman, age 24. She is in a common-law relationship and has three children ages 4, 7, and 8. They are in school, and she and her partner work for them every day.
She and her partner work in a hostel and want to start a pork farm. They have two sties built and almost ready to go. She and her partner learned this work together; he used to work at a pork farm. They will spend about four hours a day on it. With this investment, she hopes her standard of living will improve and she will be able to obtain a better income in order to give her children a better future.
Aracely thanks the Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and for this opportunity for her family.

loans.use: to start her pork farm.

loans.name: Rawasia

texts.en:
Rawasia is a 51-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of one daughter and five sons. Her husband has been running his own butcher shop business for past 30 years and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family and managing the household.

Rawasia's husband wants to purchase animals for his butcher business but, due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase the cattle. Therefore, Rawasia has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also be good for him to earn the maximum profits from his business.

For this financial assistance Rawasia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband expand his butcher business.

loans.name: Dúo En Dios Confiamos Group

texts.es: Dúo En Dios Confiamos La señora Margarita se dedica a la venta de pollo por libra, verduras en general, especies, y frutas navideñas desde hace 10 años.  Es viuda y vive al lado de sus hijos ya casados quienes la ayudan desde que falleció su esposo.  Su sueño es sacar cada día adelante el bello regalo que su esposo le dejo, lo cual fue su negocio.  Las fiestas de fin de año se aproximan y las personas ya le están pidiendo uvas verdes y manzanas frescas para diferentes actividades, pero no le es suficiente el dinero que tiene y se ve en la necesidad de hacer un préstamo para poder comprar lo que le hace falta y no fallarles a sus compradores.
texts.en:
"En Dios Confiamos" ["In God we Trust"] Duo
Margarita has sold chicken, vegetables, spices, and Christmas fruits for ten years. She is a widow and lives with her married children, who have helped her since her husband passed away. Her dream is to prosper the lovely gift that her husband left her: her business.
The end of the year holidays are coming up, and people are already asking for green grapes and fresh apples for various activities. Her funds are insufficient, so she needs to take out a loan in order to purchase what she lacks so that she does not disappoint her buyers.

loans.use: to buy grapes for sale.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en: Joselito, 51 years old, is married and has three children. His wife manages a store while he farms rice. Joselito hopes to improve his crop production. He is therefore asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides for crop maintenance. This will help him nourish his crops to give him a fruitful harvest in return. He hopes to repay his loan in full, to continue improving his crop production and to save funds for his family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Yane

texts.en:
Yane is a 54-year-old-widow with four children. Since the death of her husband, Yane is responsible for all her children.

With IDR 600,000, she initiated a kiosk business to meet their living needs and education fees. They have completed their education, have married and are living their own lives.

Now she enjoys her life with the existing business. Due to customer demand, Yane has been thinking of adding more stock such as wheat, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, rice, etc.

A neighbor shared that TLM provides business loans. To make the plan happen, Yane then requested a loan of IDR 2,000,000 from Kiva - TLM.

Yane is grateful that Kiva also supports other entrepreneurs who want to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as  wheat, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, rice, etc.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica es una joven muy esforzada que junto a su familia se dedica a la actividad de cría y engorde de cerdos. Ella solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), para la compra de cerdos de tal forma que le permita aumentar su volumen de inventario y además compra de alimentación para los mismos con el fin de aumentar el peso y rendimiento de cada uno de los animales, logrando así un aumento en los ingresos familiares generados por dicho negocio.
texts.en: Jessica is a very hard-working young woman. She and her family raise pigs. She is requesting a loan of one million fifty thousand colones (₡ 1 050 000) for the purchase of hogs in order to increase her stock. She will also purchase hog feed to increase their weight and profitability. This way, her business will increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy hogs and hog feed.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is 39 years old and operates a tailoring shop in Kisumu, Kenya.

She is the mother of 5 children and her spouse provides the family with additional income. For the last five years, she has also been in business and is doing well.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase clothing materials and the anticipated profit will be used to repay her loan.

She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 40-year-old shopkeeper in Kisumu, Kenya. She is a mother of nine whose spouse provides additional income. For the last three years she has been in this business, doing well.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase stock of retail goods. With the anticipated profit, Lucy will be able to repay her loan.

She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of retail goods

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes.

He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single woman. She has three children.

Joyce operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Joyce will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a single woman. She describes herself to be obedient.

Winnie operates a retail business where she sells bananas, onions, tomatoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Winnie will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 38 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past ten years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from fishing. Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid 19 previous loans from NWTF.

Jennifer is requesting a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
San Miguel de Los Bancos en este Cantón vive el señor Vicente un hombre luchador que trabaja como maestro albañil desde hace más de 10 años mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre; fruto de esta relación tuvieron hijos pero todos mayores de edad e independientes, solicita este crédito para emprender en su propio negocio de producción de pollos broiler cuenta con el espacio suficiente y un galpón para iniciar en esta actividad, su esposa será quien le ayude con el negocio tienen locales listos para hacer las entregas, le dedicarán un promedio de 4 horas diarias, el viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y desde muy niño tuvo que trabajar muy duro para salir adelante y apoyara a su familia. 
Con esta inversión esperan que mejoren sus ingresos económicos para darle un mejor futuro a su esposa, el señor Vicente agradece a KIVA por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de Los Bancos. In this canton lives Vicente, a hard-working man who has been a master bricklayer for over ten years. He has a solid common-law marriage and has children, all grown and independent. He is requesting this loan in order to start his own chicken business. He has sufficient space and quarters for this business. His wife will help him with this business. They have stores ready to take the orders. They will spend about 4 hours a day on the business.
He comes from a family with few resources, and from a young age has had to work very hard to get ahead and support his family.
With this investment, he hopes that his income will increase so he can give his wife a better future. Vincente thanks Kiva for this support and opportunity.

loans.use: to start his chicken business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 46-year-old lady, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has undergone training on enterprise development and financial management.

She rears goats and she is taking out a Kiva loan to buy feed and a dairy goat. This will lead to growth in her enterprise and thus an increase in her income, which will be used to support her family’s basic needs, such as for food and clothing.

Veronica is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to buy feed and a dairy goat.

loans.name: St. Sa'adah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, St. Sa’adah, who is a 40-year-old married woman with two sons. St. Sa’adah is a housewife, and her husband has been a hired employee for two years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a sanitation system at her home to improve access to sanitation and water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but St. Sa’adah will be able to repay the loan received over time.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a sanitation system at her home to improve access to sanitation and water for her family.

loans.name: Muhayokhon

texts.en:
Muhayokhon was born in 1984. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. Muhayokhon works in a state organization. She is an industrious woman and she does her job well.

Muhayokhon now needs financial support because her child is ill and doctors must operate on him. She does not money for this operation. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to pay for the operation of her child. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for a needed operation on her child.

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadoras De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Sonia Elizabeth, de 22 años de edad, casada y madre de una hermosa bebe.  Ella tiene una tienda de consumo diario desde hace 6 años, donde su mayor venta son los granos básicos, como el maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar.  Su sueño es tener una tienda que distribuya por mayor en su colonia y así no salir al pueblo a comprar su producto.  A ella le hacen falta varias cosas en la tienda como jabón por caja, azúcar por fardos, gaseosas por jumbo, enlatadas, desechables grandes y pequeñas, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y necesita invertir de inmediato porque se aproximan las fechas de fin de año que es donde la venta se eleva.  Por tal motivo solicita nuevamente otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta.
texts.en: The representative of the group "Dúo Trabajadoras de Vista Hermosa" is Elizabeth. She is 22 years old, married and the mother of a beautiful baby. She has had a store with basic food items for 6 years. Her biggest sellers are basic grains like corn, rice, beans and sugar. Her dream is to have a store that distributes wholesale in her community and therefore not have to go to the city to buy product. She is short of a number of things in her store like boxes of soap, packaged sugar, jumbo sized soft drinks, canned goods and large and small disposable goods. But the money she has does not cover it and she needs to invest immediately as the festivities towards the end of the year is when her sales increase. For this reason she is requesting another loan to buy what she needs.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Romduol

texts.en: Romduol is an 18-year-old single student who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at a university in the city. She is from Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Her father is a construction worker and her mother is a farmer. Due to the fact that Romduol is short of the money to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year, she would like to secure a loan. With this loan, she will graduate successfully and achieve her dreams. Her future plans after graduation are to find a job with a reasonable salary and be able to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
La socia continua perteneciendo  al banco comunal “SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO".

La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, ella lucha a diario por seguir sus sueños, de tener un restaurante.
La socia Giovana solicito el crédito para comprar quinua, papa y lentejas , para poder ofrecer más diversidad de platos a sus clientes .

La socia está muy contenta con el crédito y agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella, ella se compromete a seguir trabajando duro y pagar a tiempo sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the  “SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO" communal bank.
She continues to work in her food sales business. She works hard daily to follow her dream of having a restaurant.
Giovana is requesting a loan to purchase quinoa, potatoes, and lentils in order to provide more diversity in her dishes.
She is very happy to have this loan and thanks the Kiva investors for continuing to have confidence in her. She promises to continue working hard and repaying her quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, potatoes, and lentils.

loans.name: Phillegona

texts.en:
Phillegona is 52 years old and a mother of six. For the past seven years, she has been a poultry farmer in Kisumu, Kenya, and her business has been doing well. Phillegona’s spouse provides the family with additional income.

Phillegona is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed. This will be her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. Phillegona will use her anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles and has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. 

George will use the 100,000 Kes. loan to buy more stocks of spare auto parts for repairing motor vehicles. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spare auto parts.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
This young man is 27 years old, and his name is Armen. He is not married, and he lives with his parents in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Armen also has two sisters who are married, and they live with their families.

Armen has a higher education and a specialty of electrician. For a long time he was unemployed, but already for two years he has been working in his specialty at the local electrical networks. His father works at a private company, and his mother is a teacher.

Armen asks for this Kiva loan of 1,400,000 Armenian drams since his father now has some health problems that need an urgent solution. This loan will be used to pay for his father’s medical exam at the hospital.

loans.use: to pay for his father’s medical exam at the hospital, since his father now has some health problems that need an urgent solution.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 61 years old and a widow with six children. For the past 15 years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Josefina is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing equipment

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
Marta, de 52 años de edad, es ama de casa, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella solo estudio hasta segundo grado, ella tuvo una vida dura ya que se quedo huerfana de madre y se crio con su abuela; su esposo es agricultor y sus hijos son independientes. 

Marta, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y con los ingresos que genera su esposo sobreviven y cubren sus gastos. 

Marta, necesita el préstamo para pagar mozos para cortar la cosecha de este año, pues tiene sembrados 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
 
Su sueño es, seguir trabajando y asi poder tener una vida digna y llena de logros para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Marta, 52 years old, is a housewife who lives with her husband and her three children. She only studied through second grade. She had a tough life given she lost her mother and was raised by her grandmother.

Her husband is a farmer and her children are independent. Marta takes care of the housework and, with the income that her husband generates, they eke it out and cover their expenses.

Marta needs the loan to pay workers to harvest this year's crop, given she has planted 7,000 square meters of corn. Her dream is to continue working and, that way, be able to have a worthy life full of accomplishments for her and her family.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest this year's crop, given she has planted 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Punda Milia Hope Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Esther. She is 56 years old, married and blessed with six children. She is a member of Punda Milia Hope Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. The group members have undergone training on enterprise and financial management.

Esther operates a grocery store and she is taking out a Kiva loan to add stock, like rice, sugar, flour, salt and other household items, to increase her sales and boost her income. This will improve her living standards and enable her provide better food to her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to add stock to her grocery store, like sugar, salt, rice and other household items.

loans.name: Hassana

texts.en:
Hassana has a passion for working with textiles and making clothes, more specifically dresses. She is 47 years old and works as a tailor from her house which allows her to manage the house work and be productive at the same time.

She lives in the Chouf mountains with her husband, a security officer, and her 18 year old son who just graduated from school.

Hassana learned how to handle textiles and needles when she was very young. She enjoys sewing all types of dresses and sells them to her loyal customers who like her attention to detail as well as the quality of her dresses. She started selling dresses almost ten years ago and now has orders all year long from her regular customers as well as new ones.

Hassana is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva's partner. Ibdaa. She is always working on improving her products, which is why she needs to buy a new sewing machine. The new machine will allow her to make better quality products and sell more dresses, which will improve her income and her ability to support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to make dresses.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy is 45 years old. She is married and has one child. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of beauty products. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, aged 21, is a single farmer living in Kampot province, where her mango-growing business has been running for three years. She is able to save about USD 3 per day to support a living.

Currently, she is a university student who studies with a major in Management. She is now applying for a loan via VisionFund, which is the first time for her, to pay for tuition fees.

She hopes that this loan will enable her to pay for school fees on time. She dreams to have a good job in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees in order to pursue her studies in Management.

loans.name: Zouhour

texts.en:
Zouhour is a 46-year-old single mother from Tripoli. She lives with her 17-year-old daughter and owns a clothes shop for women and children in a busy street of the city.

She initially established her business five years ago but expanded to a new, bigger shop beginning in 2015 as her clients started to increase. The shop has been the source of Zouhour's income since she separated from her husband. It allows her to be entirely financially independent and enables her to provide for her daughter.

Zouhour is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy a collection of winter clothes and shoes for her shop. In fact, she is expecting this collection to have a very good impact on her income before the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes and shoes for her shop

loans.name: Ousama

texts.en:
Ousama, 43 years old, runs a home-based business in Beirut. She lives with her husband and four children, who all go to school. Since her husband, who works in car repairs, and her children are away all day, Ousama decided to start her business in 2007. She sells cosmetic products, creams and perfumes from her house to her customers, who quickly became accustomed to buying their beauty products from her.

Ousama is asking for a first-time loan of 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds from Kiva's partner, Ibdaa. She will be using the loan to buy a series of beauty products that will allow her to increase her sales during the upcoming months as she is expecting an increase in demand. The household's income is unstable, given the nature of her husband's work. Ousama's income is essential in order to provide the children with everything they need on a day-to-day basis.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and increase her sales.

loans.name: Kakakuona Group

texts.en:
Rahel, who is in her late 20s, is single with one school-going child. She has been running two projects, selling fruits and vegetable and selling charcoal, since 2007. She works from 6 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rahel's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her sales of fruits and vegetables and to start selling charcoal as well. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group. She used the profit to pay school fees for her kid, to repay the loan, to pay rent for the shop, to buy a plot of land and to cover household expenses.

Rahel will use this loan to increase her fruit and vegetable and charcoal stock. She dreams of building her own house.

Rahel will share this loan with her loan group Kakakuona, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her fruit and vegetable and charcoal stock.

loans.name: Zeynalabdin

texts.en:
Zeynalabdin is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the city of Fuzuli. He was born in 1959. Zeynalabdin is married and has two children. Zeynalabdin’s eldest son is married, has a child, and lives with his family and parents. His daughter is married too.

Zeynalabdin has been breeding animals for many years, with his wife to help him. His wife produces yogurt, cheese, and cottage cheese to sell and earn additional money. He needs a loan in the amount of 1,750 AZN to buy hay and straw for his animals for the coming winter. He is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy hay and straw for his animals

loans.name: Dúo Bendicion De San Raymundo Group

texts.es: Dúo Bendicion de San Raymundo Las señoras que conforman este dúo son doña Maria del Carmen, quien tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y está casada, ella desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de artículos de consumo diario y concentrado para animales, nos cuenta que está solicitando este crédito para poder ampliar su negocio y el incremento de ventas para el mes de diciembre ya que quiere comprar frutas de temporada y bastantes golosinas, fape la ha ayudado y espera que lo sigua haciendo,desde ya les agradese por su ayuda brindada en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Bendicion de San Raymundo Duo
Maria del Carmen, age 31. She has three children and is married. She has sold basic staples and animal feed for two years. She tells us that she is requesting this loan to expand her business. She hopes it will continue on. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy edible products for sale.

loans.name: Clorinda Matto De Turner Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Grimaneza, la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera poder obtener más ganancias con su negocio para así de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo productos de  primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar aceite, gaseosas, golosinas entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de jugos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER” communal bank in the district of Calca,  Calca province, Cusco department.
Grimaneza continues with her grocery business. She is an enterprising woman who hopes to be able to obtain more income with her business in order to continue supporting her family. She continues to sell basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk and oil to whoever requests these items. This is how she supports her family.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of oil, pop, candy, and other items.
The other members have businesses selling juice, clothing, and groceries. One has a restaurant.
The members are thankful for this loan and promise to repay their quotas as established.
The members pictured in the inserted photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy oil, pop, candy, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Odalia

texts.es:
La señora  María de 52 años de edad, es casada y  vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación,  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas sus clientes son todas las personas de su comunidad y también se dedica a la elaboración de pan.
Doña María se dedica a su negocio desde hace 6 años este es su cuarto crédito que  solicitando y lo necesita para la compra de leña, maíz y cal para tener la materia prima necesaria poder seguir elaborando su producto, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante y poder hacer crecer su negocio.
Doña María su sueño es   tener una  empresa de tortillas.

San Lorenzo,  Honduras -  Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
María, age 52, is married and lives with her husband in their own home. She makes and sells tortillas. Everyone in her community is a client. She also makes bread.
María has had this business for six years. this is her fourth loan. She will use it to purchase firewood, corn, and lime in order to have basic materials to make her product. She hopes that this investment will allow her to get ahead and make her business grow.
Her dream is to have a tortilla business.

San Lorenzo,  Honduras -  October 2015

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La socia continúa perteneciendo al  banco comunal “SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”.
La socia Serafina continúa dedicándose a sus dos actividades, a la crianza de animales y a la venta de maíz. Sus ganas de salir adelante hacen que ella trabaje arduamente todos los días y quiera progresar.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar alfalfa y maíz


La socia está contenta y satisfecha por el crédito y agrádese laos inversionista de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella. Promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
The member continues to belong to the "SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO” communal bank.
Serafina continues to work in her businesses, raising animals and selling corn. Her desire to get ahead makes her work hard every day. She wants to progress. She requested this loan for the purchase of alfalfa and corn.
She is happy and satisfied to have this loan and thanks the Kiva investors for continuing to have confidence in her. She promises to repay her quotas punctually.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa and corn.

loans.name: Juan Aguirre

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Juan  es albañil y sigue trabajando  en forma independiente, él socio es una persona responsable el socio espera poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas para su trabajo como combo entre otros.
texts.en:
the member belongs to the “LOS SOLIDARIOS” communal bank, located in the district of Urubamba, Urubamba province, Cusco department.
Juan is a bricklayer and continues to work for himself. He is a responsible person and hopes to continue working and supporting his family.
He is grateful for this loan and promises to repay his quotas. This is how he supports his family.
He is requesting this loan to purchase tools for his work such as a sledgehammer.

loans.use: to buy tools such as a sledge hammer.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is a hardworking woman who earns a living selling fish. Her work is done peddling around selling to neighbors and locals on the streets of her town. Her husband is a fisherman. She has had her own home for many years now, and she is happy to have her own, welcoming place in which to live.

Melchora wants to improve her means of living, but she also wants to keep selling fish. This is why she is asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase paint for pump boat repainting. This will improve the ease of transporting her husband's catch. Thus, it will provide comfort and safety as she continues handling her livelihood activity.

With her previous loan, Melchora managed to invest in necessary fishing paraphernalia, for which she is very grateful. She is hoping that someday, she will become successful and have other sources of income as well.

loans.use: to purchase paint for her pump boat.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 32 years old and he lives with his pretty family in the city of Yerevan. Gevorg is married and he has two cheerful boys. His wife is a very artistic person; her specialty is as a musician and jazz singer but she is temporarily unemployed, being busy with her children's care.

Gevorg graduated from the Veterinary Faculty of the Yerevan State Agricultural Institute. He mentions his great love of pets. Since his graduation until now, Gevorg works at his specialty with great pleasure and care. He works at a veterinary clinic, where he enjoys his everyday work with pets, be it dogs, cats, fish, birds or even turtles. Gevorg even shares with all of you his dream of having his own nursery for animals, where he will care and heal all the animals that will need his help. Gevorg also teaches his two sons to love and care for animals and even has pets in his flat.

Gevorg has some health problems which he wants to take care of but lack of finances makes him upset. He has asked for this loan in order to solve his health problem so he can work as actively and devotedly as he usually likes to do.

loans.use: to solve his health problem so he can work as actively and devotedly as he usually likes to do.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a 35-year-old married man from Calape, Bohol. He has four children who are 14, 11, 8 and 1 years old. He supports them through driving his motorcycle and growing rice. He has earned an income for 15 years to help provide for the family's daily needs.

Allan will use the loan to maintain his motorcycle and buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and chemicals for insects that may ruin the growth of their plants. Allan is hoping for bountiful harvest for his family. He also wants to improve his livelihood to increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, rice seeds, fertilizer, and chemicals.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This nice lady’s name is Aida. She lives in Ijevan city of the Tavush region and is married with a big family. Aida lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and her four grandchildren. She and all of her family members are employed except her daughter-in-law who takes care of her children and their house. Aida is worried and she mentions that this is because of her husband’s health state. He needs an urgent and full medical examination and also a course of medical treatment.

Aida is requesting a 1,450,000 AMD loan to finance her husband’s medical examination and treatment course at the hospital. She hopes that she will receive support from Kiva lenders to find the solution to her husband’s health problems.

loans.use: to finance her husband’s medical examination and treatment course at the hospital

loans.name: Kithuluni Farmers Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Jenifer. She is 45 years old, married and has 6 children. She is a Member of Kithulini Farmers group which joined Hand in Hand in 2014 and have benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

She operates a green grocer and she is applying for a second Kiva loan to boost her enterprise by buying more stock like potatoes and tomatoes. This will increase her income and she will be able to pay the education fees for her children.

She appreciates Kiva and its lenders for the help and support and she promises to repay her loan well.

loans.use: to boost her grocery stock by buying things like tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Kura

texts.en:
Kura is a widowed woman with ten children, two attend school. They live at their own house without electricity and running water.

She has operated a home-based fish selling business for over four years to sell to restaurant operators and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of perishability leading to losses.

She wants to purchase bundles of fish and dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Dicipline Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Teshie-bukoshie and runs a general store. She is married with two children, and her dream is to educate them. Elizabeth established her business in 2009 so that she could earn a living. She also distributes rice to supplement her income. Elizabeth’s major business challenge is that her business is seasonal.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy more rice, gari, canned foods, soft drinks, and charcoal to increase her stock. She is the group leader of the Discipline Group, which has two members.

loans.use: to buy rice, gari, canned foods, soft drinks, and charcoal

loans.name: Akhter

texts.en:
Akhter is a hard-working lady. She is a 40-year-old married woman.

She initiated her business selling milk as it was difficult to run household activities with the small income of her husband (also shown in the photo). She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Akhter’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Akhter has requested 55,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Rina Gladys

texts.es: Con 45 años de edad Rina vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de sus hijos de 14 y 20 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que en busca de poder darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos se dedica a la confección de ropa, obteniendo de esta manera los ingresos económicos necesarios para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia. Además posee una pequeña tienda en la cual ofrece distintos artículos básicos del hogar. Rina en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tela, hilos, ganchos, alfileres, y productos básicos para poder surtir su tienda y tener más material para la confección de ropa y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos. Y así también se encuentra muy agradecida con el crédito anterior, ya que gracias a ello ha podido sostener sus negocios y a la vez la economía de su familia.
texts.en: At the age of 45, Rina lives with her partner and two children ages 14 and 20. She is a hard-working woman, and responsible. She seeks to provide her children with everything necessary. She makes clothing, which provides the necessary income to satisfy her family's basic needs. She also has a small store where she sells basic household items. Rina wants to improve her quality of life and is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in thread, fabric, clasps, pins, and basic items for her store in order to stock her store and have more material for making clothing. This way, she will increase her income. She is very grateful for her previous loan. Thanks to it, she was able to sustain her businesses and support her family.

loans.use: to invest in thread, fabric, clasps, pins, and basic items for her shop.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
La socia Giovanna continua dedicándose a trabajar en una  empresa privada, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se dedica a la  elaboración de artesanía como pintura, decorativos, utilitarios, joyería, murales, esculturas y entre otros en su trabajo, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante su trabajo poder continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia Giovanna solicita el crédito para la compra de bienes de consumo entre otras cosas mas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Giovanna continues to work in a private company. She has been doing this work for quite some time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into her work each day. She works making handicrafts like paintings, decorations, utensils, jewellery, murals and sculptures amongst others in her work. She is an enterprising woman who hopes through her work to continue to support her family

Giovanna is requesting the loan to buy consumer goods amongst others.

The member feels grateful for the awarded loan and promises to comply with the established installments.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods amongst others.

loans.name: Dúo Fe En Cristo Group

texts.es: Dúo Fe en Cristo Doña Ana María tiene 58 años de edad es casada tiene 6 hijos ya mayores de edad su negocio es de tortillería ella quiere invertir su crédito en comprar maíz, leña, canastos, aplastadoras, cal, y unas mesas nuevas. Ella inicio su proyecto cuando tenía 20 años de edad vendiendo tortillas por menor  pero poco a poco fue creciendo hasta poner su tortillería ella trabaja con su hija, sus clientes son personas vecinas, y comedores cercanos, sus metas son mejorar la calidad de vida, alimentar la producción, ofrecer variedad de productos, mejorar los ingresos económicos, fortalecer el negocio, y poder ayudar a su esposos a pagar los gastos de su casa. Ha tenido 1 crédito con fape que le ayudo a crecer su negocio es por ello que agradece a fape la ayuda brindada, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas para la venta.
texts.en:
Dúo Fe en Cristo ["Faith in Christ Duo"]

 Ana María is 58, married, and has 6 grown children. She sells tortillas and wants to invest this loan in the purchase of corn, firewood, baskets, mills, lime, and new tables. She started her business when she was 20, selling tortillas wholesale. Bit by bit her business grew until she was able to open her own store. She works with her daughter. Her clients are her neighbours, as well as nearby restaurants. Her goals are to improve her quality of life, increase production, offer a variety of products, improve her income, strengthen her business, and help her husband to pay the household costs. She has had one previous loan with Fape, which helped her to expand her business. She is grateful for this help, and is requesting this loan for the purchase of corn to make tortillas for sale.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman in her late 40's with four children, two attend school. She has run a grocery store and charcoal business for fifteen years. She works from 6 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sauda's 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase charcoal stock and to start a grocery store. She has managed to successfully repay her loan. She is happy with the loan and used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, buy a plot of land, pay shop rent, build a house, and buy several items (a TV set, a radio, a fridge, sofa set, cupboards, beds, mattress, household expenses). She will use this loan to buy drinks and charcoal. She dreams of owning a salon.

Sauda will be accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks  and charcoal.

loans.name: Narciza Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa una mujer luchadora de 58 años es madrede 4 hijos los cuales son independientes , tiene su negocio en un pequeño Recinto llamado San Bernabé el mismo que está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos .
La señora Narcisa tiene una pequeña farmacia en el sector, y ahora desea emprender en un local su bazar y bisutería, cuenta con el espacio necesario también se encuentra sacando los permisos respectivos para iniciar en este negocio cuenta con la experiencia necesaria ya que sabe donde comprar al por mayor la mercadería a este negocio le dedicará un promedio de 8 horas diarias junto con su botiquín.  
La señora Narcisa agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a hard-working woman of 58 years. She has four independent children. Her business is located in a small neighbourhood called San Bernabé, in the northeast of the province of Pichincha, in the Canton of San Miguel de los Bancos.
Narcisa has a small pharmacy. She now wants to start a jewellery and general store. She has the space necessary and is getting the required permits to start this business. She has the necessary experience as she already knows where to buy the merchandise wholesale. She will spend an average of 8 hours per day on her business, as well as her pharmacy.
Narcisa thanks Kiva for this support and opportunity.

loans.use: to start a general store.

loans.name: Abdul Hameed

texts.en:
Abdul Hameed is a 46-year-old competent and hard working person who serves his neglected community. He is trying his best to fulfill his teaching career, but faces many challenges. Abdul Hameed said that he has no other source of funding and the school is not yet profitable School and household expenses become terrible to manage. He started a school 18 years ago with a low number of enrolled students; a majority students were getting free education. There are now 103 students enrolled in which 50 % are female.

Abdul Hameed requested for Rs. 60,000/- for a computer lab and furniture. He said that he has plans to teach computer skills from nursery to metric students. He believes that computer education is very important for the children. He also shared that he will offer free short courses to the youth and other children as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer  and furniture.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto Aquiles

texts.es:
José, de 63 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador y responsable, está casado, vive con su esposa y tiene 5 hijos, pero todos ya son adultos y tiene sus propias familias. 

José, trabaja como agricultor y cultiva maíz y frijol en su terreno, pero aparte de eso también tiene una granja de 200 gallinas ponedoras, estas gallinas están próximas a poner huevos y en dos semanas comenzaran a poner. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar pollos de engorde para poder comercializarlos en Diciembre, ya que el pollo se vende mucho en esta época. 

Su sueño con poder seguir trabajando para poder tener una granja más grande con pollos y gallinas.
texts.en:
José, 63 years of age, is a very hard working and responsible gentleman. He is married, lives with his wife and has 5 children, but they are all adults already and have their own families.

José works in agriculture and plants corn and beans in his land but, apart from that, he also has a farm of 200 laying hens. These hens are close to laying eggs, and will start doing so in two weeks.

Jose needs the loan to buy broiler chickens to be able to commercialize them in December, given that chicken sells much during this time of year.

His dream is to be able to continue working to have a bigger farm with chickens and hens.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens to be able to commercialize them in December.

loans.name: Shumile

texts.en:
Shumile is a 33-year-old single woman who has run her school for the last fourteen years. There are 148 students in her school, with more than 48% being female. Shumile wants her school to be child-centered and to create a child-friendly environment that will make students and parents happy.

Shumile requires PKR 140,000 to buy furniture to enable her to create a comfortable environment. Shumile says, “There are many challenges in each journey but once you decide to achieve your goal then no challenge remains as a challenge."

loans.use: to buy furniture to create a comfortable environment for her students.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Mrs. Nang is 59 years old, married and has three children. She has been raising hogs for almost 15 years. This is her main source of income. Aside from raising hogs, she grows and sells chickens.

She is in need of capital to support her livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and additional pigs. With these, she could maximize the resources available and improve both sources of income.

She dreams of handling both sources of income successfully in order to continue to support the education of her children, so they can have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and additional pigs.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán de 63 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y junto a sus 3 hijos mayores de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador y responsable que se gana la vida gracias a que labora en una finca, labor que le permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. La vivienda en la que reside Hernán y su familia es humilde, la cual ha sido construida con madera y láminas, en la que no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cables eléctricos, poliducto, caja térmica y demás materiales necesarios para la instalación del servicio de energía eléctrica, mejorando considerablemente su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Hernán is 63 years old. He lives in his own house with his life companion and his 3 grown-up children. He is a responsible and hard-working man who makes a living thanks to his work on a farm. This labor allows him to obtain the income needed to satisfy the basic needs of his family.

The house that Hernán and his family live in is humble. it is constructed out of wood and laminate sheeting. It does not have electricity so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cables, tubing, a breaker box and other materials needed to install electricity. This will improve his style of living considerably.

loans.use: to invest in cables, tubing, a breaker box and other materials needed to install electricity.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a 35-year-old married man with two children. He joined Hand In Hand and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management trainings.

Shadrack operates a motorbike, and he is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike so as to improve on efficiency, hence gaining more customers and increased income. He says he will use the income to provide for his family’s basic needs such as food and education fees.

Shadrack is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support and promises to repay his loan in good time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike and improve on efficiency, hence enabling more income to support his family's basic needs such as food and education fees for his children.

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
Bernaditha is 37 years old and married with 5 children, all in school. Bernaditha and her husband operate their own hardware and construction store. She and her husband were helpers in a construction company until they were both laid off. Aware that they needed to support their children and their expenses, they decided to sell cement and sand using their last salary. They delivered the cement and sand to their customers themselves, oblivious to the backbreaking lifting of heavy materials, until such time that their hard work earned them more customers and they were able to hire a helper. 

As of today, Bernaditha has 5 helpers with their own families to support and who depend on their wages. Bernaditha also helps her helpers by giving them an emergency allowance and health insurance. Bernaditha's construction store is her bread and butter, and although she wants to expand her business, construction supplies are expensive and she has no additional capital to supply all the demands of her customers.

Bernaditha is requesting a loan of PhP 150,000 to buy cement, sand, rock, pipes, steel and other construction supplies. She is very optimistic that with the loan they will be able to expand and have more construction supplies to deliver to her customers.

Bernaditha wants to see all her children finish their schooling, and more than that, she wants to help her neighbors have an opportunity to earn for their families' basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rock, pipes, steel and other construction supplies to deliver to her customers.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 46 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy pigs, feeds, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elsie has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from egg retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feeds, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Laázarus

texts.en:
Laázarus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Laázarus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Laázarus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Laázarus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Laázarus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Laázarus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Emmanuel has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric ton of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Emmanuel can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Emmanuel is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer from Masama village. As a Babban Gona member, Sule is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sule would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Sule can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37 percent higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sule no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare of land, Sule hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Cicilia is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing her dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Cicilia would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Cicilia can store her maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Cicilia has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Cicilia is thankful that she no longer has to worry about having no money to increase her farmland and looks forward to using her additional earnings to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén de 53 años de edad reside en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 8 y 14 años de edad. Él es un padre responsable quien para poder conseguir el pan de cada día de su familia labora en una empresa cerca de su comunidad, labor que le permite satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. Rubén vive de forma humilde en una vivienda la cual ha sido construida con madera y con el paso de los años se ha deteriorado. Y es por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: laminas y clavos para mejorar las paredes de su hogar y de esta forma ofrecerle una mejor forma de vida a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: 53-year-old Rubén resides in his own house with his life partner and his children, who are 8 and 14 years old. He is a responsible father who in order to be able to obtain daily bread for his family works in a business close to his community. This work has allowed him to satisfy the basic needs of his family. Rubén lives in a humble manner in a house which has been constructed with wood, and with the passage of time it has deteriorated. It is for this that he requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheets and nails to improve the walls of his house, and in this way to offer a better quality of life for his loved ones.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets and nails to upgrade the walls of his house.

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es: Sandra de 34 años de edad vive al lado de sus hijas de 4, 10 y 13 años de edad. Ella es madre soltera quien lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijas y para ello presta sus servicios en una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad. Sandra habita en una vivienda humilde que ha sido construida con láminas las cuales se encuentran en mal estado y esto genera que en la época de lluvia se filtre el agua, y también genera temor en ella por posibles enfermedades que puedan adquirir sus hijas. Y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos y pago de mano de obra para reparar su vivienda. De esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y las de sus hijas.
texts.en: 34-year-old Sandra lives with her daughters, who are 4, 10, and 13 years old. She is a single mother who fights to move her daughters ahead, for this she lends her services to a business which is located close to her community. Sandra lives in a humble house which has been constructed with metal sheets, which are now in a bad state, and during the rainy season has led to water seeping in. This also led to her fear of possible sicknesses that her daughters could get. For this, she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, nails, and labor costs to repair her house. In this way, she can improve her quality of life and that of her daughters.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, nails, and labor costs to repair her house.

loans.name: Ana Esperanza

texts.es:
Ana, de 51 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, está casada y vive con sus tres hijos en su casa, dos de sus hijos estudian y la mayor ya tiene una bebé de 3 años y viven con ella. 

Ana, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y verduras en su casa, ella tiene una pequeña tienda con la cual genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar, pero también se dedica a vender platillos típicos todas las tardes en la puerta de su casa y además vende los días domingo cuando hay partidos de futbol y en su casa tiene un molino. 

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como rinso, azúcar, café, arroz, consomes y algunas golosinas.
 
Los sueños de Ana, son poder continuar trabajando y mejorar su condicion de vida y la de su familia, asi como también mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, 51 years old, is a very hard working woman and a born fighter. She is married and lives in her house with three children. Two of her children are studying and her oldest daughter already has a three year old baby girl, and they live with her.

Ana makes a living selling essential products and vegetables in her house. She has a small shop through which she generates income to cover her household expenses. But she also makes a living selling traditional dishes every evening in front of her house, and she also sells on Sundays when there are soccer games. In her house she has a mill.

Ana needs the loan to buy essential products like rinso (laundry detergent), sugar, coffee, rice, soups and some sweets.

Ana's dreams are to be able to continue working and improve hers and her family's living situation, as well as her house.

loans.use: to buy essential products such as rinso (laundry detergent), sugar, coffee, rice, soups and some sweets.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Musa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric ton of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Musa can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Musa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Musa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en: Like it is for many women, it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Shaista to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Shaista is a married woman and a mother of three children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Aliyu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Aliyu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37 percent higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Aliyu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to USD 2,000 per hectare of land.

Aliyu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en:
Yunusa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yunusa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yunusa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yunusa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Yunusa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yunusa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zuleyma Elizabeth

texts.es: Zuleyma de 32 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo de 12 años quien es el único que le brinda compañía. Ella es madre soltera y para poder cubrir las necesidades de su hijo presta sus servicios como ordenanza en una institución pública que se encuentra cerca de su hogar. Gracias a esto puede ganarse el pan de cada día y también darle el estudio a su hijo. La vivienda en la que habita Zuleyma es humilde y ha sido construida con madera, y esta con el paso del tiempo se ha deteriorado y hace crecer la inseguridad en su hogar. Es por esto que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, clavos, madera y pago de mano de obra para la reparación de su hogar, y de esta manera ofrecerle una mejor forma de vida a su hijo.
texts.en: 32-year-old Zuleyma lives with her 12-year-old son, who is the only one who keeps her company. She is a single mother, and to be able to cover the necessities of her son, lends her services as an orderly in a public institution located close to her house. Thanks to that, she is able to earn her daily bread, and also allow her son to study. The house that Zuleyma inhabits is humble, and has been constructed with wood. With the passage of time, it has deteriorated and has increased the insecurity of her house. It is for this that she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, nails, wood, and labor costs for the reparation of her house, and in this way she will offer a better quality of life to her son.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, nails, wood and labor costs for the reparation of her home.

loans.name: Avetiq

texts.en:
Avetiq started a transportation business five years ago.

Using his own truck he receives different orders for his transportation service. Most frequently he transports fruits and vegetables and home supplies to local markets.

Avetiq, his wife, and their two minor children live in Gyumri town.

He asks for this loan to purchase four tires for the winter season and pay for partial renovation of the truck to continue his transportation service, as well as to gather income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for four tires for the winter season and partial renovation of the truck to continue his transportation service, as well as to gather income for the family.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en:
Jannette is a wife with four children between the ages of 3 and 14. She is from Valencia, Bohol. She owns a small sari-sari store where she sells various items to support her children. Grocery items like canned food, noodles, chips, cooking oil, shampoo, and bath soap are available in her store. This has been her business for seven years now. She is asking for a loan to add inventory of soft drinks, food, cigarettes, pens, canned goods, and chips.

Jannette hopes to expand her business so she can make her family's life better.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, food, cigarettes, pens, canned goods, and chips.

loans.name: Khadim Hussain

texts.en: Khadim Hussain, a 33-year-old man, has been running a school since 2008. He has succeeded in his mission of providing education to children in need despite initial hardships. He is proud of the quality of education in his school, which is better than schools charging much higher fees than his. There are 477 students being taught, 40% of whom are female students. He requires PKR 100,000 to help make improvements to his school building and to buy furniture to provide a conducive environment for his children.

loans.use: to make improvements to his school building and to buy furniture to provide a conducive environment for his children.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is 53-year-old married woman. Her son (also shown in the photo) has been running a small shop successfully for many years. He sells various items such as calling cards, mobile accessories, and chargers. To improve her son's business, currently Shahnaz has applied for a murabaha loan of 25000 PKR  to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries. With the help of this loan, he can meet the increasing demands of his clients and generate more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries to sell.

loans.name: Aneesa

texts.en:
Increasing expenses compelled Aneesa to start her own business selling animals. She is a 38-year-old, married woman doing business with the help of her husband of many years.
