Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She works very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase baby goats and calves

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 29 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 4 children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Rita is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her father to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her daughter to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Rita is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase inventory for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 32-years-old, married woman. Her husband (the man shown with her above) operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. Asma's husband is responsible for building the roofs of houses during their construction. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family. However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. For the growth of her husband's business, Asma has requested a murabaha-type loan of 45000 PKR. This will allow him to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so he can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so her husband can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 44 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

Therefore Razia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Razia is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a maize farmer from Duna village. As a Babban Gona member, Victoria is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Victoria would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Victoria can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Victoria no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Victoria hopes to realize better yields. She plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shehu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Shehu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Shehu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Thabet

texts.en: Thabet is a 27-year-old, single man from Atteal, Tulkarem city. He lives with his family in a small, old house and is the supporter for his family, who depends on him for everything. Thabet has a medical Center. It is the only center of its kind in the region. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of the latest conflict.Thabet took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to Buy a new imaging machine for his laboratory. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his efficiency and speed and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: Buy a new imaging machine for his laboratory

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Maria Teresa continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios”.
La socia sigue  elaborando  cuadros de pintura,  la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas al oleo, pinceles entre otros.
texts.en: The member Maria Teresa continues as part of the communal bank "Los Solidarios". She continues to produce paintings, and has been carrying out her work for a long time, which has gone well thanks to the effort she puts each day into her business. She feels grateful for the loan and commits herself to fulfill her share of payments. She is an enterprising woman who wishes to obtain more earnings in her business to be able to continue supporting her family in this way. She requests the loan to buy old paints and paintbrushes, among other things.

loans.use: to buy oil paints and paintbrushes, among other things.

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en: Dioscoro, 51 years old, is a married man with seven children; one adult and six-school aged children. They live in a municipality of Clarin in Bohol, Philippines. Ten years ago, this man started his vegetable gardening business. Aside from this, he also owns a farm where he grows rice plants.  It is very important for him that this business can last in time because it is the financial support for his family. With this, he is asking for a loan to buy vegetable seeds (specifically eggplant), medicines and fertilizer to enhance the growth of his plants. Dioscoro wants to improve his business in the future so he could give good education to his children. He wants them to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (specifically eggplant), medicines and fertilizer

loans.name: Vidaliana

texts.en:
Vidaliana is 54 years old from the community of Valencia, Bohol. She lives in a place with ample space to do business like hog raising. She also cultivate a farm where she grow rice. This is her business for six years now. The usual profit of PHP3000 allow her to finance the schooling of her youngest child who is 17 years old.

She is asking a loan to buy feed, piglets and fertilizer. Vidaliana hope that she can expect a better harvest once her farming needs are taken cared of like fertilizer. The feed will also impact on good health for her hogs, thus increase her chance to negotiate in selling them in four months time. She believes that with the help of the loan, her profitability will increase as well.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Phillis is 39 years old. She is married to Peter who is also a farmer, and they are blessed with six children between the ages of 1 to 20. 
She has had a farming business for 24 years, currently earning monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Phillis has borrowed KES 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya, after repaying the previous loan successfully and will use it to purchase farm inputs.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan as well as support her family. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well-established farming business and enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
A young student, 18, Sarorn is living in a bedroom house in Kompot province and he is studying English at the University. To make a living, he has helped his mother to grow rice and feed pigs to sell as the main source of income.

For this year, he lacks the capital to support his studies so he decided to get a loan with VisionFund and this is the first time for him. He is going to manage this loan to pay for school fees and buy school material. He hopes to be graduated and be able to get a good job in order to better support his family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and buy school material.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 55 years old married woman shown in the photo with her husband. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education.

Yasmeen is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Naeeda

texts.en:
It was hard for Naeeda to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband(also shown in the photo). Naeeda is 43 years old, a married woman and mother of 5 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of 20000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Naeeda has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Tsui Shitoo Group

texts.en:
Tsuishitoo means “be patient.” These women believe that all the roads that lead to success have to pass through patient highway at some point.

One member of the group, Mary, is a 45-year-old business lady who is very ambitious. She produce cooking oil and sells rice at the market place. Although she has a certificate in marketing, due to economic constraints in Ghana, she has struggled to find formal work, so she has decided to earn a living from working on her own using her skills that she acquired from marketing classes.

Her husband has been unemployed for ten years; this has forced her to become the family’s breadwinner. She has one school-going child who heavily depend on her. Although her husband gets small jobs here and there, the income is not sustainable. This is the reason why Mary and her other two friends joined ID-Ghana in August 2015. With a loan from ID-Ghana, the hardworking women can further grow their businesses and improve their financial literacy through ID-Ghana trainings.

Mary is planning to use her loan to boost her business through restocking a larger quantity of rice and cooking oil, as well as extending marketing skills for more income.

loans.use: to boost her business through restocking a larger quantity of rice and cooking oil, as well as extending marketing skills for more income. .

loans.name: Mafkura

texts.en: Mafkura, 38, is a refugee from the Bilasuvar region of Azerbaijan.  Her family is large. She is married with a son and two daughters. She is a very hardworking, diligent lady who is trying to earn enough income. Curently she is a shopkeeper. She sells small home supplies, and household items in her shop. In this way she takes care of her family's needs. Mafkura is very energetic and passionate about her job. There are many people in the local market who respect her for her dedication, honesty and right principles in doing business. She has a small shop where she sells the merchandise. Some of the sellers aren't doing goods because they overprice their goods, but Mafkura is very careful and caring toward her client base.That's why people like buying from Mafkura. She is well known and does a great job in meeting her customers' needs. Mafkura is planning to expand her business, due to a growing demand for new home supplies, replacing needs for the old ones by the clients she is planning to expand. Mafkura needs a loan of 1,900 Azerbaijani New Manats to buy new merchandise. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her shop like common household supplies

loans.name: Julia Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Julia continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de adornos, aretes y collares, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar aretes, collares entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Julia, continues working in the business of making decorations, earrings and necklaces, the member has a good time with her business which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day, the member continues selling the merchandise that her customers request, the member is happy for about the loan y promises to make her payments, the partner wishes to be able to continue working in this way so she can continue supporting her family. 
She is requesting a loan to buy earrings, necklaces, among other items.

loans.use: To buy earrings, necklaces, among other items.

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana is 22 years old. She is refugee living in a refugee settlement, which was built for people who lost their homes due to the war. She is living with her family, which consists of father, mother and two sisters.Parvana is a farmer. She raises cows and sheep. She raises them for meat purposes, but she also uses their milk for household needs. She has been doing this work for five years. She has also watched her parents doing this activity since her childhood. She has gained very good experience. She knows the details of her job. This is helping her, but the most important factor in her being a successful young farmer is her passion and joy. She loves her job, and she likes to take good care of her animals.

Parvana usually fattens her animals and then sells their meat at the local bazaar. People like to buy from Parvana because she is trustworthy and brings very good, fresh, natural meat to the market.Also, there is increasing demand. Azeri people consume meat a lot. To meet the demand, she is planning to expand. Parvana wants to expand her business .She requires 2,000 AZN to buy three calves . She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Senecia

texts.en:
At 64 years old, Senecia is not showing signs of slowing down. She still works hard raising hogs and farming vegetables like taro and string beans in the community of Valencia in the province of Bohol. This business of hers started 25 years ago when her children were still young.

Senecia is asking for a loan to finance her business needs. She will use it to buy fertilizer for her vegetables and feed for her hogs.

Senecia dreams of expanding her vegetable garden so that she can grow more crops and earn better. Her income will be used to buy nutritious food and for savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 48 years old, married to Christopher and blessed with six children aged between 29 and eight years old.

She has been into the dairy, milk and maize business for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 17,000.

This being her first loan with VFK, she intends to buy more maize, milk and dairy feed for resale in her village.

With the anticipated profits she plans to help her husband in paying school fees for their children from the expanded business.

loans.use: to buy more maize, milk and dairy feed for resale in her village

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick used the previous loan to repair his motorcycle which had problems due to bad roads. He is a motorcyclist and a farmer where he works for 12 hours a day and has been in this business of farming for 12 years now.

However, hardships of heavy rains that make roads impassible are a hindrance to his motorcycle business as they increase mechanical problems. Patrick has asked for a loan to help him make a final payment for the motorcycle that he is using.

He is thankful to Kiva and Kiva lenders who lent their support that allowed him to successfully develop himself. Patrick is looking at building rentals in the future where he can fetch more income for his family. Remember Patrick has been using a motorcycle that he acquired on credit and now wishes to make the final payment such that he becomes the true owner of the motorcycle.

loans.use: to make a final payment for the motorcycle that he is using.

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en:
Ishaku is a maize farmer from Jalawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Ishaku is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Ishaku can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ishaku no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Ishaku hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 40 year old ambitious school owner who started a community school in the year 2012 with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). Her aim is to contribute to the literacy rate of his community and make education available to more students than are currently enrolled in schools. There are 147 students in his school more than 64% out of which are females. Currently she has requested for a loan worth Rs 70,000 to purchase electrical water cooler and generator. She says, “This will not only help her improve school building but also provide comfortable environment to her students.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical water cooler and generator.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Ayuba is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Ayuba can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ayuba has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Ayuba is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to provide healthcare for his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Bitrus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Bitrus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Joshua has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Joshua would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Joshua can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Joshua will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Joshua is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dinatu

texts.en:
Dinatu is a maize farmer from Dan'asabe village. As a Babban Gona member, Dinatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tons of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dinatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dinatu can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dinatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Dinatu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hyssop Group

texts.en:
Blessing resides in Waterfalls, Harare. She is a lady aged 45 and mother to three children all of whom are in full-time education. She is the default household head and breadwinner because her husband deserted the family in 2007.

Blessing started her trade in 2005 and now she is running a barber shop from home and a retail shop in a developing suburb in Harare. With time there were was a lot of competition in the groceries business and this meant that she was realising little income. The shrewd entrepreneur in her encouraged her to diversify her operations. She started selling hardware, kitchenware, baby-wear, stationery and other small items that increase her stock turnover.

Loss of customers due to shortages of stock was her major challenge. In addition, Blessing did not have adequate finance to boost her business despite the opportunity for growth. She teamed up with her friends in the local catchment area and who had the same challenges in business and joined Thrive Microfinance. They named themselves Hyssop. These four entrepreneurs went through the training at Thrive and increased their knowledge of business. They learned how to grow their businesses through borrowing and to increase their clientele base.
They received a total group loan of $1500 (One thousand five hundred United States dollars). Blessing intends to meet the demand for her customers by restocking more products. She also foresees an increased demand during the festive season. Higher rate of stock turnover will also assist her in taking care of the family which entirely depends on her.

loans.use: to increase her stock of household products in time for Christmas.

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es: Don Juan de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de medicina popular y adicional a eso tambien se dedica a la pesca artesanal, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas medicina popular para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He works selling popular medicine and also works in small scale fishing. With his profits he manages to pay some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy more popular medicine to be able to continue with his sales and thus have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy more popular medicine.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es: Norberta de 65 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en junto a su esposo y su nieto de 21 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida gracias a que desde pequeña le enseñaron como criar pollos y hoy en día es el negocio con el que genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a su familia y brindando lo necesario para su hogar. Norberta desea invertir en alimento, laminas, madera, clavos, lo que le permitiría mejorar los corrales lo que le permitirá tener un mejor ambiente de desarrollo para sus pollos y así poder ofrecer animales saludables a sus numerosos clientes y generar mayores ingresos económicos con los cuales poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: laminas, madera, clavos, alimento. Para realizar mejoramiento de corrales donde tiene la crianza de pollos.
texts.en: Norberta is 65 years old, and lives in her own home with her husband and her 21-year-old granddaughter. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living raising chickens, which is an activity that she was taught at a very young age. With the income from this business she has been able to raise her family and provide the necessities for her household. Norberta would like to invest in feed, as well as sheet metal, wood, and nails with which to improve her pens in order to provide a better environment for her chickens. This will allow her to provide healthy animals to her numerous customers, and thereby earn more income and provide a better quality of life for her family. For this reason she is requesting a loan through FUSAI, to invest in sheet metal, wood, and nails, to improve the pens where she raises chickens, and chicken feed.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, wood, and nails, to improve the pens where she raises chickens, and chicken feed.

loans.name: Wilfredo Balmore

texts.es: Wilfredo de 29 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su madre, abuelo, 1 hermana de 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que brinda sus servicios como empleado en alcaldía municipal de su comunidad además se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas siendo así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su familia, además recibe el apoyo con algunos gastos de parte de sus hermanas. Wilfredo desea invertir en su negocio comprando semillas, abono, fertilizante, además realizar algunas reparaciones a su vivienda como repellar algunas paredes y reparar goteras en el techo, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: semillas, abono, fertilizantes, laminas, tornillos, cemento, etc., para mejorar la calidad de sus hortalizas y poder ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes permitiéndo generar más ingresos económicos  y brindar mayor  comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 29 and lives in his own home with his mother, grandfather, and six-year-old sister. He is a hardworking man who has a job at the local City Hall in his community, and he also works growing vegetables. This allows him to make enough income to provide for his family. His sisters also help him cover some expenses.

Wilfredo wants to invest in his business by purchasing seeds and fertilizer. He also wants to make some home repairs by plastering several walls and fixing leaks in the ceiling. For these reasons, he is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy the seeds and fertilizer, as well as planks, screws, cement, etc.

He wants to improve the quality of his vegetables in order to offer his customers a better product. This will allow him to generate more income and provide more comfort for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, planks, screws, cement, etc.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré en Octobre 2015, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre leurs petits commerces plus rentables. 

Madame Mariama (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants et  s’active dans la vente de chaussures et de friperies.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 paires de chaussures et quelques friperies pour le revendre en détails.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne
texts.en:
Established in October 2015, this banc villageois is made up of village women who joined the program in order to make their small businesses more profitable.

Mariama (who is standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of five children. She works selling shoes and used clothing.

With this new loan, she plans to buy 15 pairs of shoes and some used clothing, which she will resell at retail.

With her earnings, Mariama plans to improve her family's living conditions and help to cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes and some used clothing.

loans.name: Fatou Abdou's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré en Octobre 2015 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance a animé la rencontre du groupe.
 
Madame Fatou Abdou, âgée de 48 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants enfants. Elle s’active dans l’agriculture et le commerce de détails.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs d’arachide et 02 sacs de mil dans son village pour le revendre en détails dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en:
Newly established in October 2015, this banc villageois is made up of village women who joined the program to make their small businesses more profitable. They also work doing rain-fed agriculture. The group shares a good ambiance.

Fatou Abdou, who is 48 years old and standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of three children. She works in agriculture and in retail.

With this new loan, she plans to buy three sacs of groundnuts and two sacs of millet in the village, which she will resell at retail in the weekly markets.

With her earnings, Fatou Abdou plans to help her husband take care of their children and the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of groundnuts and two sacs of millet.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La socia Marlene continúa  dedicándose al negocio de artesanía, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo  joyas, cerámicas, mantas y telares entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cerámicas entre otros.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marlene is still in business selling crafts. This borrower has been running her business for years, and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. She continues to sell jewelry, ceramics, blankets, looms, and other items to all the customers who come to her. This allows her to provide for her family.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more ceramics and other items. She is happy with her loan and promises to comply with all of her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy ceramics and other items.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
KUNTHEA is a 28-year-old farmer on a rice field who lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hard-working mother of two children who are enrolling in the primary school. Her husband is also a farmer. This couple can make a net profit of approximately USD 5 a day.
At this time, KUNTHEA is facing a financial issue in her family. Thus, She needs some money to expand her business to buy a billiard table to rent to players who will be pay to play, but she can’t afford one.  Therefore, she has decided to apply for a KIVA loan to help them. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a billiard table to rent

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a 60-year-old widow and has three children. One of her children is still attending school. Seven years ago she started working in the field to cover the household expenses the entire family. Emilia is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, CEVI, to purchase fertilizers. With this she would able to improve her harvest and help augment her earnings. Thus, she could able to continue expand her business and seek ways to become more sustainable.

For the future, she is looking forward to making her business more productive and investing in other sources of income to become successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking woman who is engaged in selling foods. She has been managing her restaurant business for six years. Marites' income from the business is a great help for her in sustaining her family's needs. She has five children, and some of them are attending school. Marites' husband is a farmer.

While she enjoys managing the business, Marites wanted to extend the foods she serves to her customers. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy raw meat and ingredients for cooking foods. She hopes to gain more customers to serve and will have a great income as well. She will particularly use her earnings for their farm.

loans.use: to buy raw meat and ingredients for cooking foods.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a food café. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

Patrick describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. His business goal is to have a big restaurant within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open a big hotel with accommodations and will educate his children.

This is Patrick's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind heart of lending her funds several times in the past, which really helped sustain and grow her store. It has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and she is grateful for your help. 

Once again, she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of 20000 PHP to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income; it sustains her family's basic needs and sends her children to school. She is hopeful for your positive response.

She prays for God to prosper her store to be able to save for her children's college education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mary has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mary would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Mary can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mary will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Mary is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gjelina

texts.en:
Gjelina is a married mother of two children who are in their early 20s. She is shown in the photograph with Tonin, her husband. 

For the past twenty five years Gjelina has been doing agriculture to earn a living. She also works as a janitor in the village's school for a pay of $116/month, and about twice a week she looks after an elderly couple for a pay of $62/month. 

Gjelina and Tonin own about 9 dynym (1 dynym = 1,000 square meters) of agricultural land and have rented 5 of these out to some other villagers for the past five years for as little as $19/dynym per year. In the other 4 dynym they have planted olive grooves from which they sell olives and also plant seasonal veggies for their own consumption.

"We don't have a toilet inside the home, so we thought it would be good idea to build a proper one with the full sewage system. And this is why we request the loan in hopes that lenders will show some understanding and lend to us," Gjelina said to the branch assistant in the interview.

loans.use: to build a toilet and sewage system inside her home.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia was living a tough life some years ago. It was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is a 41-year-old married woman running a general store business with the help of her husband. She counts a good client list and earns a good amount of income to bear her household expenses. She has five children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy stock of biscuits, grains, oil and peas to increase her sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of biscuits, grains, oil and peas to increase her sales to earn a good amount of income.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 44-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the taxi's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. Yasmeen has availed herself of a murabaha loan of 40000 PKR so that her husband can buy a new engine for the van to provide better equipment to his customers. Yasmeen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her husband's van to provide better equipment for his customers.

loans.name: Sidika

texts.en:
Sidika is married and a mother of two. She sells ornaments and also tobacco, which is sold either by the kilo or as cigarettes. This is her third loan.She bought her materials, sold them in her shop, and made money.

With the help of the loan she is planning to buy goods for her shop, sell them, and make money. 

--

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sıdıka hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Hediyelik eşya ve tütün işi yapıyor tütünü kilo ile satışını da yapıyor ve tütünü sararak sigara haline getirerek de satıyor.  Bu 3.kredisi. Dükkana mal aldı sattı ve para kazandı.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile de dükkana mal alarak satarak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy ornaments and tobacco for her shop

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bitrus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Bitrus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Gabriel would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Gabriel now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is maize farmer from Dan'asabe village. As a member of Babban Gona, Hajara is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hajara would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Hajara can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Hajara is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end, hopes to use her increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Aliyu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Aliyu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Aliyu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Aliyu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Rahila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Rahila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Rahila can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Rahila no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Rahila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rahila is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Rahila will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Rahila now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mengsong's Group

texts.en: Mengsong’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Mengsong works as a factory laborer and he also does extra work as an officer to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this man and woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Shantoshben And Group

texts.en:
Shantoshben is a 24-year-old lady who lives in Dahod district of Gujarat with her husband and two children. To supplement her family's income, she runs her own small beauty parlor business. Her income of 3,000 INR goes entirely to savings. But these savings are meager and will not help her realize her biggest hope. She wants to provide a good education and better healthcare for her children. Increasing her income will also help improve her family’s standard of living.

She wants to expand her microenterprise by offering more services in her beauty parlor like hair cutting, facials, waxing, etc. This will bring more customers and, thereby, increase her income. Shantoshben has joined with three other women (Sarlaben, Savitriben, and Uramilaben) to request a loan. Together they need a group loan to expand their respective businesses. They are grateful to their lenders for the financial support and encouragement.

loans.use: to expand her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Gustavo Jean Pierre

texts.es:
Jean Pierre vive junto a su familia en uno de los distritos más pobres de Lima. La situación económica por la que atraviesa su familia es muy difícil debido a la falta de trabajo por parte de sus padres. 

Él decidió estudiar la carrera de Mecánica automotriz, porque desde muy pequeño le gustan los autos y siente mucha pasión por todo lo relacionado con el tema automotriz. Siente que esa carrera le permitirá desenvolverse mucho en el ámbito laboral porque es una de las más demandadas hoy en día. Beneficiará a su familia porque él podrá apoyarlos económicamente. A su comunidad le permitirá apoyar a los jóvenes para que salgan adelante, con mucho esfuerzo. Aún le faltan 2 años y medio para que culmine su carrera.

Le dedica 6 horas a la semana a sus estudios, le va muy bien en todos sus cursos, aprendió a organizarse con todas las actividades que realiza. Cuando termine su carrera piensa trabajar en grandes empresas, donde le permitan aprender cada día cosas nuevas y especializarse más en el tema automotriz.

La difícil situación económica por la que atraviesa su familia, pone en riesgo su continuidad profesional. Es por eso que, solicita el apoyo de KIVA para que pueda continuar sus estudios, logre acabar su carrera en el tiempo estimado y convertirse en el gran profesional especialista en su carrera. Con esta ayuda de KIVA, sus padres ya no tendrán porque preocuparse mucho por los estudios de Gustavo, lo que no afectaría su salud.

El gran sueño de Gustavo, es terminar su carrera en el tiempo estimado. También le gustaría estudiar otra carrera en la universidad como es Ciencias de la Comunicación para poder ver a su familia feliz y sin preocupaciones.

Gustavo quiere expresarles unas líneas a los inversionistas de KIVA: "Siento mucha felicidad al saber que personas sin conocerme me puedan brindar la confianza que toda persona necesita para estar seguro de sí mismo. Quiero agradecerles a todos ellos y decirles que no les fallaré con todo el apoyo que me dan."
texts.en:
Gustavo Jean Pierre lives with his family in one of Lima's poorest districts. The financial situation his family is going through is very difficult, given his parents' lack of work.

He decided to study auto mechanics because, since he was very young, he likes cars and he is very passionate about everything related to the automotive field. He feels this career will allow him to develop well in the workplace because it's currently in high demand. It will benefit his family because he will be able to support them financially. It will allow his community to be able to help young people in order to get ahead with much effort. He still has 2 and half more years to finish his degree.

He spends 6 hours a week on his studies. He is doing very well in all his courses. He learned how to get organized with all his activities. When he finishes his degree we wants to work in big companies where he will be allowed to learn new things every day, and specialize more in the automotive field.

The difficult financial situation that his family is going through puts at risk his professional future. That's why he requests Kiva's support so that he can continue his studies, be able to finish his degree in the projected time, and become the great professional specialist in his career. With this help from Kiva, his parents won't have to worry much about Gustavo's studies, and their health won't be affected.

Gustavo's great dream is to finish his degree in the projected time. He would also like to study another career in university, such as communication sciences, to be able to see his family happy and worry-free.

Gustavo would like to share some words with the Kiva investors: "I feel much happiness knowing that people, without knowing me, can offer me the trust that every person needs to be self confident. I want to thank all of them, and let them know I will not fail them with all the support they are giving me."

loans.use: to continue with his auto mechanics studies.

loans.name: Yegsabet

texts.en:
Yegsabet is an experienced seller of cosmetic products. She has been working in cosmetic sales for around 32 years and decided to open her own shop in 2008 in a popular neighborhood of Beirut. She sells all kinds of beauty and cosmetic products: creams, perfumes, make up and hair products. Her brother is her partner in the shop and supports her with the management and paper work.

Yegsabet is 63 years old. She lives with her brother in the family apartment and the shop is their main source of income. She is asking for a 3,085,617 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva Partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy new products for which the demand will be high before Christmas season. Yegsabet works hard to ensure the success of her business and she also sells products wholesale to hair salons in order to increase her income.

Her hard work has been paying off so far. In fact, she has clients from all over Lebanon and is proud of her shop's results and reputation in the cosmetics market.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her cosmetics shop

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es: Mario de 18 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar en compañía de sus padres y dos hermanos. Él es un hombre trabajado a quien le enseñaron como criar animales y gracias a su esfuerzo posee un pequeño negocio de crianza de conejos además cultiva güisquiles, siendo esa la manera como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que apoya a sus padres con algunos de los gastos de la vivienda. Mario desea invertir en la compra de materiales para mejorar los corrales de los conejos lo que le permitiría incrementar el número de conejos e incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: compra de tela metálica, madera, clavos, alimento, etc., para mejorar los corrales lo que le permitiría aumentar la cantidad de conejos y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Mario is 18 years old and lives in his family home with his parents and two siblings. He is a hard-working man who was taught how to raise animals, and thanks to his effort he has a small business raising rabbits as well as growing squash. This is how he earns the income that he uses to help his parents with some of the household expenses. Mario would like to invest in materials to improve his rabbit pens, which will allow him to increase the number of rabbits he has and thereby increase his sales and his income. For this reason he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy wire netting, wood, nails, etc., to improve the pens, and feed, which will allow him to increase the number of rabbits he has and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy wire netting, wood, nails, etc., to improve his rabbit pens, and feed, which will allow him to increase the number of rabbits he has and increase his income.

loans.name: Dúo Alegria Por Vivir Group

texts.es:
DUO ALEGRIA POR VIVIR
Doña Veronica es originaria del municipio de Tecpan, ella tiene 38 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus tres hijas menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de materia prima para su venta de refacciones, maiz , frijol, leña y tomate. 
El esposo de ella trabaja como costurero en una fabrica de ropa y gracias al apoyo y a sus hijas ella sigue adelante con su negocio. 
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio, surtirlo con mas variedad de productos  asi obtendrá mejores ganancias  y poder mandar sus hijas  a estudiar para un futuro mejor ya que hoy en dia la educacion es muy importante, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboración de refacciones para la venta.
texts.en:
Veronica is from Tecpan. She is 38 years old and has three young daughters under her charge. She works selling snacks. Her husband works sewing at a clothing factory, and thanks to his support and to her daughters, she keeps her business going.

She invested her previous loan in ingredients and supplies for her business: corn, beans, tomatoes, and firewood.

Her dream is to expand her business. She wants to stock up on a wider variety of products in order to obtain better profits so that she can send her daughters to school. She wants them to study and have a better future, because these days education is very important.

She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for the snacks she prepares and sells.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Aissatou Mamadou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  est mis en place en ce  second semestre de l’année 2015. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles sont donc venues dans ce sens pour faire parti du programme. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Aissatou Mamadou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  mariée, âgée de 30 ans et mère de 04 enfants. Elle  s’active dans la vente de sucre et divers produits alimentaires qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

 Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs de 50 kg de sucre et d’autres condiments alimentaires  pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de renouveler son activité, épargner et aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was established in the second half of 2015. It is made up of women who are determined to change their living conditions. It is for this reason that they joined the program. They all live in the same village and share a sense of solidarity and mutual aid. They all work in small-scale commerce and rain-fed agriculture.

Aissatou Mamadou (who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She works selling sugar and other food products, which she buys from the weekly markets.

With this loan, she plans to buy three 50-kilogram sacs of sugar and other food condiments, which she will resell at retail in her village.

Earnings will allow her to maintain her business, save money, and help her husband to cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy three 50-kilogram sacs of sugar and other food condiments.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El socio Emilio continúa en el banco comunal “Los Solidarios” .
El socio sigue con su negocio de artesanía, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso el socio espera poder obtener más ganancias con su negocio para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, el socio sigue elaborando tejidos como chompas, guantes, mantas en base de lana de alpaca entre otros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas de colores entre otros.
texts.en:
Emilio is still a member of Los Solidarios Communal Bank. He's a responsible and hardworking person who hopes to be able to earn more profit with his business to continue supporting his family.

He still has his handicraft business. He weaves sweaters, gloves, and blankets of alpaca wool and other materials. This is how he gets his family ahead.

Emilio's requesting the loan to buy colored wool and other materials.

loans.use: to buy colored wool and other materials

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
La socia Ayde  continua dedicándose al negocio de agricultura, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracia al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua cultivando maiz, papa y trigo para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas, abono entre otros.
texts.en:
Ayde still works farming. This borrower has been in business for years, and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She continues to grow corn, potatoes, and wheat for her customers.

She is happy with her loan and promises to comply with her payment terms. This borrower wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other items.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a resident from the town of Bilar, Bohol. His source of income comes from selling snack foods from a marketplace in his town. He serves banana cue and hot cakes to local residents in the community. He is married man and has no dependent.

Sergio has been engaged in the food vending business for the past two years. He wants to improve his earnings, but he has a very limited capital. Therefore, he joined CEVI to avail loans and acquire capital to continue operating his day-to-day activities for his livelihood. He wants to purchase additional ingredients like bananas, flour and sugar. These will help him prepare more varieties of snack foods to sell.

In the future, Sergio is looking forward to making use of his profit wisely, and to continue expanding his business for a sustainable living and to become financially stable,too.

loans.use: to purchase additional  ingredients like bananas, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, a 36-year-old mother of four, helps her husband by working their own coconut farm to make a living. Aside from this, they also plant other crops on their farm such as corn and root crops to earn more for the family. in the year 2010, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to finance the maintenance costs of her coconut plantation like weeding and fertilization. She wants to improve her farm to secure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to finance the maintenance costs, such as weeding and fertilization, of her coconut plantation.

loans.name: Nain

texts.en: Nain is 70 years old, single, and lives in Pagadian city, Zamboanga del Sur. He is an active member of Paglaum MPC since year 2000. He signed up for membership with the cooperative to access the programs and services intended to pensioners like him. Recently, he asks Paglaum MPC for a loan in the amount of 38,000 PHP to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Onik

texts.en:
Onik lives in Lchashen village of the Gegharkunik region with his son. He also has three daughters who are already married and they live with their families.

Onik used to work as a driver in different companies, but now his only occupation is farming and agriculture. On his farm he has cows, calves, a bull, sheep, pigs and chickens. He has a nice big fruit garden where he has a lot of apple and pear trees. He also cultivates potatoes, greens, tomatoes and cucumbers on his land. He sells all the fruit and vegetables along with his farm products such as milk, macun (the national dairy product), cheese, meat and eggs at the city’s wholesale market. Onik does almost all the farm work by himself since his son is a furniture maker and is very busy with his work 'til late at night.

Onik is now asking for this loan of 700,000 AMD as he wants to buy two pigs and increase his pork sales. He would also like to buy fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and increase his pork sales as well as buy fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Emmanuel has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Emmanuel can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Emmanuel is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kabiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Kabiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Kabiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ndiome Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  est mis en place en ce second semestre de l’année 2015. Il est composé de  femmes déterminées à changer leurs conditions d’existence. Elles sont donc venues dans ce sens pour faire parti du programme. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Ndiome (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  veuve et mère de 02 filles. Elle  s’active dans la fabrication de savon local. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

 Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter différents produits pour la préparation de son savon traditionnel en gros et après préparation les revendre en détails dans son village.

Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront d’accroitre son épargne et d’aider ses enfants à la maison.
texts.en:
This group was established in the second half of 2015. It is made up of women who are determined to change their lot in life. It is for this reason that they joined the program.

These women come from the same village and maintain ties of solidarity and mutual aid. They work in small-scale commerce and also practice rain-fed agriculture.

Ndiome (who is standing on the far right in the photo with her hand raised), is the featured borrower of the group. She is a widow and the mother of two children. She works making artisanal soap. She does well with this business, because she has been doing it for many years.

With this loan, she plans to buy the ingredients necessary to make the soap at wholesale. After she makes the soap, she will resell it at retail in her village.

The earnings she makes will allow her to increase her savings and help her children.

loans.use: to buy the different ingredients needed to make artisanal soap.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place en Octobre 2015 et est composé de membres ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et habitant toute le même village et exerçant comme principale activité le petit commerce. 

Madame Fatoumata (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle  s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (riz, sucre, bouillon, et d’autres condiments) qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

 Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac de 50 kg de sucre, 02 sacs de riz de 50 kg des bouillons et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails dans son village. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la scolarité, soins médicaux santé et  habillements de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was established in October 2015 and is composed of women who are from the same village and work in small-scale commerce. They share close social bonds.

Fatoumata (who is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and has four children. She works selling food products (rice, sugar, bouillon, and other condiments) that she buys in the weekly markets.

With this loan, she plans to buy one 50-kilogram sac of sugar, two 50-kilogram sacs of rice, bouillon cubes, and other condiments, which she will resell at retail in her village.

Her earnings will allow her to support her children's education, medical, and clothing needs.

loans.use: to buy one 50-kilogram sac of sugar, two 50-kilogram sacs of rice, bouillon cubes, and other condiments.

loans.name: Adalia

texts.es: Doña Adalia es una mujer que se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra y comercialización de plátano. Solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 00), para la compra de semilla e insumos agrícolas necesarios para el crecimiento y buen desarrollo de este cultivo, de esta forma podrá lograr su propósito de ampliar su cultivo de plátano y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Adalia is a farmer. Specifically, she grows and sells plantains.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,050,000 colones to buy the seeds and farm supplies that she needs in order for her crops to adequately grow and develop. This will allow her to meet her goal, which is to expand her plantain crops and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies for her plantain crops.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios”.
La socia continúa con su negocio de venta de flores como rosas, claveles y otras más, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia su negocio, la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera obtener más ganancias con su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abono entre otros.
 Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the communal bank Los Solidarios.

This borrower is still in business selling flowers, such as roses, carnations, and others. She has been in business for quite some time, and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She is a fighter and an enterprising woman. She wants to make more profit from her business so that she can continue to support her family.

This borrower is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies. She is happy with her loan and promises to comply with all of her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. This is her fifth loan from SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Inviolata

texts.en:
Inviolata is married and has two children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business, selling sugar, rice, flour, and other items, which she has been doing for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

Inviolata requested her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank for 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. In the future, she hopes to have a stable family and business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, flour, and other items

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a maize farmer from Tafki village. As a Babban Gona member, Gabriel is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Gabriel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Gabriel can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Gabriel no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Gabriel hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
