As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor  tiene 62 años de edad es casado; mensualmente recibe su pensión. Padece de cataratas en el ojo izquierdo, hace siete años le operaron el ojo derecho, en ese entonces le fue imposible costear la operación de ambos ojos por que no contaba con el dinero suficiente. Necesita de urgencia la cirugía de cataratas debido a que esta en riesgo su órgano, el pronostico es reservado sin embargo el especialista le da esperanza en poder salvar su órgano y recupere la vista.
texts.en:
The man is married. He's 62 years old and receives a monthly pension.

He suffers from cataracts in the left eye. His right eye was operated on seven years ago, when it was impossible to have the operation in both eyes because he lacked the money.

He urgently needs cataract surgery because of the risk to the organ. The prognosis is reserved; the surgeon is hopeful he'll be able to save the eye and the man will recover his sight.

loans.use: to pay for eye treatment

loans.name: Vessels Of Honour Group

texts.en:
The very least you can do in your life is to hope and dream for better things, and live and work toward attaining those hopes and dreams. Norest is aged 35 and married with one daughter. Like for her husband, the very poor economic outlook in Zimbabwe has closed the door to formal employment for her and made it necessary to find other ways to survive.

Her passion to be a successful entrepreneur started at an early age. This was cultivated by her background at her church. As they grew up their church leaders encouraged and trained them to be involved in basic skills that could help them earn a living. Her determination enabled her to turn lemons into lemonade by crossing borders to restock groceries that were unavailable in supermarkets, selling to the people in Harare.

In the quest to be a businesswoman, Norest also started a small savings club with other women from her neighborhood in the year 2011. They named the club Vessels of Honour. In this club every member is self-employed and engaged in various business activities.

The cross-border business specializing in groceries gave her money to support her family. The economy stabilized after the introduction of a multi-currency system, and big grocery shops started operating. This led Norest to shift to selling jewelry and handbags to ladies. In addition, she sells meat to people around her neighbourhood. She is currently buying cattle and selling meat to people in companies and different households.

Together with her club members, she joined Thrive Microfinance for financial assistance training. They increased their saving skills. More so, they learned bookkeeping and also how to market their products well.

Vessels of Honour group received a total group loan of $1,500. Norest intends to increase the levels of stock and meet the increasing demand, and diversify her products to satisfy every household.

loans.use: Tto increase the range of food products she can offer her customers in the run-up to Christmas.

loans.name: The Chosen Ones Group

texts.en:
Zeppa remembers how, as a young girl, she would watch her mother bake delicious scrumptious tea scones and cake. This inspired her to also be a master baker. At the tender age of ten she was already baking nice, tasty scones for her father, who would invite his friends over for tea. No-one turns down an invitation for tea with scones made by Zeppa.

After completing school, Zeppa was formally employed but continued baking as a hobby, baking for her family and friends. She has been married for thirty years to her wonderful husband who, like her father is a big fan. They have two grown up children who mean the world to them. He helps her in delivering her cakes and sourcing new customers for her around Harare.

Zeppa took an early retirement package to pay for her son’s tertiary education overseas. Naturally, she returned to doing what she loves doing the most. Cakes baked in love and with love come out to absolutely the most delicious and moist. Over the years she has developed her natural baking skills through attending cake guilds and following internet tutorials. This has made her perfect the precision of icing her cakes and has earned her clients from private schools, banks, airlines etc.

Zeppa is a member of a group called the Chosen Ones and resides in Houghton Park in Harare. The group consists of 5 women with a shared personal and business history who are now applying for a second loan with Thrive Microfinance. The group members used their loans well and paid them back in a timely manner. Their group relationship is growing from strength to strength and the ladies are currently being taught basic baking by Zeppa. She used her first loan to buy her cake ingredients in bulk. She is planning to use her second loan to purchase a big gas stove and tank.

She is also currently working towards opening a small deli in one of the affluent shopping centres in Harare where she will serve her cakes and other confectionary items with tea, coffee etc.

loans.use: to purchase a big gas stove and tank for baking as the electricity supply is very irregular.

loans.name: Dúo Concepción De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es: Dúo Concepción de Villa Nueva Berta Marilia de 44 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos. Inicio  su negocio hace 10 años, empeco su negocio con venta de choco bananos, gelatinas y helados gracias a Dios le ha ido bien en sus ventas y gracias a los prestamos de Fape y kiva a crecido Esta solicitando este crédito para la compra producto en frutas para vender.
texts.en:
Berta Marilia, one of the members of the Dúo Concepción de Villa Nueva group, is 44 and has 5 children.

She started her business 10 years ago, and began by selling chocolate bananas, jelly candy and ice cream. Thanks to God, she has enjoyed good sales, and thanks to Fape and Kiva, she has expanded her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mario Ulises

texts.es: Mario es un joven trabajador que a sus 27 años de edad se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa de seguridad, además cuenta con una pequeña granja en su vivienda, lo que le permite tener mejores ingresos. Él vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 3 meses de edad que es su mayor alegría. Mario desea comprar concentrado y más gallinas, además de mejorar la granja de pollos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: gallinas, pollos, concentrado y vitaminas, además de materiales para mejorar su granja.
texts.en:
Mario is a hardworking young man who is 27 years old and makes a living as a security guard. He also has a small farm where he lives, which allows him to make additional money. He lives with his partner and their 3-month-old son, who is his greatest joy.

Mario wishes to buy animal feed and more hens, in addition to making improvements to the chicken farm. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy hens, chickens, animal feed and vitamins, as well as materials to improve his farm.

loans.use: to buy hens, chickens, animal feed and vitamins, as well as materials to improve his farm.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Don José es originario de la aldea Xetzac del municipio de Tecpan, el tiene 50 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijas, el se dedica a la crianza de animales.
El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de animales para la crianza como pollos, y cuando ya estan grandes venderlos a un mejor precio, tambien para la compra de alimentos para los mismos
La esposa de el se dedica al comercio y gracias al apoyo de ella y el de sus hijas el sigue adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de el es ampliar mas su granja tener mas animales  ya que así obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijas a estudiar para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Don José is from the village of Xetzac in Tecpan munipality, he is 50 years old, in his care are his two daughters, he works in the breeding of animals. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy animals to breed, such as chickens, and when they are grown to sell them at a better price, also to buy food for them. 

His wife works in business and thanks to her support and support from his daughters he continues his business.

His dream is to make his farm bigger, with more animals, so that he will make better earnings and can send his daughters to school so they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell (chickens)

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
Epifanio is a 49-year-old man who lives in Tubigon, Bohol with his family. He has two children, aged 18 and 16 years old. Epifanio works hard to provide for the needs of his family.

He is a driver of a motorcycle known as “habal-habal” locally. It is called “habal-habal” because of its extended seat to accommodate more passengers. In addition to this, he also runs a farm, specifically a vegetable farm.

Because of this, he is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle to maintain its good condition. Also, another part of his loan is to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer as well. In this way, he will be able to improve his earnings as well as his profit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle, and buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine owns a sari-sari (variety) store selling basic household commodities ranging from liquors, beverages, noodles, cooking oil, soap, and dry goods to a variety of pig feeds, which she has used to manage the economy of her house.

She is a 42-year-old, married woman and has three-school aged children.

She wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to purchase stock of pig feed to continue improving her business. She used the previous loan to stock her shop and wants to continue doing so.

Josephine is hoping that she will become fruitful in managing her livelihood to support the welfare of her family and to be able to achieve a better life with opportunities ahead.

loans.use: to purchase stock of pig  feed.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona, 25, lives with her husband and son in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. She graduated Gavar city’s State University the historical faculty. For the past four years she has worked at the school as a teacher of Armenian History.

Sona finds her work and the subject that she teaches very interesting and important, and she does her best to stimulate the interest of her pupils on such significant subjects as the history of their motherland. Sona also gives paid private courses in Armenian History to pupils who are studying to pass entrance exams. With this loan of 500,000 AMD through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon Sona will buy a computer and several volumes of new and important professional literature that she needs in her occupation.

loans.use: buy a computer and several volumes of important new literature that she needs for work.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has an ice cream making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk and sugar and other materials for her food production business.

Delia has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk and sugar and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, age 55, didn’t have a chance to go to school because of the financial situation of her family. She is a married ‎mother of three children who are already adults. Her husband is working in Saudi Arabia so she had to raise her children ‎alone; she carried all the responsibility by herself.

Nadia mainly works selling blankets, and she feels that her business is working well. Now she needs this loan to buy more ‎blankets and bed covers in order to pay for basic needs for her children.

Nadia dreams that her husband would come back and live with her and that all her family would have better living ‎conditions.‎

loans.use: to buy more ‎blankets and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Nshan

texts.en:
Nshan is a taxi driver from Gyumri town. Using his own car, Nshan has been involved in this service for more than 10 years. Besides his mothertown Gyumri, Nshan also drives to longer distances in Armenia and also outside of Armenia. He lives with his wife, elderly retired parents-in-law and two children. As the main breadwinner in his family, Nshan has to work hard to sustain the daily basic costs of the family.

Because Nshan needs to do some improvements on the car so he is able to continue driving and providing taxi service, he requested this loan. He planned to purchase four tires and do a partial renovation of the engine and some cosmetic work to bring the car to a working condition again.

Nshan hopes to receive your trust and support.

loans.use: to pay for four tires, a partial renovation of the engine and some cosmetic work to bring the car to working condition and continue taxi driving.

loans.name: Veenus

texts.en:
Veenus is a 49-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible to fulfill the needs of all the family members.

Veenus has been running her own beauty salon for past 10 years; she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e. creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Veenus has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Veenus is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her polar business.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Haruna will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Haruna now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadores Del Km. 148 Group

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer muy generosa, sincera y responsable, tiene 30 de edad es madre de familia de una pequeña de tres años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Sandra (la primera del lado izquierdo en la foto)  con el afán de mejorar las condiciones de su familia ha decidió trabajar como costurera  desde hace 20 años, a ella le gusta realizar esta labor pues lo hace desde la comodidad de su hogar permitiéndole así cuidar mejor de su familia. Ella es una mujer que posee liderazgo por esa razón es representante de un grupo de personas, ella está solicitando un préstamo con el afán de comprar más telas para la elaboración de blusas y poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Sus aspiraciones en la vida son; contar con su propio local de negocio, contar con su casa propia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a very generous, honest, and responsible woman. She is thirty years old and has a three-year-old little girl. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Twenty years ago, in order to improve her family's situation, Sandra decided to start working as a seamstress. She likes this line of work because she can do it from the comfort of her home, which allows her to take better care of her family. She is a good leader, which is why she represents a group of people. (She is the first person from the left in the picture.)

She is requesting this loan in order to buy more fabric for making blouses. This will allow her to further meet her customers' needs. Her aspirations in life are to have her own retail space one day and also to buy a home so that her family can enjoy better living standards.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making blouses.

loans.name: Walter Group

texts.en:
What is success? This can be defined as accomplishing or triumphing in whatever endeavour one has set out to do.

Getrude, age 32, is a serious and committed crossborder trader. She is married and they have one child who is eight years old. Her husband is a technician and currently employed in South Africa. Their son is doing grade two at a local government primary school.

Through perseverance, many people have been successful in situations that seemed destined to be certain failure. Getrude has a flea-market in one of the oldest ghettos in Harare. Getrude crosses to South Africa at least four times every month to meet the demands of her customers. This business has been giving her sleepless nights in her travels every week, as most buses that cross the border travel during the night. Her son ends up missing her as she is busy travelling. Getrude mainly restocks shoes and clothes for both men and women of all sizes.

Her weekly crossings to South Africa resulted in the need for increased capital for her business. This pushed her to join hands with her friends to join Thrive Microfinance. The women formed a team of four serious business ladies. The group was named Walter, which is the name of one the team member’s son who motivated her to be an entrepreneur. They learned bookkeeping, which has changed their way of doing business since they did not keep records before. They did lessons on savings and have made savings their key to their financial security.

The Walter group received a total group loan of $2,000. Getrude wants to go to South Africa to restock her flea market in preparation for the festive season. The festive season is a time when people are extravagant and buy new clothing, especially for their children. Restocking in bulk also increases the profit levels resulting from reduced travelling costs per month. This also enables her to spend more time with her son.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and other household products to meet the Christmas rush.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora tiene 44 años de edad es divorciada, tiene solo una hija de 16 años de edad. Trabaja como supervisora en una tienda de conveniencia, ella nació con un desorden refractivo en sus dos ojos debido a esto ha utilizado lentes desde los 7 años edad cuando le detectaron el problema en su vista. La graduación que tiene es de ocho dioptrías por lo que sufrió un desgarre en la retina esto afectó su visión y de no tratarse podría llegar a perder la vista permanentemente.
texts.en:
The woman, 44, is divorced and has only one child, a 16-year-old daughter. She works as a supervisor in a convenience store.

She was born with a refractive disorder in both eyes, so she has worn corrective lenses since the age of seven when they detected the problem with her sight.

She has a gradation of eight, from which she suffered a tear in her retina that affected her vision. If she's not treated she could lose her sight permanently.

loans.use: to pay for eye treatment

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, John has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, John would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support John can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, John will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. John is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Francelina

texts.pt:
A cliente Francelina, comerciante de 32 anos de idade, solteira e ainda sem filhos, vive na casa própria e sustenta a mais  02 irmãos.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar açúcar, ovos, sabão em pó,  óleo, batata, cebola, cervejas, refrescos para reforçar o seu negocio
A cliente tem como sonho concluir a sua casa, comprar uma viatura para lhe ajudar no seu negocio, ver a sua família feliz.

Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar pretende tomar mais vezes para alcançar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Francelina, a 32-year-old businesswoman, is single and has no children. She owns the house where she lives and maintains two siblings.

With the requested amount she will buy sugar, eggs, washing powder, cooking oil, potatoes, onions, beer, and beverages to strengthen her business.

Her dreams are to build her house, buy a vehicle for her business, and see her family happy. Her main challenges are financial in nature, but she has continued working. She plans to apply for more loans to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs, washing powder, cooking oil, potatoes, onions, beer, and beverages to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia Jesusa es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora ella se dedica al negocio de la venta de jugos, hechos de frutas naturales .la socia trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las horas de la tarde donde expende sus deliciosas bebidas.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “San Juan de Ollantaytambo” , tiene 52 años de edad, su sueño de la socia es  progresar y ampliar su negocio.
Genoveva solicito el préstamo para comprar  papaya, plátano y leche.

La socia está contenta  con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante, agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Jesusa, 52, is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She earns a living selling juice made of natural fruits. She works selling her delicious beverages from 6 a.m. until the afternoon hours.

She's a member of San Juan de Ollantaytambo Communal Bank. Her dream is to make progress and expand her business.

Genoveva requested the loan to buy papayas, bananas, and milk.

She's happy about the loan because she will get ahead. She's grateful to the Kiva lenders and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy papayas, bananas, and milk

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She sells cosmetics and perfumes from her house, which she has been doing since 2013. Her home-based business aims to take good care of her family, and at the same support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.

Since her business income is specialized for their family's daily living needs, Leila requested a youth loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to increase her business merchandise with newly released, special offer winter cosmetics and perfumes collection. She hopes to develop her business in the future so that when she finds the suitable time, she can move it outside her house.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new released, special offer winter cosmetics and perfumes collection

loans.name: Eufemia Matilde

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Unidas.
En este lugar vive la señora Eufemia, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 22, 18 y 12 años de edad, los  dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es electricista.
Doña Eufemia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, ella hace tiempo atrás y con la ayuda de los créditos construyó un galpón en el cual cría pollos, ella compra los pollos cuando están pequeños, luego los mantiene por tres meses y cuando están grandes los vende a comerciantes o por libras a vecinos del lugar, ella también vende ropa de todo tipo y esto le realiza en sus ratos desocupados. Ambos trabajos no le impiden realizar una u otra labor y esto también le deja tiempo suficiente para estar atenta a  las necesidades de su hogar
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para pollos y prendas de vestir. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque le brindan atención  medica gratuita. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
In "Los Bajos de Montecristi", a city known for its huge variety of typical products such as Panama hats, the "Madres Unidas" loan group meets every fortnight.

And it is here that 46-year-old Eufemia lives. She is married and has three children, ages 22, 18, and 12 years old. The youngest two children attend school. Eufemia's husband is an electrician.

Eufemia likes to work and help her husband to move forward with her family. Some time ago, Eufemia, with the help of loans, built a chicken coop. She buys chickens when they are young, then raises them over three months in the coop. When they are grown, Eufemia sells the chickens to traders or by the pound to neighbours. Eufemia also sells all types of clothing in her free time. Eufemia can run both businesses without the one affecting the other, and she still has time to look after her household.

Eufemia will use this loan to buy chickens, and feed and medication for the chickens, and clothing items. Eufemia has been with the loan group since its inception, and she likes it because she receives free medical care through the group. Eufemia's dream is to see her children finish their education.

loans.use: to buy chickens, and feed and medication for the chickens, and clothing items.

loans.name: Tatiana Rocio

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Unidas.
En este lugar vive la señora Tatiana, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo  de 6 años de edad, el mismo que estudia en escuela. El marido es despachador en una empresa de lácteos.
Doña Tatiana es una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza lo necesario para ganar algo  y así contribuir con los gastos que generan el hogar y la crianza de su pequeño, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también tiene un pequeño local en su casa en la cual exhibe sus prendas, ella sale una a dos veces por semana a ofrecer sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días, ella lleva más de 3 años en este negocio con el cual se gana sus recursos para ir mejorando su situación económica por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusa entre otras prendas.  Lleva 2 ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su local.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a town known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hat, which is well-known inside and outside the country. This is where the members of the Madres Unidas communal bank meets every two weeks.

Tatiana is one of its members. She is 22 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has a six-year-old son from this relationship. He is in school. Her husband works for a dairy company.

Tatiana is a very hard worker and does everything she needs to do in order to make some income and contribute to her household and to supporting her little boy. She works as a door-to-door vendor, selling all kinds of clothing. She also has a small retail space set up at home, where she displays her clothing items. She goes out once or twice per week to offer her products. She leaves them with her customers on credit, and bills them weekly. She has been in business for over three years, and this work allows her to generate resources to gradually improve her financial situation, which is in her family's best interest.

She will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and other clothing items. She has been with her communal bank for two cycles, and enjoys being a member because she appreciates the help she gets from the loans provided. Her goal is to further improve her retail space.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and other clothing items.

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak is 42 years old and he lives in Dilijan city of Tavush region with his father and mother. He is not married. All his life Spartak has been engaged in farming. His farm is a very cute one, and here he has several cows and calves. With the help of his retired mother, Spartak sells his farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), and cheese to their regular customers and neighbors.

Spartak greatly wants to make his farm bigger and richer with cattle. The enlargement of his farm will mean more farm products assortment and more sales of all of it. Spartak asks for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of one more cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle. Little by little he hopes to make true his farm enlargement plan.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle; little by little he hopes to make true his farm enlargement plan.

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.en: Nikolay lives in the frontier village Aygehovit in the Tavush region. He has a large family and he lives with his wife, son, daughter in-law, and grandchildren. Nikolay used to work in different workshops, but now he is busy with farming, agriculture, and coal production. Nikolay has a large and rich farm, where he takes care of cows, calves, sheep, lambs, and chickens. He is especially famous in his village with sheep breeding. He sells a lot of milk, meat, eggs, and also sheep wool. His fruit garden is also rich and colorful; he has apple, persimmon, fig, and grape trees. He sells all the harvest from his fruit garden and his farm products and with its income he cleverly pays for his big family’s numerous needs. This Kiva loan helps Nikolay enlarge and repair his cattle barn because he recently bought more sheep and now his barn is too small for all of them.  He also must repair the barn roof  to keep it in safe during the winter months.

loans.use: to enlarge and repair his cattle barn, especially repair the roof to make it safe during the winter months

loans.name: Abdulrahamani

texts.en:
Abdulrahamani is a married man with one child. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells fruit juices. He has been involved in this business for four years. He also has a business of selling charcoal.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is Abdulrahamani's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more ingredients for making juices and will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

His business goal is to have other business outlets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making juices

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her children who are doing studies. Her brother has been running his own business of clothes selling for 4 years, her brother is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. Her brother needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her brother is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Shagufta is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her brother to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her brother can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Shagufta is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bulk clothing to help her brother increase his cloth business

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en: Fernanda lives in Atsabe. She is creative in making her local production, and she is happy to do her activities. She said living in a town is very competitive for earning money, unless one does some activity that is profitable in order to survive.Looking for ways to earn money, Fernanda came out with an idea to open a sewing service for all people. She started to open her activity a few years ago, with her own working capital. She is applying for a loan of $ 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more materials like thread colors, cotton, and sewing needles.

loans.use: to buy thread colors, cotton, and sewing needles.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is a 59-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her three children in Ozurget district. Darejan has two cows and produces dairy products. Also, the family owns a plot of land where they grow nut trees and sell the harvested nuts locally.

Darejan wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,000 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase a car and her son will drive it to trade fruits and vegetables. This will increase family income, as they will have stable income.

Darejan is very motivated to start a new business and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a fruits and vegetables trading business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana has been involved in running a furniture shop since a few year ago. She started her business with her own working capital. Juliana is married and her husband is in carpentry. Juliana has a furniture shop in her house, so she is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital, because she wants to buy additional materials, including wooden beams, wooden boards, wood glue, drilling machines, cutting machines, and other materials to use. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy wooden beams, wooden boards, wood glue, drilling machines, cutting machines, and other materials to use.

loans.name: Abroad Group

texts.en:
It is easy to know where the sun sets, and it is easy to define a girl the same way it is to define a boy, but it is always critical to define a woman. The dictionary is inadequate to define a woman, especially the likes of Winnet. She taught her children the values and rules of life; she has been able to fend for them and see them through all academic stages until some of them waved good-bye to form families of their own.

Winnet is not only a member, but a strong member of Abroad Group. The group is an association of women who have seen each other in the same location for more than five years. Members of Abroad have supported each other in the good and bad times of their lives. Winnet is 56 years old and a cook by profession. She is at the far left in the photo.

Winnet started a canteen business five years ago. She has amassed love, honour, and respect among her clients due to her acts of kindness. Winnet’s canteen serves sadza, rice, and various relishes, which have earned her more customers. Winnet was able to start her business when her husband, a truck driver, gave her a small amount of cash to start off with.

Winnet wants a loan from Thrive to buy some pots, utensils, food items, and many other missing ingredients in her business. Winnet is facing challenges of cooking less quantity than required due to less capital. She was very happy to learn of Thrive, and she expressed that the training is very beneficial for any entrepreneur to revive his or her business.

loans.use: to buy some pots, utensils, food items, and other ingredients for her catering business.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Iliya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Iliya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer from Nassarawa Murga village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yahaya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Yahaya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dúo Estoy Con Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO ESTOY CON DIOS
Don Alfredo es originario del municipio de Tecpán, tiene 50 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus hijos menores de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años.
El credito que el recibio lo invirtio en compra de insumos para agricultura, como semillas, organicos, fungicidas y fertilizantes.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposa y al apoyo de sus hijos el sigue adelante con su trabajo ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante.
El sueño de el es ampliar  mas sus siembras ya que asi tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor ya que hoy en dia la educación es muy importante para un trabajo, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de semillas de verduras y fertilizantes para cultivar.
texts.en:
"Dúo Estoy Con Dios" Group:

Don Alfredo is originally from the municipality of Tecpán, he is 50 years old and he looks after his children. He has been making a living as a farmer for the past several years.

The loan he received was used to buy farming supplies, such as seeds, organic materials, fungicide and fertilizers.

Thanks to the support from his wife and his children, he continues making progress with his work since it is the only way he can get ahead.

His dream is to expand the cultivated land, so he will make more money and be able to send his children to school for a better future, since education today is very important for a job. He is requesting this loan to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers for farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”.

El socio Roberto  sigue con su actividad de mototaxista, el socios quiere viajar seguro y dar un mejor servicio de transporte a sus clientes, por ello el solicito el préstamo para mejorar las condiciones de sus mototaxi.
Roberto necesita comprar gasolina y repuestos de mototaxi.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y asegura que cumplirá sus cuotas acordadas .
texts.en: This is a member of the “SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO” communal bank. Roberto still has his motorcycle taxi business. He wants to travel safely and provide his customers with a better transport service. For this reason, he is asking for the loan to improve the conditions of his motorcycle taxi. Roberto needs the loan to buy gasoline and motorcycle replacement parts. He is happy about the loan and promises that he will comply with his agreed-upon payments.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and motorcycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.pt:
A cliente Ermelinda, comerciante de 34  anos de idade, viúva e mãe  de 03 filhos, dos quais 01 a frequentar o ensino secundário , 02 no ensino primário. Vive  na casa própria e não sustenta a mais ninguém .
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar farinha, massa, óleo, leite condensado, ovos, arroz, fósforos, sardinhas, para reforçar o seu negocio, e comprar pintos ração vitaminas, vacinas .

A cliente tem como sonho concluir a sua casa, ver a sua família realizada, os filhos com nível superior  e  comprar um carro para lhe ajudar no seu negocio .
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar pretende tomar mais vezes para alcançar os seus sonhos, o credito anterior aplicou na produção agrícola
texts.en:
Ermelinda, is a 34-year-old businesswoman. She is a widow, and the mother of three children. One of them goes to secondary school, and two to primary school. She owns the house where she lives, and is not responsible for anyone else.

With the requested amount she will buy flour, pasta, cooking oil, condensed milk, eggs, rice, matches, and sardines to strengthen her business. She will also buy chicks, vitamins, and vaccines.

Her dreams are to finish building her house, see her family achieving their goals, see her children become professionals, and buy a car for her business.

Her main challenges are financial in nature, but she has continued working. She plans to apply for more loans to achieve her dreams. She used the previous loan for her agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy flour, pasta, cooking oil, condensed milk, eggs, rice, matches, and sardines to strengthen her business. She will also buy chicks, vitamins, and vaccines.

loans.name: Piedade

texts.pt:
A senhora Piedade é comerciante e auxiliar de limpeza, casada mãe 3 filhos todos a frequentar o ensino primário além destes sustenta também  sustenta 2 sobrinhos orfaos que vivem com ele vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar refrescos, arroz, farinha, acucar, feijao amendoim, cervejas para sua merceiaria no mercado local.
Planos para o futuro crescer no negócio satisfazendo as necessidades de seus clientes, ampliar a sua mercearia, reabilitar a sua casa,
Diz que com os emprestimos fez a mercearia pois antes vendia numa banca, comprou uma bicicleta e sustenta os filhos com os lucros deste negocio e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar o seu sonho.
texts.en:
Piedade is a businesswoman, and works as a housekeeper. She is married, and the mother of three children who go to primary school. She also maintains two nephews who lost their parents and live with her in a house she owns.

With the requested amount, she will buy beverages, rice, flour, sugar, beans, peanuts, and beer for the store she owns at the local market.

In the future, she plans to expand her business by satisfying her customers' needs, enlarge her store, and remodel her house.

She says that she opened the store with the previous loans; she used to sell her products in a stall before. She bought a bicycle and now maintains her children with the profits she makes from this business. She also says that she will apply for more loans to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy beverages, rice, flour, sugar, beans, peanuts, and beer for the store she has at the local market.

loans.name: Aracely Marilu

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Unidas.
En este lugar vive la señora Aracely, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de los padres. Ella lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para seguir adelante.
Doña Arecely es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos, gracias a los créditos que recibió del grupo ella pudo surtir una pequeña tienda en la casa de los padres,  allí empezó con muy poco y después con la ayuda de los otros créditos ha podido ir aumentando la variedad de productos, ella sabe que al brindar un mejor servicio su clientela aumenta y solo así ella puede salir adelante y ayudarles a sus padres ya que son de escasos recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the loan group Mothers United meet in the lowlands of Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of typical products such as the straw hats known within and outside of the country.

This is where Aracely lives. She is 32 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has been in the loan group for 3 cycles and she likes it for the help that it gives her with loans to move forward. 

Aracely is a woman who has always liked to work and attain her own resources. Thanks to the loans that she has received from the group, she was able to stock a small store in her parents' house. There she started with very little and later, with the help of the other loans, she has been able to continue improving the variety of products. She knows that if she offers the best service she will increase her customers and only then will she be able get ahead and help her parents who have limited resources. 

This loan is to buy provisions to stock her store. Her dream is to have a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase provisions.

loans.name: Maqsooda

texts.en:
Maqsooda is a 51-year-old widow woman. Five years ago, she started her own school. She has a dream to provide education with less fees in her community. Today, her school has over 142 students and 40% female students are benefited. She has financial constraints and cannot provide the school students with comfortable furniture and rooms.

In order to buy new furniture and to get construction work done, Maqsooda has requested a loan of PKR 100,000. She has worked hard to bring her school to the level it is at today and wants to continue to strive to make her school even better.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and pay for construction work.

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny is a married woman with six children, one of whom attends school. Fenny owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fenny has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Tsuishitoo 2 Group

texts.en:
Salomey is a mother of one child. Her business is selling kids wear at the market place. She has done this for ten years. She is responsible for paying school fees for her child.

She has challenges of little capital and competition. She desires to buy more clothing but lacks money to do so ahead of the festive season.

She is the group leader of Tsuishitoo 2, a group of four members.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell during the coming festive season.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Salisu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Salisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Salisu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Salisu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Salisu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Grupo Pala 2 Group

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre casado con 32 años de edad, tiene una familia de un hijo de 3 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad del caserío pala.
Manuel (él primero del lado izquierdo en la foto) es el representante del grupo  pala 2, él trabaja como  agricultor y su mayor producción es el café, con esta actividad lleva 10 años de realizarlo, gracias a sus años de experiencia a su cultivo ha logrado sacarle provecho.
Manuel con el afán de obtener una buena cosecha en esta temporada, está necesitado de un crédito pues el en este momento carece de dinero para poder comprar sus fertilizantes y pagar la el anhelo de Manuel es mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 32-year-old married man. He has a three-year-old son. He and his family live in a community within the rural area of Pala.

Manuel is the first person from the left in the picture. He represents Grupo Pala 2. He works as a farmer, growing mainly coffee. He has been in this business for ten years. Thanks to his years of experience, he has managed to make the most off his crops.

In order to obtain a good harvest this season, Manuel needs a loan so that he can buy fertilizer and pay for labor on his plantation. His desire is to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a Murabaha loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get a boost in her earnings to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently.

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been doing agriculture work for some years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Ambreen has applied for a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, with a Murabaha PKR loan.

loans.name: Misbah  Naz

texts.en:
Misbah Naz is a 32 year old unmarried man who has been running a school for the last year. After a year of struggle and hard work, today his school boasts over 161 students. He has always emphasized the quality of the education imparted at his school and goes to great lengths to ensure that the children at his school are learning.

He needs a loan of PKR 150,000 to buy chairs and desks for his students and to repair his existing furniture to provide his students with a comfortable learning environment. He believes the key to success is hard work, and that is something he is used to.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for his students and to repair his existing furniture to provide his students with a comfortable learning environment.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 46-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been actively running a ‘Tandoor’ in his locality for many years. A tandoor (clay oven) is used for cooking chapattis and naan especially in Pakistan. He cooks chapattis and naan with flour, salt and oil and then sells them to the people of his community. He also takes orders from nearby hotels and makes enough money to have a decent life.

For the improvement of her husband's business, Nasreen has applied for a Murabaha loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 31-year-old married mother of two. She decided two years ago to open her current clothes and home products selling shop to support her husband in covering their family's living needs.

Zahra's business combined with her husband's are barely covering their daily expenses. That's why she has to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for an urgent surgery she has to undergo.

She is working hard to develop her business too. This was obvious in her previous three loans acquired and paid back in such a way that she has a good-standing history with Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua.

loans.use: to pay for an urgent surgery she has to undergo.

loans.name: Mame Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré en Octobre 2015 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance a animé la rencontre du groupe.
 
Madame Mame Diarra, âgée de 45 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère 05 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de détails d’arachide et de produits alimentaires.
 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs d’arachide, 01 sac de riz, 01 sac de mil et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne, améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Recently inaugurated in October 2015, this banc villageois is composed of women from the same village who have joined the loan program in order to make their small businesses more profitable. In addition to vending, the group members also grow rain-fed crops. The group meeting was held in a friendly atmosphere. Ms. Mame Diarra, 45 years of age (the one standing on the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has five children. She retails peanuts and other food products. 

With her new loan, Mame Diarra plans to buy two bags of peanuts, one bag of rice, one bag of millet and other food products to retail in her village. Thanks to her revenues, she plans to bolster her savings and improve her family's life conditions.

loans.use: to buy two bags of peanuts, one bag of rice, one bag of millet and other food items to retail in her village.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Yungaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal "IMACULADA CONCEPCION DE YUNGAQUI II", ubicado en el departamento del Cusco.

El socio Juan Carlos es un socio trabajador que se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes y patos, el tiene 29 años y un hijo por quien velar, es por eso que día a día se dedica a su negocio con mucho empeño para que cumplir sus deseos y metas, de tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El socio solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz y alfalfa.  

Los demás socios  se dedican al negocio de transporte, al negocio de venta y compra de madera, a tienda de abarrotes , dar servicios de mecánico y aserraderos, entre otras actividades.

Los  socios  están muy contentos y agradecidos con los inversionistas de KIVA, por confiar en su  banco, se comprometen a cumplir puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank Inmaculada Concepcion de Yungaqui Ii, located in the department of Cusco.

Juan Carlos is one of its members. He is a hard worker who makes a living raising and selling small animals like Guinea pigs and ducks. He is 29 years old and has one child to care for, which is why he dedicates lots of effort to his business every day. He wants to achieve his goals and desires and have a better quality of life. He is requesting this loan to buy corn and alfalfa.

The rest of the members of this group work in different businesses: transportation, selling and buying wood, running a grocery store, providing mechanic's and sawing services, etc. They are all very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for having confidence in their communal bank. They promise to make all of their payments on time and comply with their terms.

loans.use: to buy corn and alfalfa.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth who is in her early 30's, is married with three children. Two of them are still in school and one is still small. She has been running two projects - a gengeduka (small shop) and selling fabrics for seven years now. She works from 7.30 pm to 08 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Elizabeth's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the gengeduka stock and to increase the stock of fabrics. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, bought bricks for building her house and covered household expenses.

loans.use: to increase stock in her gengeduka and to buy up-to-date fabrics to fulfil her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”.

La socia Carmen sigue dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores. Esta actividad lo realiza varios años, ella depende de esta actividad, por esta razón solicito el préstamo para comprar alimentos que incrementen la cantidad y calidad de sus animales.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz y alfalfa, para dar de comer a sus animalitos.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen continues to belong to the communal bank "San Juan de Ollantaytambo."

She continues to make a living raising small animals. She has been doing this work for several years. She relies on this work. This is why she requested the loan to buy foods that will elevate the quantity and quality of her animals.

Carmen requested the loan to buy corn and alfalfa to feed her little animals.

She is happy about the loan and promises to meet her instalment payment obligations.

loans.use: to buy corn and alfalfa.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from the village of Datag in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol province. She is 62 years old and is single. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately PHP 10,000 a month from these activities.

She is asking for a loan to buy sachets of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food and biscuits. She will also use the money to buy piglets and feed so she can start raising hogs.

Delia's previous loan was repaid back in full. She hope that her business will continue to flourish so she can support herself and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy sachets of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food, biscuits, feed and piglets.

loans.name: Gladys Candelaria

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Unidas.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad. El marido es agricultor.
Doña Gladys es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y al ver que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que el gana se decidió a emprender un negocio, ella  vende ropa en general, productos de Yanbal, Avon, Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes quieren algo,  deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante en ocasiones que su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 3 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son tener salud y salir adelante.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of typical products, such as straw hats and shawls known inside and outside of the country, the members of the Grupo De Crédito Mardres Unidas [United Mothers Credit Group] meet every 15 days.

Mrs. Gladys lives in this place. She is a 57 year old who lives in a free union, from which she has five grown children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Doña Gladys is a woman who likes to work and seeing that her husband does not earn enough decided to start a business, she sells clothes and Yanbal, Avon and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, accessories for ladies). She sells her products door to door and also sells from her house, when her customers want something she gives them her products on credit and collects every eight or fifteen days. She's spent more than 8 years working in this trade, which continues on occasions when her husband doesn't have work. 

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes. She's been through 3 cycles with the Credit Group and she likes it because thanks to the loans she finances her business. Her dreams are to be healthy and continue onward.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and clothes.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 28 years old. He is not married with 1 children.

He has had a services business for 1 year. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorbike and hopes this will help him to expand his business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his child to university."

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
This young lady is 24 years old, and she lives with her big family in Dilijan, a city in the Tavush region. Her name is Gayane and she is a graduate of the State Academy of Sciences, Faculty of Jurisprudence. Now she works at a private company as a lawyer.

Simultaneously with her work, Gayane is engaged in farming. She has a large family; she lives with her parents, brother, grandmother, and her aunt. On the farm, all of the work is equally divided among the family members. Gayane takes care of cows, calves, pigs and chickens.

With the help of her mother, Gayane sells her farm products such as milk, meat, macun (a dairy product) and eggs. She mentions that she is so happy to help and support her family with her work on the farm, which brings in some more income, albeit small, for their needs.

Now Gayane asks for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to purchase a lot of fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Daniel Orlando

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Unidas.
En este lugar vive el señor Daniel, tiene 36 años de edad, está divorciado y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad los mismos que estudian en la escuela y que aunque viven con la mamá dependen de él ya que es un padre muy responsable.
Don Daniel es un hombre muy trabajador que desde muy pequeño aprendió la elaboración de artesanías actividad que actualmente le permite ganarse la vida, el tiene un taller de artesanía, allí fabrica  todo tipo de figuras las mismas que elabora  con tagua, el fabrica llaveros, muñecos, collares, pulseras y muchas otras figuras que luego vende en otras ciudades como Guayaquil y en las playas de Manta donde la gente puede apreciar su arte y esto le permiten ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar tagua, pinturas y otros materiales para elaborar sus productos. Lleva 3 ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In "Los Bajos de Montecristi", a city known for its great variety of typical products such as Panama hats, which are recognised both nationally internationally, the "Madres Unidas" group meets every fortnight.

And it is here that 36-year-old Daniel lives. He is divorced and has two children, ages ten and five years old. Both attend school and, although they live with their mother, they also depend on Daniel, who is a very responsible father.

Daniel is very hard-working. From a young age he learned to make handicrafts, which now allows him to earn an income. He has a workshop where he produces goods using ivory palm. Daniel produces key fobs, dolls, necklaces, bracelets and many other products. He sells his products in cities such as Guayaquil, and on the beaches of Manta, where people appreciate his art and allow him to earn an income.

This loan will be used to buy ivory palm, paint and other materials for producing goods. Daniel has been with the group for three loan cycles and he likes it because the loans are distributed quickly. Daniel's dreams are to continue making improvements to his business.

loans.use: to buy ivory palm, paint and other materials.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en:
Mehnaz is a 29-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Mehnaz aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida was living a tough life some years ago. It was very difficult to bear her household expenditures, so she started a business selling milk for many years with the help of her son (also shown in the photo). She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Mwanangano

texts.en:
Mwanangano is a married mother of three children, all of whom do not attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Masama village. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Musa will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Musa now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members, and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dauda has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dauda will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Dauda is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maodo's Group

texts.fr:
Inaugurer en Octobre 2015 dans la place publique du village, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes qui habitent le même village et s’apprêtent à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce et l’agriculture. 

Madame Maodo, âgée de 45 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de graines d’arachides qu’elle achète dans son village et les villages environnants.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs d’arachide et 03 sacs de mil pour le revendre en détails dans son village et les marchés hebdomadaires.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider mon mari à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille (soins médicaux nourriture et scolarités des enfants).
texts.en:
Created in October 2015 in the village square, this local 'banc villageois' is comprised of women living in the same village who are preparing to start income-earning businesses. They form a network based on solidarity and mutual support.
They are small traders and farmers. Maodo, 45 years old (standing on the far right with one hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of four children. Her business is the trading of peanut seeds, which she buys both in her village and in the neighbouring ones. With this new loan, she plans to buy five sacks of peanuts and three sacks of meal - to resell in her village at the weekly markets. The profits will enable her to help her husband to meet the family's living expenses (medical care, food and the children's education).

loans.use: to buy five sacks of peanuts and three sacks of meal, to resell in the weekly markets in her village.

loans.name: Elias

texts.pt:
Vive maritalmente, tem 34 anos de idade, com nível básico escolar, pai de 1 filho ainda sem idade escolar, vive na casa própria e esta a repetir o crédito pela 4ª vez . É trabalhador dos Caminhos de Ferro e conta com ajuda da esposa que é negociante.  Com os créditos anteriores investiu na conclusão de sua obra e conseguiu se mudar para casa própria, pois antes vivia na casa de serviço. Conseguiu também comprar moveis. Com este pretende continuar com os acabamentos da sua casa comprando  cimento e areia.
Constituía seus sonhos a compra de uma viatura e já conseguiu realizar e agora pretende continuar a melhorar cada vez mais a sua vida com base nos recursos que ja conseguiu.
texts.en:
He lives in a common-law marriage. He is 34 years old and finished the basic levels of educations. He has a son who is not of school age yet, and lives in a house he owns. This is the fourth loan he applies for.

He works for a railroad company, and his wife, who is a businesswoman, helps him. He invested the previous loans in finishing building his house, and could move into his own house. He used to live in a house provided to him by his employer. He could also buy the furniture.

With this loan, he plans to finish building his house by buying cement and sand.

One of his dreams was to buy a vehicle, and he achieved it. He is now planning to improve his life more every day using the resources he already got.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Luz es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora ella se dedica al negocio de la venta de verduras.
la socia trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde donde expende sus productos como zanahorias, lechugas, tomates.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “San Juan de Ollantaytambo” , tiene  39 años de edad, su sueño de la socia es  progresar y ampliar su negocio.
rosa Luz solicito el préstamo para comprar zanahorias , tomates y lechugas.

La socia está contenta  con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante, agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas puntualmente
texts.en:
Rosa Luz is enterprising and hard-working. She makes a living selling vegetables.

Rosa works from 6am to 4pm, during which time she sells products such as carrots, lettuce and tomatoes.

Rosa is a member of the “San Juan de Ollantaytambo” communal bank. Her dream is to progress and expand her business.
