Rosa is applying for a loan in order to buy carrots, lettuce and tomatoes.

Rosa is happy with this loan because, with it, she will move forward. Rosa thanks Kiva investors and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes and lettuce.

loans.name: Raymundina

texts.es:
La socia Raymunda pertenece al banco comunal “San Juan de Ollantaytambo”, ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.

Raymunda tiene 31 años y una familia con la que quiere salir adelante, la socia se dedica a su tienda donde expende productos alimenticios por mayor como gaseosas y alimentos en general , su deseo es ampliar su negocio por fin de año.
La socia  solicito el préstamo para comprar aceite, azúcar y Gaseosas.

La socia está contenta y complacida con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
Raymunda belongs to the “San Juan de Ollantaytambo” communal bank. She is a hardworking and responsible person.

Raymunda is 31 years old and she hopes to get ahead with her family. She makes a living at her store where she sells wholesale food products, such as carbonated beverages and food in general. Her dream is to expand her business by the end of the year.

She is requesting a loan to buy oil, sugar and carbonated beverages.

Raymunda is happy and satisfied with the loan because this way she will continue moving forward. She promises to follow through with her loan agreement.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar and carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda sells food to the community of Clarin, Bohol. She has been doing this for nine years to support her family. She has four children; three adults and one-school-aged child. With this, she wants to improve her business to sustain and support her school-aged child.

And this is the reason why she is asking for a loan. She needs to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, sugar and powdered milk in order to operate her food selling business continuously. Other parts of her loan amount is to buy piglets and feed as well. Definitely, she also runs a hog raising business.

Erlinda dreams of uplifting their livelihood. She wants to have a better means of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil and sugar and also to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Unidas.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cinco hijos de 30, 28, 24, 19  y 17 años  de edad, cuatro de ellos aun viven en su casa y tres estudian en Universidad y  colegio. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante en los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa,  deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas, ella tiene muy buena clientela y son 10 años que lleva con esta actividad la cual le ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y zapatos de todo género. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así sale adelante y ayuda a su marido. Sus sueños son que sus  hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The city of Bajos de Montecristi is known for its great variety of traditional products such as the toquilla-straw hats, famous locally and abroad. This is where the members of the Madres Unidas [Mothers United] credit group meet every 15 days.

This is also where Maria lives. She is 49 years old, married, and has five children who are 30, 28, 24, 19 and 17 years old. Four of them still live at home and three are university or high school students. Her husband is a cabinet maker.

Maria is a very hard-working woman who likes to work so she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells all kinds of clothing and shoes, selling door-to-door and also from her house, extending credit and collecting every week. She has been doing this for ten years and has very good customers. This has helped her get ahead.

This loan is so she can buy pants, shirts, blouses, and shoes of all types. She has been with the credit group since it was formed and she likes it because this is how she gets ahead and helps her husband. Her dream is for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and shoes.

loans.name: Carmen Nicacia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Madres Unidas.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen,  tiene 41  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  cuatro  hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 13 años, todos sus hijos estudian dos en universidad y dos en colegio. Su esposo es chofer. 
Doña Carmen es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo y su  forma de venta es puerta a puerta, por lo general siempre le gusta vender la mercadería que este de temporada ya que es la que se vende más rápido y mejoran sus ganancias,  trabaja casi todos los días ya sea en la mañana o en la noche. Tiene 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual puede ganar sus recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa interior y otras prendas. Tiene tres ciclos en el grupo de crédito, le gusta porque los  créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda para ella. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the loan group Mothers United meet in the lowlands of Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of typical products such as straw hats known within and outside of the country.  

This is where Carmen lives. She is 41 years old, is married, and has 4 children with her husband. Two of them are older, and two are 16 and 13 years old. All of her children study: two of them in university and two in school. Her husband is a chauffeur. 

Carmen is a housewife and in order to earn her own resources to help her husband with household expenses and the cost of their children's studies, she works as a merchant. She sells all kinds of clothes door to door. In general she likes to sell merchandise that is in season since that's what sells faster and improves her income. She works almost every day, whether in the morning or in the evening. She has been doing this for 15 years and earns income with it. 

This loan is to purchase pants, blouses, underwear and other garments. She has been with this loan group for three cycles and she likes it because the loans are fast and help her a lot. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, underwear and other garments.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a single woman with no children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale

loans.name: Rossinah

texts.en:
Rossinah is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a maize farmer from Gwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Hassan is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Hassan can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hassan no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Hassan hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ngaakoom Group

texts.en:
Judith, age 30, resides in Teshie-Mangoase province. She is married and has three children. In order to make a living, she sell wigs and cosmetics. The lack of working capital is a challenge to her business.

In the Ngaakoom Group of three members, Judith is the leader. This is her fourth cycle with ID-Ghana. Her past loan enabled her to buy enough stock to support her trade. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy many wigs and cosmetics for the service to her customers. She hopes she will earn more income from the trade to improve their standard of living and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy many wigs and cosmetics for the service to her customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 58-year-old farmer from Radeni village, Ungheni region. She’s a widow and works also part time as a chef at a café in Ungheni. She has been dealing in viticulture for five years, grows 500 cuttings of grapes and she harvests about three tones of grapes every year. The money earned from selling grapes is a good addition at Maria’s incomes.

But the grapevine is old and gives a small productivity. And Maria decided to renovate it to harvest more grapes. As result she will can earn more money and will improve her living conditions.

Maria will use this loan to purchase 500 cuttings of grapes.

loans.use: to purchase grape cuttings.

loans.name: Future Primary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sunday. He is the Director of Future Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Bulenga in Wakiso with 200 students.

Future Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Future Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sunday ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 55-year-old, married woman who has been running a school for the last seven months. She has great enthusiasm to serve community children and is determined to be successful. She has the passion to provide a quality education to her students.

Currently, she has 56 percent female students; whereas, in total, 121 students are enrolled. Khalida has the desire to expand by enrolling more students. A loan of PKR 100,000 will allow her to buy furniture and assets to provide a comfortable learning environment.

Khalid's goal is to continue running this school for the long run and to expand by enrolling more students.

loans.use: to buy furniture and assets to provide a comfortable learning environment.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Jovem empreendedor, de 27 anos de idade, pai de familia com 1 filho ainda bebe, tem 12ª classse formado como serralheiro e já esta a por em pratica o que aprendeu pois, abriu um estabelecimento onde presta servicos de seralharia e carpintaria e emprega 2 pessoas. vive na casa propria e esta a repetir o credito pela segunda vez, com o primeiro conseguiu construir estabelecimento de venda de vidros e melhorar os seus serviços. 
Com o presente credito pretende comprar material de construcao para revender como, cimento, pranchas, varroes, vidros, etc.
Seu sonho é de construir uma oficina de carpintaria e poder prestar melhores serviços e melhorar sua vida.
Seu maior desafio é o mercado para o seu negocio, pois está numa zona em vias de desenvolvimento e ainda não tem grande população consumidora de seus servicos.
texts.en:
He is a young entrepreneur. He is 27 years old, and the father of a little baby. He studied up to the 12th grade, and specialized in Locksmithing. He is now applying his knowledge; he started a business offering locksmith and carpentry services. He has two employees. He lives in a house he owns, and this is the second loan he applies for. With the first one, he could open a glass store, and improve his services.

With this loan, he plans to buy construction materials for resale, such as cement, boards, columns, and glass.

His dream is to build a carpenter's workshop, improve his services, and improve his living conditions. His biggest challenge is the place where he lives, since it is a developing area and there not enough people who uses his services.

loans.use: to buy cement, boards, columns, glass, etc.

loans.name: Fatou Cheikh's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé en Octobre 2015 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement est composé de femmes qui jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou Cheikh (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée 30 ans, mariée et mère 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente des  friperies qu’elle achète dans la capital.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter de la friperie, 10des chaussures et une quinzaine de jupes pour venir le revendre dans son village en détails.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer à la prise en charge de sa famille (soins médicaux, nourriture, habillement, scolarité etc.…) et renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created in October 2015 through an inauguration process. The group comprises women who get along well and have a good team spirit.
Their principal business is small trading. Fatou Cheikh (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children.
Her business is selling secondhand clothing which she buys in the capital. With this new loan, she plans to buy secondhand clothing, some shoes and fifteen or so dresses - to bring and sell in the village.
With the profits, she plans to participate in financing the family's living expenses (medical costs, food, clothing, education etc....) and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing, some shoes and fifteen or so dresses to bring and sell in her village.

loans.name: Po Joyju Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Po Joayu es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, están trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una poniendo su mayor esfuerzo por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Soriana quien se dedica a la venta de comestible y, también se debe destacar el trabajo de todas las integrantes que se esfuerzan y se ayudan las unas a las otras. Soriana tiene muchos clientes ya que sus comidas gustan mucho.
La Sra. Soriana pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, panificados, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su emprendimiento y teniendo de esta manera los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Po Joayu is from the city of Caaguazú. The members are working in the elimination of poverty program, each one making her best effort to be able to grow and get ahead. One of the members is Soriana, who makes a living by selling food. The work of all of the members who make an effort and help each other should also be recognized.

Soriana has a lot of customers since people like her food a lot. Soriana is asking for this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her foods, like meat, condiments, bread and other items. In this way she will be able to continue with her business and have this means of earning money to help her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food, like meat, condiments, bread and other items.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley estudia para poder ser alguien el día de mañana, poder terminar su facultad, y trabajar para poder salir adelante con su familia y sus hijos. Estudia la carrera de administración agropecuaria, y por medio de sus estudios quiere ir abriéndose camino.
Ella comenta que pude este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Shirley is studying so that she can become someone in the future, to complete her college course, and to be able to get ahead with her family and children. She is studying for a degree in agricultural administration, and hopes to make opportunities for herself through her studies.

She says that this loan is to pay her fees, so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es estudiante de la carrera de Genética Animal está cursando el 1er año. Comenta que le gusta mucho la carrera que escogió, por ello pone todo su esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder abonar cuotas de su universidad y comprar algunos libros. Su aspiración es seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos profesionales al terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Luz is from the city of Encarnación, is a student of Animal Genetics and is in her first year. She mentions that she likes the major she chose so she puts all of her effort into her studies. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay university fees and to buy some books. Her aspiration is to continue enriching her professional understanding upon finishing her coursework.

loans.use: to pay university fees and to buy some books.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 26-year-old businessman from Kenya. He is single, and for the last two years he has been in this business doing well.

This is his second time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase more stock and the anticipated profit to repay his loan. He hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to increase his stock.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Martin is a 31-year-old man from Kisumu, married and supporting six people in his family. He operates a motorcycle transport, a business he has been operating for the last five years. He makes a monthly income of KES 40,000.

He has applied for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase a new tracker to help him secure the motorcycle from theft.

loans.use: to purchase a new tracker to help him secure the motorcycle from theft.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
In Tsovagyugh, a village in the Gegharkunik region, lives Arevik with her husband and two sons. Her husband works as a constructor. Their older son is a student and their smaller son is school-aged.

Arevik and her husband have a nice farm, which is the main and constant source of income for the family. On the farm they have a cow, a calf, a heifer, sheep and chickens.

Aarevik’s husband, who is a master in construction work, started repairing their house, and he managed to do the main part of it very nicely and skillfully. There is still some work left to do because they lack the money needed to finish it.

Therefore, Arevik is asking for this loan of 400,000 Armenian drams (AMD) as this will help her family to finally finish the repair work on their house, making it nicer and more comfortable than before.

loans.use: to finish the repair work on their house, making it nicer and more comfortable than before.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer from Galadima Village. As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Kabiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Kabiru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Nuhu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lusoose School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Samuel. He is the head teacher of Lusoose School, a mixed school with 300 students in the urban area of Kawempe in Kampala. Lusoose School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have consistent access to clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Lusoose School will repay its loan from its school fees, which it collects each term. Samuel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza vive en la ciudad de Itá con sus padres, trabaja como Niñera en una casa de familia hace 3 años, su padre es comerciante y la madre trabaja como Empleada Doméstica.
Liza está cursando el 4to año de la carrera de Contabilidad y comenta que su mayor anhelo es terminar su carrera y así poder conseguir un trabajo digno.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de sus útiles de universidad, de manera a poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Liza lives in the city of Itá with her parents. She has worked as a nanny in a family home for three years. Her father is a trader and her mother works as a domestic helper.

Liza is studying in her fourth year of an accounting degree, and says that her greatest desire is to finish her degree and obtain a decent job.

She is requesting this loan to cover the costs of her university supplies, so that she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy university supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma continua con sus estudios de administración de empresas, por medio de su carrera quiere ser una profesional util que ayude a las demás personas, y comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para poder cubrir parte de sus gastos de titulacion. 
Ella es una persona muy dedicada que lucha y se esmera cada día. Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir la totalidad de sus gastos de titulacion y agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Norma is studying business administration. In her career, she wants to be a professional who helps other people. She notes that her previous loan was a great help in covering part of her educational expenses.

She is a very dedicated person with a fighting spirit who tries her best. She is requesting this new loan to be able to cover all of her educational expenses. She is thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: pay educational expenses.

loans.name: Dalma

texts.es:
Dalma esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser una buena bioquímica, y por medio de sus estudios poder ser una profesional útil, no solo a si misma, sino también a las demás, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar los gastos de su universidad, los que le fueron muy útiles.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Dalma is putting forth her best effort to be able to be a good Biochemist, and through her studies to be able to be a useful professional, not only for herself but for everyone else. She says that she used her last loan to pay the costs of her university, which was very useful. 

She is asking for this new loan to be able to pay the fees of her courses and to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Djie's Group

texts.fr:
Inaugurer en Octobre 2015 dans la place publique du village, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes qui habitent le même village et s’apprêtent à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce et l’agriculture. 

Madame Dye, âgée de 48 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de le commerce de détails de produits alimentaires (thé, sucre huile etc.…).

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac de sucre, 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffiné du thé et d’autres condiments qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails dans son village

Les bénéfices serviront à participer à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et renforcer son  activité.
texts.en:
Created in October 2015 in the village square, this local 'banc villageois' is comprised of women living in the same village who are preparing to start income-earning businesses. They form a network based on solidarity and mutual support.They are small traders and farmers.

Dye, 48 years old (standing on the far right with one hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of four children.
Her business is the retail selling of foodstuffs (tea, sugar, oil etc....).

With this new loan, she plans to buy one sack of sugar, a 20 litre bottle of oil, estate tea and other condiments which she buys in the weekly markets - to resell in her village.

The profits will enable her to participate in family's living expenses and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of sugar, a 20 litre bottle of oil and some estate tea.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 43-year-old lady, married and blessed with 3 children who attend school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development and financial management.

Francisca operates a cereals shop. She also does poultry farming. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy more cereals hence add stock to her cereal store. This will enable her to meet her customer’s demands hence earn more income. With increased income, she will be able to provide a balanced diet for her family and also pay tuition fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more cereals hence add stock to her cereal store for increased income to provide better food to her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Magaji is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Magaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for such items as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Magaji will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price, a premium up to 37 percent more than the price at harvest.

With the possibility of earning up to $2000 per hectare of land, Magaji now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en:
Ishaku is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. With a good harvest this season, Ishaku has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for such items as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ishaku can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37 percent more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ishaku will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ishaku is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Julie Ernestine

texts.fr:
48 ans, Ernestine est veuve depuis 2012. Elle est mère de deux grands enfants Ils ne vont plus à l'école, l'ainé fait des petits boulots et le second l'aide dans l'exercice de son activité.
Elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche pendant 22 ans et était en chômage technique en 2010. Elle dirige un petit magasin général et vend des charbons de bois pour gagner sa vie. Elle choisissait le commerce à cause de son niveau d'éducation très bas et son âge un peu avancé. Le prêt va lui permettre de ravitailler les stocks de charbons et des marchandises générales. Le magasin général se trouve juste à gauche du stand des charbons de bois. Les charbons de bois sont mis en sac en jute. Son objectif est de développer et étendre ses activités pour pouvoir laisser un minimum de patrimoine à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ernestine is 48 years old and has been a widow since 2012. She is the mother of two grown children, who no longer go to school. The eldest works in small jobs, while the second helps Ernestine with her work.

Ernestine was working in an economic zone for 22 years and then became technically unemployed from 2010. She [then started] running a small general store to sell charcoal to earn a living. She has chosen this business because she has a low level of education and she is quite old.

This loan is going to allow her to increase her stock of charcoal and other general goods. Her general store is to the left of the charcoal stand, which she is standing in front of (the charcoal is covered by straw pieces). Her goal is to develop and expand her business so her children will have some sort of inheritance.

loans.use: to buy dried vegetables, cassava, corn, pistachios, soap, and 45 sacs of charcoal.

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en:
Zakariya is maize farmer from Jalawa Village. As a member of Babban Gona, Zakariya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Zakariya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Zakariya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Zakariya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and ultimately hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Diariatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place en Octobre 2015 et est composé de membres ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et habitant toute le même village et exerçant comme principale activité le petit commerce. 

Madame Diariatou (debout à droite avec une main levée), est la représentante  du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 25 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle  s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (riz, huile, sucre et du lait) qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la localité.

 Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac de 50 kg de riz, 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffiné, 01 carton de 100 sachet de lait de 22,5 g et du lait pour le revendre en détails dans son village. 

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte renforcer ses épargnes et améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et scolaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in October 2015 and is made up of members with good social cohesion, all living in the same village and all principally small traders.
Diariatou (standing on the right with one hand raised) is the group's representative. She is 25 years old and married with five children. Her business is the sale of foodstuffs (rice, oil, sugar and milk) which she buys at her local weekly markets.
With this loan, she plans to buy one 50 kg sack of rice, one 20 litre bottle of refined oil, a carton containing 100 x 22.5g sachets of milk, and some milk - all to sell in retail quantities in her village.

With her profits, she plans to increase her savings and to improve the family's health, education and living standards.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, refined oil, milk sachets and milk for resale in the village.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es estudiante de la carrera de derecho está cursando el 2do año, comenta que su sueño siempre ha sido ser una buena abogada que ayude a las demás personas.
Maria es una persona muy sacrificada que se esmera por poder mejorar cada día y cumplir sus anhelos.
 El préstamo lo solicita para abonar cuotas de la carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Maria is a student in her second year of law school. She says that her dream has always been to be a good lawyer who helps other people. Maria is a very hardworking person who strives to be able to improve each day and to achieve her dreams. She is asking for the loan to pay for her tuition expenses so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university fees

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
El señor Leonor tiene 45 años, está casado y vive en la ciudad de Ybycuí, comenta que  siendo joven se dedicaba a la profesión de chofer, fue juntando su dinero y tras haberse casado, junto con su esposa y abrieron una despensa, hoy en día tiene gran cantidad de productos y clientela formada.
El pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, bebidas, enlatados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Leonor is aged 45, married, and lives in the city of Ybycuí. He says that when he was young he worked as a chauffeur and saved his money, so once he got married, he opened a grocery store with his spouse. Nowadays he has a large quantity of products and an established clientele.

He is requesting this loan to buy goods to stock his store, such as vegetables, fruit, drinks and canned goods, among other things. This way he will be able to continue with his sales as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy goods for his store, such as vegetables, fruit, drinks and canned goods, among other things.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: Fidel is a 51-year-old man living in Tubigon, Bohol with his family. He supports them through buri weaving. Buri is known as the largest palm in the Philippines; it has various uses such as bags, mats, and native hats. Sometimes it is used for costumes in dance contests and some activities. Fidel has been doing this business for 11 years. He is asking for a loan to help him buy more buri leaves. In this way, he will be able to improve his earnings and augment his profit.

loans.use: to buy buri leaves.

loans.name: Melque

texts.en: Melque, 44, is married and the mother of four children. She is working as a fish dealer. As a fish dealer, she sells fish to other fish vendors in the community of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. Her husband works as a laborer and farmer. They both strive to make enough to cover all the needs of their household. She plans to use the loan to buy a basin where she will temporarily store the fish, a styrofoam box to preserve the fish with some ice, and fresh fish. This will help her make the most of her time doing business. Melque is a strong and determined woman who dreams of the best for her family. She would like to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to  buy a basin, a styrofoam box, and fresh fish.

loans.name: Gesila

texts.en:
Gesila and her family live in the small town of Catigbian, Bohol. She is 58 years old, married, and has five children: four adults and one school-aged child. Her husband works hard as a farmer, while Gesila is engaged in basket making. She has been proficiently doing this business for 12 years.

Gesila is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for making baskets; specifically, she will use rattan stem (rattan is a tropical palm). In the future, Gesila is determined to improve their livelihood for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (specifically, rattan stem) to make baskets.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a single mother who supports one person in her family. She operates a grocery store, a business she has been doing for the last two years. It generates a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more vegetables for resale. She will plow the anticipated profit back into the business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen has been involved in retailing bottle containers for seven years. He purchases bottles in Artik town and resells them in Yerevan and Abovyan town markets. Armen organizes the sales using his own truck, and he already has a big network and partners in this business.

He requested this loan to be able to purchase 18,000 bottle containers and sell them to customers.

He would be very grateful to receive this support and to invest in his business. Armen lives with his retired mother, his wife, and two minor children, and he is the only worker in the family.

loans.use: to purchase 18,000 bottle containers and sell them to customers, thus generating income for his family's living.

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en: Rudik is 62 years old and he lives in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. He has a higher polytechnic education and is employed.  For many years he worked at various workshops as a leading specialist. Rudik is married and he has a son who works as a manager. His wife is a doctor with higher education and perfect qualifications.  Rudik has some health problems that cause him discomfort, and he has some anxiety. He asks for this loan of 1,400,000 Armenian drams with great hope that with the help of this he will manage to pass his medical exam and finally solve his health problem.

loans.use: to pass his medical exam and finally solve his health problem.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 47-year-old divorced woman. She lives in Gori district with her pensioner mother. Eliza worked in Turkey as a housekeeper, and now she is unemployed. She wants to start a trading business and needs money to purchase clothes.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $3500. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes, which she will resell at a higher price. Eliza will earn a stable income and will be able to improve the living conditions for her pensioner mother. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to sell clothes.

loans.name: Tilape

texts.en:
Tilape is 20 years old and lives in Lusaka, Zambia. Lusaka is one of the fastest-changing cities in Southern Africa, but it also has some of the world’s most abject poverty. Tilape has just completed training with Zoona to finally make her dream of running her own business come true, and she needs a loan to make her dream a reality.

When Tilape finished her high school education in 2013, she would have loved to go to college, but her mother did not have the funds to pay for her tuition. Tilape describes herself as a hard worker who has passed through a lot of ups and downs in her life. She says this makes her very strong and focused in whatever she applies herself to.

Tilape will use this loan to start a business of mobile money transfers by purchasing a trading kiosk, which she can use to serve her customers. She will also use the money to buy a mobile phone, which she will use to facilitate transactions. Tilape explains how running her own business will give her the opportunity to improve her family’s basic needs. This prospect excites her, and she cannot wait to begin operating her very own Zoona mobile money outlet. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Desde los ocho años de edad, Marcial tuvo que cambiar sus libros por una pala y unas cuantas semillas para sembrar en el terreno que era de su padre y así poder sustentar la comida de su hogar. Ahora a sus 42 años de edad tiene su propia familia y su terreno, donde se apasiona sembrando maíz, frijoles y trigo. Y viaja en temporadas a un país vecino para aumentar los ingresos del hogar. 
En estos momentos Marcial solicita un préstamo para comprar dos quintales de urea, 10 litros de refrescantes, dos quilos de abono y pagar a los trabajadores. Esto le permitirá tener mejores resultados en su producción y ofrecer productos de calidad. En sus planes está comprar vacas y más terreno para así incursionar en el mundo de la ganadería.
texts.en:
Marcial had to exchange his books for a shovel and some seeds at the age of 8 to sow the land that belonged to his father so he could grow food for his household. Now he's 42 and he has his own family and land, where he's passionate about growing corn, beans, and wheat. He also travels seasonally to a neighboring country to increase his household income.

At the moment Marcial's requesting a loan to buy 2 quintals of urea, 10 liters of stimulants, and 2 kilograms of soil amendments, and to pay the workers. This will allow him to have better results with his crops and to offer quality products.

Among his plans is to buy cows and more land so he can get into ranching.

loans.use: to buy 2 quintals of urea, 10 liters of stimulants, and 2 kilograms of soil amendments, and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a maize farmer from Jaki village. As a Babban Gona member, Esther is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Esther would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for such items as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Esther can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize, a premium of up to 37 percent higher than the price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Esther no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Esther hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru:
26-летняя Садбарг проживает на районе Муминобод. У нее прекрасная семья: любимый муж и трое замечательных детей в возрасте 7, 3 и 2 лет. Они живут очень скромно. Ее муж работает мастером по ремонту домов. Сама Садбарг обладает мастерством кройки и шитья. Уже на протяжении 3 года она занимается пошивом женских платьев национального стиля. Садбарг любит свою деятельность и хорошо справляется с ней. По ее словам ей удобно шить на дому, так как она дополнительно может делать работу по домашнему хозяйству и присматривать за детьми. Садбарг хочет приобрести новую швейную машинку, по причине, что ее нынешняя машинка старая и не в рабочем состоянии. 
В данный момент Садбарг начинает долгожданный ремонт в доме, чтобы улучшить условия проживания семьи.  Она видит, что нет средств для покупки новой швейной машинки и поэтому обратилась за кредитом. Ваша поддержка им сейчас очень важна.
texts.en:
Sadbarg is 26 and lives in the Muminobod region. She has a wonderful family: a beloved husband and three splendid children aged seven, three and two. They live very modestly. Her husband works in construction, renovating homes, and she is skilled at cutting and sewing. She has been sewing women's dresses in the local style for three years. She loves her occupation and manages it very well. In her words, it is convenient for her to sew at home since she can keep up with her housework and care for the children at the same time.

Sadbarg wants to get a new sewing machine because her current one is old and no longer working. She is currently beginning long-awaited home renovations to improve her family's living conditions. She sees she doesn't have the money to buy a new sewing machine and therefore is looking for a loan. Your support is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Dúo Guadalupe De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Guadalupe de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Hermelinda de 59 años de edad, es casada, vive al lado de su esposo y su hijo quien está  estudiando el último año de su carrera.  Se dedica al bordado y tejido de güipiles típicos y también tiene una venta de ropa típica usada y nueva en el mercado.   Su sueño es tener un puesto propio ya que no lo tiene y así vender mucho para tener ganancias y ayudar a su hijo para poder graduarse en sus estudios.  Ella se ve en la necesidad de pedir otro préstamo ya que tiene pedido de güipiles y los hilos que tienen no le alcanza.  Ella nos dice que utiliza 6 colores de hilos y cada caja cuesta Q. 300.00 c/u. Les da muchas gracias por el apoyo que le dan y les desea muchas bendiciones.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe de San Pedro Duo

The person in charge of this group is Hermelinda, who is 59 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her son, who is in the last year of his university courses. She works embroidering and weaving traditional blouses, and also selling new and used traditional clothing in the market. Her dream is to have her own shop because she does not have one, and with it she would be able to sell more, earn more income, and help her son to graduate. She needs another loan because she has orders to fill for blouses and does not have enough thread. She says that she uses 6 colors of thread and each box costs 300 quetzals. She is very thankful to lenders for their support, and wishes many blessings on them.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional woven fabrics.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khadijah

texts.en:
Khadijah is a Lebanese married woman. She is 41 years old and the mother of six school-aged children. She is a housewife, focusing on her family and children. Her husband works hard to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life.

Khadijah at this period is in real need of a little help from Kiva. She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that she is happy that she will be able to ensure them an appropriate education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 36-year-old, Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and four children, three of whom are still attending school.

Since 2005, Layla has provided her family with extra financial support, through her work in the agriculture sector.

She is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l. to purchase new merchandise and agriculture tools, such as seeds and seedlings for planting. Her loan will help her improve her productivity. These changes will increase her returns and result in higher profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise and agriculture tools, such as seeds and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer from Dukko village. As a Babban Gona member, Nuhu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Nuhu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nuhu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Nuhu hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Sani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

Ishaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, Fatuma has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour,  and cooking fat

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es:
Ella es Nubia, es una mujer de 66 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, inicio el negocio por necesidad económica, ella vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos ya mayores de edad, trabaja por vivir tranquilamente, no está interesada en grandes riquezas, busca la tranquilidad.
Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer seria, humilde, trabajadora, aseada, junto con su esposo reúnen los recursos para pagar sus cuentas, vive feliz y lucha por mantener ese estilo de vida.
La cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para aumentar su producción para poder atender la demanda de fin de año.
El dinero lo invertirá en panes, salchichas, papas, salsas, aceite, enseres plásticos, servilletas, vasos, refrescos, arepas, frutas, verduras, entre otros productos para preparar comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
This is Nubia, a 66-year-old woman who works selling fast foods. She started the business out of financial need. She lives with her partner with whom she has five grown children. She works to live peacefully. She is not interested in great wealth; she seeks tranquility.

She describes herself as being a serious, humble, hardworking and orderly woman. She and her husband combine their resources to pay their bills. She lives a happy life and struggles to maintain that lifestyle.

The client is requesting a loan to increase her production to accomodate the year's end demand. Funds will be used to invest in breads, sausages, potatoes, sauces, oil, plastic utensils, napkins, glasses, beverages, corn cakes, fruits and vegetables among other things to prepare quick meals.

loans.use: invest in breads, sausages, potatoes, sauces, oil, plastic utensils, napkins, glasses, beverages, corn cakes, fruit, and vegetables for the year-end season.

loans.name: Emmanual

texts.en:
Emmanual is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Emmanual is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Emmanual would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Emmanual will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Emmanual now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Jibir can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price, at a premium of up to 37 percent higher than the price at harvest.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Alh. Jibir hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Vanadzor town, living with his wife and son.

He owns a big truck and has been providing transportation services for already 16 years. Ashot works with local sand mining companies and most recently received orders from them.

By requesting this loan, Ashot needs to purchase 6 tires and renovation of the truck to continue providing transportation services.

He would be very grateful to receive lenders' support and improve the business that helps him to support his family living for already 16 years.

loans.use: to pay for 6 tires and renovation of the truck to continue providing transportation services.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village. As a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Hussaini is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hussaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing.

As a Babban Gona member, Hussaini can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% above the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hussaini no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to USD 2,000 per hectare of land, Hussaini hopes to realize better yields and he plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jose Obed

texts.es:
15 años de experiencia tiene el señor Obed en la elaboración de arepas, experiencia que lo certifica como un empresario serió comprometido y luchador que durante ese tiempo ha manteniendo a su familia gracias a su humilde negocio que año tras año crece gracias a las buenas recomendaciones de sus clientes.
Tiene una familia conformada por 4 hijos de 15, 12, 6, 5 años de edad, es felizmente casado, les brinda techo, alimentación educación.
Obed se encuentra solicitando un préstamo que le permita mejorar las ventas, y aumentar su producción y lo más importante sacarle bastante provecho a la temporada de fin de año, el dinero será utilizado en la compra de enseres para la cocina y maíz en cantidades.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando por su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida tanto como le sea posible.
texts.en:
Obed has 15 years of experience making arepas, which qualifies him as a serious, committed, and persevering entrepreneur. He has supported his family all this time thanks to his modest business, which grows year after year because of his customers' good referrals.

He has four children, ages 15, 12, 6, and 5, and he's happily married. He provides them with a roof, food, and an education.

Obed's requesting a loan so he can improve his sales, increase his production, and, above all, make the most of the end-of-the-year season. He'll use the money to buy kitchen essentials and corn in bulk.

His dream is to keep on working for his family and improve his quality of life as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy kitchen essentials and corn in bulk to make arepas in large quantities

loans.name: Seher

texts.en:
Seher is married with two children. She decided to open a fast food shop when her husband was unemployed. When her husband went to work abroad, the shop was left totally to her and she began to run it alone. Even though she had a lot of experience she dreaded it at first but after running the shop for five years, Seher is very pleased with her situation. With her first loan she'll buy supplies for the shop.

Her dream is to open a restaurant and for her children to study and go places.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Seher Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Eşinin işsiz kalması ile bir şeyler yapmak isteyen Seher Hanım fast food dükkanı açmaya karar vermişler. Eşinin yurt dışına çalışmaya gitmesi ile dükkan tamamen Seher Hanıma kalır ve tek başına işletmeye başlar. İlk başlarda çok acemilik çekse de yılmayarak çok çalışır. Beş yıldır dükkanını işleten Seher Hanım bugün geldiği durumdan çok memnun. Aldığı ilk kredi ile dükkanına malzeme alacak. Hayali çocuklarının okuyup iyi bir yerlere gelmesi ve restoran açmak.

loans.use: to buy products for her fast food restaurant.

loans.name: Sarayya Yohanna

texts.en:
Sarayya is a maize farmer from Dukko village. As a Babban Gona member, Sarayya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs, which will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

As a Babban Gona member, Sarayya can store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season, when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sarayya no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Sarayya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to buy improved machinery and hire skilled labor.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ousongado Group

texts.fr: Lékiatou, est une femme âgée de 36 ans mariée mère de 02 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 10 ans dans la gestion de son kiosque. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est  son dynamisme, son courage, sa bonne relation envers ses clients, elle tient son lieu de commerce très propre. Son fort c'est la diversification de ses repas. Elle veut le prêt pour s'acheter des caisses de bierre à 60 000 f, 2 cartons d’éperon à 60 000 cfa, 2 cartons de spaghetti à 40 000 f cfa. L'utilité du prêt c'est de pouvoir s’approvisionner afin de renforcer son activité. Elle à reçu le prêt deux fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Lékiatou is a 36 year old married woman, and the mother of two children.
She has run her kiosk for ten years already. The business works well because of her courage and dynamic personality, the good relations she has with her customers, and the high level of cleanliness of her workspace.
Her strength is the variety of her meals. She is seeking the loan to buy some cases of beer for 60,000f, two boxes of Eperon spirit for 60,000f and two boxes of spaghetti for 40,000f.

The loan is useful to allow her to make the purchases, in order to strengthen her business. She has received two previous loans which were reimbursed on time.

loans.use: to purchase cases of beer, two boxes of Eperon spirit, and two boxes of spaghetti.

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en:

With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ummaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ummaru can store his maize and sell it in the future, for up to 37% above the market price at harvest.

Ummaru is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ihuriroryababyeyi Group

texts.en:
Adelle, who is holding the book in the picture above, is the president of the Ihuriroryababyeyi Group. She has worked with Vision Finance Company since 2010 to develop her business, and she is happy to report that she is a repeat client, which shows her diligence and commitment.

Adelle is a 48-year-old married mother of two children between the ages of 17 and 19 years. She has owned and operated a goat selling business, selling goats to the community where she stays. This enterprise requires her to work from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day and still manage her household.

Adelle has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her goat business by purchasing more goats to sell. She intends to use the profits from her business to save for the future, to pay school fees for her children, to buy new clothes for the family, and to buy four cows.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell.

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Jonaliza is a 33-year-old woman from Clarin, Bohol. She is married with two young children. The oldest child is five years old, while the youngest child is three years old. Her husband went to another country to earn more, while Jonaliza is engaged in direct selling business.

She buys and sells products from personal collections, such as Avon and Natasha (a company that sells beauty and cosmetics, fit and trendy products, apparels and home care products).

Jonaliza wishes to improve this business for her children. She wants them to finish their studies in the future, thus, she is requesting an amount to help her operate her business continuously.

She will use the money to buy products such as cosmetics, beauty soap, fragrances, lotion, shirts, underwear, shoes, sandals, and home care products such as bathroom cleaner, laundry soap and toiletries.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, beauty soap, home care products, etc.

loans.name: Basiledes

texts.en:
Basiledes is 48 years old, from Jagna, Bohol. She is a single mother with an eight-year-old son, whom she raises alone.

Basiledes works hard for the needs of her child. She cooks suman, as shown in the photo, spread on the table to dry. Suman is a snack made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and is often steamed, wrapped in banana leaves. It is usually eaten sprinkled with sugar or dipped in caramelized sugar.

Basiledes is asking for a loan to buy more sugar and sticky rice. She has repaid her previous loan in full. By this time, she plans to continue to work hard, so she can produce more suman, increase her sales, and pay her dues. Her income will be for her son's education and food for the two of them.

loans.use: to buy sugar and sticky rice.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel has various businesses. She has run a sari-sari store for 7 years, sells charcoal ,and raises pigs.

Lucel is a married woman with five children ages 16, 11, 7, 5 and 4 years old. Her husband works hard as a tricycle driver to provide the needs of their children and give them a good education.

Lucel asks for a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, sugar, salt, powdered chocolate drinks, juice, soft drinks and liquor. She will also buy additional piglets and feed. She and her husband will enhance their livelihood and improve their earnings.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, sugar, salt, powdered chocolate drinks, juice and drinks. She will also buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and transportation in her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, a sack of beans and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, a sack of beans  and cooking fat for her food selling business.

loans.name: Lilia Natalia

texts.es:
Lilia es una mujer emprendedora, sonriente, luchadora y capaz, la cuales se dedica a prestar servicios de confección a terceros, inició su negocio en el año 2013, con una máquina y un proveedor, con el pasar del tiempo ha ido creciendo y tiene trabajo más constante, gracias a que se caracteriza por ser muy pulida en sus trabajos y puntual en sus tiempos de entrega.
En estos momentos la mente de Lilia está enfocada en el crecimiento de su empresa, es por esta razón que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una máquina fileteadora, quiere terminar el año de la mejor manera y empezar un 2016 con toda la maquinaria a punto para lograr mayor número de contratos que le signifiquen un aumento considerable de ingresos.
texts.en:
Lilia's an enterprising, smiling, persevering, and capable woman who earns a living providing tailoring services to third parties. She started her business in 2013 with a machine and a supplier. Over time she has grown and she has more steady work, thanks to being known for her polished work and punctual delivery time.

At the moment Lilia's focused on the growth of her business, so she's requesting a loan to buy an overlock machine.

She wants to finish the year in the best way possible and start 2016 with all the equipment to secure a greater number of contracts, leading to a considerable increase in income.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine to get more merchandise and to improve her production time

Suleiman is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Suleiman is thankful that his days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Mmaize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Suleiman would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Suleiman will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Suleiman now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dile

texts.en:
This elderly couple is Dile and her husband Pjeter. Their family home can be seen in the background.They live in the very rural northern part of the country.

They are requesting this loan to pay for their only son's master's degree. He has recently started working in a printing house.

For 25 years now they've been doing agriculture/livestock to earn a living in addition to their retirement pension of $150/month (the total for both of them). On the 13 dynym of agricultural land they own, they plant wheat on 7 dynym, they rent 5 dynym to other villagers and they grow veggies on one dynym. As far as livestock are concerned, they currently have 3 pigs, 20 chickens, 2 turkeys and 1 goat. They only sell the piglets and wheat.

loans.use: to pay for her son's master's degree.

loans.name: Lahakhok Group

texts.en:
Khammee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Khammee and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits.

Khammee and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years, filter users, like Khammee’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dituben And Group

texts.en: 45-year-old Dituben hails from the Dahod district of Gujarat. She lives with her husband and a child. Dituben supports her husband as she doesn’t want the earning burden to fall on him; hence she runs a vegetable business. She feels that expanding the business would earn her more income than she usually does. So with the help of Prayas (Milaap’s field partner in Gujarat) she formed a group called Dituben and Group. The group consists of four members who together need a loan for their respective businesses. Dituben will use the loan for purchasing potatoes, tomatoes, cauliflower, cabbage, brinjal chilli and onions for her vegetable business. When the business is sustainable, these women gain confidence to run the business independently, and this is possible with your timely support and encouragement.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Isyaku

texts.en:

As a Babban Gona member, Isyaku is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.
