loans.name: Champaben And Group

texts.en:
43-year-old Champaben hails from the Dahod district of Gujarat. She lives with her husband and three children. Champaben runs her own paan store, selling the popular local digestive made of stuffed betel leaves. She works hard to supplement her husband’s income, and diligently saves, so they can be financially stable and have a guaranteed income source.

As her children are growing up, the expenses of the family are rising. The income from her current work is insufficient. She wants to save a good amount for her children's education. So Champaben seeks to grow her microenterprise and increase her income. She plans to buy greater quantities of betel leaves and seasonings at better rates. This will improve her profit margins and also help her cater to more customers, increasing her income. Champaben has joined with four other women: Manguben, Naduben, Sushilaben and Ramilaben. Together they need a group loan to expand their respective businesses. The loan will help these women meet their family's basic needs and cover their children's educational costs. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her paan shop microenterprise.

loans.name: Flor De Alejandria Group

texts.en:
In a mountainous, cold area off of the Interamerican Highway in Western Guatemala that is often engulfed in fog, the community Nueva Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán is found. Many women in the area work as artisans, weaving traditional textiles of the region and creating beautiful, intricately designed cortes (skirts), and hüipiles (blouses) that emulate their local and ancient indigenous style.

It is in this place where we find the “Flor de Alejandria” or “Flower of Alejandria” trust bank, formed by seven women from the area. One of these women is Guadalupe, who studied through second grade and now has two children. She has been married for 10 years to a Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán native.

Guadalupe runs a tailoring business, embroidering traditional tapestries, aprons, and hüipiles (blouses) in indigenous styles of different parts of Guatemala. Her business is operating smoothly, and with the help of a loan, it will only be strengthened. For this reason, this visionary woman is requesting support from Kiva to increase her inventory, and buy cloth, accessories, needles, thread, and new parts for her sewing machine, to fortify her business.

Guadalupe’s dream is to see her business thriving, eventually buying another sewing machine to satisfy her demand. This will be made possible with her continued efforts and determination, increased profits, and the support of investors around the world who believe in women entrepreneurs, like her.

loans.use: to increase her inventory, and buy cloth, accessories, needles, thread, and new parts for her sewing machine, to fortify her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 55-year-old widow from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. All her four children are now adults. She has been relying on her sari-sari store(general store) business to earn a living for four years now.

Veronica is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, liquors, tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, bath soap and electronic load wallet for mobile subscribers.

Veronica dreams of living in a comfortable house in the future, once she can save enough from her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquors, tooth paste, etc.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 54-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children. She works really hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs and demands. She has opened in her house a room to prepare homemade foods and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today she’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more food provisions in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more food provisions.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has three school-aged children. Her husband is the main income provider; he works hard to earn enough money to be able to pay their daily expenses.

She requests a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase stationery and school items for her children. She said that she is very satisfied and willing to benefit from kiva’s loan to continue their education.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and the school items for her children.

loans.name: Kito Development Group Bweyogerere

texts.en:
Berita is a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance; she previously applied for a loan of UGX 500,000. She is a married woman with children. She is a businesswoman who is a tailor, and she is a hardworking lady.

In a bid to increase her working capital, she has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital to boost her business. She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business.

The group is appreciative of the Kiva support and partnership.

Photo: The extra person is saving and hopes to get a loan next cycle. The seventh is the UGAFODE Credit staff in charge of the group (extreme left).

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Isabel Marciano

texts.es:
Isabel Marciano con 52 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge,en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la cría-engorde y posterior comercialización de ganado vacuno; cría en inverna propias, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 1 año.Invernas cuentan con pasto natural de la zona, sus animales luego de engordarlos los comercializa cada cinco meses los domingos que es día de plaza en el distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo, donde se reúnen criadores, compradores de todo el distrito y sus caseríos, para ofertar y comprar el buen ganado que posee. Adicionalmente cultiva café de la variedad Catimor,así mismo cultiva producto de pan llevar (vitucas, yuca, menestras y otros productos), y cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, patos y cerdos) para el consumo y en ocaciones para venta.El destino del crédito será para la compra de ganado vacuno para engordarlo luego de ello sacarlo a la venta, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Isabel Marciano es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Isabel Marciano is 52 years old. He lives with his spouse in their own home made of rustic material, in a rural area in the district of Santo Tomas, in the province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, Peru.He has good personal and work references from local residents. The inhabitants of this area work mostly in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He has worked for one year raising and selling cattle in his own pastures. The pastures contain natural local grazing material. He then sells them every five months. On Sundays there is a market in the district of Santo Tomas de Cutervo where breeders and buyers gather from the whole district and surrounding areas gather to buy his good cattle. He also grows coffee of the Catimor variety and food crops (taro, yucca, vegetables and other products), and raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, ducks and pigs) for his own consumption and sometimes to sell. The loan will be used to buy cattle to fatten and later sell. With this he will earn more income and thereby improve the quality of life for himself and his family. Isabel Marciano is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a young woman who resides in a town called Blantyre in Malawi. Blantyre is known as the economic capital of Malawi. This makes it an ideal location for an emerging entrepreneur. Esther is looking to start running her own business in Blantyre, making sending and receiving of money much easier and safer for locals.

Esther grew up in a typically middle class family and had a good life until her father lost his job when she was in high school. Since then, her life has been riddled with challenges and financial constraints. Esther would like to start her own business because she would like to ease the heavy load of her parents and become financially secure in her own right. Currently, the economy in Malawi makes it difficult for young people to find gainful employment. This makes it difficult for Esther to support herself. She believes that becoming a Zoona agent and running her own business will turn his situation around.

Esther would like to generate enough capital to start her own mobile money transfer business. The loans is going to be used to procure a trading trolley, a mobile phone and the funds needed to serve her people who need access to Financial services. Financial inclusion is one of the biggest problems people in Africa face and Esther would like to be part of the solution by not only becoming an entrepreneur, but by offering a service which creates an impact in her country

Esther thanks the Kiva lenders for this life time opportunity to run her own business.

loans.use: to procure a branded trolley and an internet-enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.

texts.en: Davan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Davan’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maiphosee Group

texts.en: Khuouanta understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Khuouanta knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Khuouanta purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Khuouanta is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Tham Group

texts.en: Dao is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Dao and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Dao and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Dao and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Dao and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nakheu Group

texts.en: Phuvan understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Phuvan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Phuvan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Phuvan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thamee Group

texts.en: Khoon is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Khoon and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Khoon and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Khoon and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khoon and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dongsawang Group

texts.en:
Thone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Thone and his group were excited to learn that the TerraClear water filter is available on a payment plan, which makes it much more affordable.

Thone's village understands the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family budgets. Treating drinking water requires cash and time and Thone can now shift these resources to other pursuits. The TerraClear filter is guaranteed for 2 years. During these 2 years, filter users like Thone’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and medical costs associated with unsafe drinking water.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Keangyang Group

texts.en:
Soudasada is excited that the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

Soudasada and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Soudasada and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Soudasada and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Soudasada and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Hanine

texts.en:
Hanine is a 29-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. She works hard to show her determination of being able to improve her family’s way of living, and help her husband who works as an employee. 

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay the school registration fees for her child. She states that the loan will certainly help them continue his education properly.

loans.use: to pay the school registration fees for her child.

loans.name: Arelis Gregoria

texts.es:
Arelis es una mujer de 41 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 17 y 8 años de edad.
Inicio un negocio de producción de arepas, un producto muy típico elaborado en maíz, el cual es de consumo diario en mucho de los desayunos en algunas partes de Colombia, principalmente en Antioquía.
Al momento de comenzar su aventura como empresaria independiente se trazó unas metas; pagar la educación de sus hijos, consolidar un negocio el cual pueda heredar a sus hijos y comprar una vivienda.
Arelis quiere solicitar un préstamo para aumentar su producción e arepas y así dar abasto a la demanda que se presenta en fin de año, su propósito es obtener buena rentabilidad para conformar un local, tener clientes y distribuir sus productos a todas las tiendas del municipio.
El dinero será usado en comprar maíz en grandes cantidades y realizar adecuaciones al local, piso, techo, enseres entre otros.
texts.en:
Arelis is 41, married, and has two children aged 17 and 8 years. She started a business making arepas, a traditional food made of corn, which is consumed daily for breakfast in many parts of Colombia, mainly in Antioquia. When she began her adventure into being an independent entrepreneur she had some goals in mind: to pay for the education of her children, build a business that she can leave to her children, and buy a home.

Arelis wants to borrow to increase her production of arepas to meet increased demands at the end of the year. Her purpose is to get a good return in order to fix her business locale, have more clients and distribute her products to many stores in the municipality. The loan will be used to purchase corn in large quantities and fix her business locale's floor, ceiling, fixtures, and more.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn and to make improvements in her business locale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old. She grew up in Lusaka and completed her schooling here. She attempted completing a nursing qualification but this did not work out due to financial constraints. She then saw that becoming an entrepreneur would improve her standard of living because she would be in control of her own revenue and time.

The Zambian economy is unpredictable and volatile and this has contributed to many failed attempts at starting her own business. Today, Ruth is excited to be connected to Kiva lenders as this will help her make her dream of being financially independent through running her own business come true. She hopes to help take safe money transfer facilities to her community where most of the locals are unbanked and in need of this kind of service. This loan will enable Ruth to be able to purchase a trading kiosk and have the funds needed for her to start running her own business as a mobile money transfer agent.

Ruth is reaching out to Kiva lenders because she knows that this is a safe, reasonable way for her to generate the capital she needs to start running her own business. Ruth says running her own business will change her life because she will be in a position to take care of herself and have access to basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase a trading kiosk and have the funds needed to start running her own business as a mobile money transfer agent.

loans.name: Blematesaa Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 52-year-old woman who has a goal of moving successfully ahead in her life. She also wants to help out her husband with their household expenses. She belongs to the ID-Ghana Blematesaa Group along with her friend Christiana. ID-Ghana is located at Dansoman in the greater Accra region of Ghana.

A few years ago, Elizabeth opened a small trade where she sell jean clothing. The business was a success in the market. Today, this hardworking entrepreneur has a business partner. Nevertheless, she seeks financial capital so she joined Friendship Bridge with ID-Ghana to ask for a loan. She would like to buy more jean clothing as well as supplies for the regular customers. Her goal is to continue to expand her business so that she can support and sustain her family.

Elizabeth and her friends in ID-Ghana learn a lot from their monthly educational trainings that take place after they transact business on their loans. A facilitator from ID-Ghana shares information with them about the world within them and around them. One month, they may learn about health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. Another month, the topic might be women’s health, women’s bodies and proper hygiene. Since the women have had little or no education, they are eager to learn.

loans.use: To buy more jean clothing as well as supplies for the regular customers.

loans.name: Songkhone Group

texts.en:
Wan understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Wan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Wan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Wan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so his family can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
Abooman-Teshie is a beautiful city full of color, rich in trade, and blessed with hardworking citizens.

The Promise is a group of 3 women with a median age of 30 years old.

Esther is a group member who is 26 years old. She was not able to go to school herself, but she has worked hard to provide education to her child, Suleman, who is now preparing for school. Her business is selling mother care supplies. With the her loan portion, Esther will buy more mother care items to sell for a good price and bring in some income.

Esther states that with these loan cycles and the support of Kiva, she has achieved growth and increased her business profit. She has also learned how to manage her businesses wisely through the dynamic and involved workshops that ID-Ghana provides her. Her heart is full of gratitude.

loans.use: to buy more mother care items to sell for a good price and bring in some income.

loans.name: Hashimu

texts.en:
Hashimu is a maize farmer from Katsalle village. As a Babban Gona member, Hashimu is excited to have access to a trained Agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hashimu had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Hashimu can to store the maize he harvests and sell it later in the season when he can obtain up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hashimu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the potential to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Hashimu hopes to have better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary es una mujer casada de 49 años de edad que buscando la libertad financiera y valerse económicamente por ella misma se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para iniciar un negocio que será una tienda naturista.
Ella pide apoyo de la comunidad Kiva, está en una edad considerable, su matrimonio es estable pero en cualquier momento puede acabarse y quiere tener de respaldo un negocio que le genere ingresos que sirva para mejorar su calidad de vida y reparar la vivienda y tener la tranquilidad de que puede mantener un hogar por ella misma.
texts.en:
Luz Dary, 49, is a married woman who is looking for financial independence. She's requesting a loan to start a business, a natural food store, so she can be financially self-sufficient.

She's asking for support from the Kiva community. She's older and her marriage is stable, but it all could be over at any time. She wants to have the support of a business that will generate an income for her to improve her quality of life, make repairs to her home, and know that she can take care of her household by herself.

loans.use: to start a natural food store business

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre soltero de 27 años de edad que se dedica a prestar servicio de salón de belleza, es un hombre que definió su sexualidad y con orgullo dice que es una persona Gay.
Diego toda la vida se validó por sí mismo, pago sus cursos y con mucho esfuerzo, ahorros y trabajo monto su salón de belleza y es lo que le da para pagar todas sus cuentas.
Diego quiere explorar otras alternativas para generar ingresos, sin descuidar su negocio de salón de belleza, para ello necesita capital con el que no cuenta, es por este motivo que quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar con al venta de mercancía de productos por encargo.
Quiere ofrecer a sus clientes productos de belleza, perfumes, fragancias, accesorios, ropa y pijama.
texts.en:
Diego is a single man who is 27 years old and works in a beauty salon. He describes his sexual identity proudly and declares that he is a gay man. Diego has validated himself for his entire life. He paid for his own courses, and with much effort, savings and work opened his own beauty salon. With this business he pays all of his bills.

Diego would like to explore other alternatives for earning income, without neglecting his beauty salon business. For this he needs capital which he does not have. For this reason he is requesting a loan to start selling products by order. He would like to offer his customers beauty products, perfumes, fragrances, accessories, clothing and pyjamas.

loans.use: supply himself with beauty products, perfumes, fragrances, accessories, clothing and pyjamas.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a diligent 44-year-old businessman. He owns several rental units as his core, small-scale business. In one of the rental units at Mukuru Kwa Njenga, he has not installed any toilets for his tenants due to the lack of interconnected sewer lines. His tenants currently use toilets in the neighborhood, which are not easily accessible during the night. The Fresh Life Toilets, which do not require a sewer line, have proven to be the long-awaited solution for providing toilet access to his tenants. Peter hopes to acquire one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.use: to pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer from Galadima village. As a Babban Gona member, Habila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Habila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Habila can store the maize he harvests, and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Habila no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Habila hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Edilma

texts.es:
Ella es Edilma es una mujer de 38 años de edad que busca salir adelante, tener libertar financiera, ser autónoma, no depender de nadie y progresar junto con su familia.
Ella se dedica a la cría de animales,  vive en el municipio de Turbo una tierra afectada por el conflicto armado, pero que tiene habitantes como Edilma que trabajan por cambiar la cara de su tierra querida y mostrar lo que verdaderamente es, una zona llena de trabajadores pujantes, honesto y cordiales.
La cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de pollos y materiales para reparar el galpón y la porqueriza.
texts.en:
Edilma, 38, is a woman who's looking for a way to get ahead, be financially independent, be autonomous, not depend on anybody, and make progress with her family.

She earns a living raising animals. She lives in the town of Turbo. The area's affected by the armed conflict, but it has residents like Edilma who work to change the face of their beloved land and show what it truly is--a region full of strong, honest, and friendly workers.

She's currently requesting a loan to buy chickens and materials to repair the chicken coop and the pigsty.

loans.use: to buy chickens and materials to repair the chicken coop and the pigsty

loans.name: Mervis

texts.en:
Mervis is 23 years old and lives in a town called Lusaka in Zambia. Mervis is looking to start her own mobile money transfer business and be part of the solution to the financial inclusion problem. which most of Africa now faces.

Mervis grew up in Lusaka and completed her schooling here. Unfortunately, she lost her father when he died suddenly 10 years ago. He was the sole breadwinner and this caused some severe financial constraints for herself and her mother. Her mother was unable to pay for her tuition and as a result, they were separated. Mervis had to stay with distant relatives who assisted her mother by putting her through school. By the time Mervis was reunited with her mother, things had taken an unfortunate turn and her mother fell ill and passed away.

Over and above dealing with the loss of her mother, Mervis is struggling to keep up with tuition fee payments for her three younger siblings, for whom she is now solely responsible.

Zambia is a country that does not see very many female entrepreneurs succeed because society dictates that women should aspire to get married and have children. Girls are taught to aspire to marriage and to make life choices keeping in mind that marriage is the most important. Mervis would like to go against the grain and make a success of running her mobile money transfer business in Lusaka and then she would like to eventually expand into other locations.

Mervis is requesting a Kiva loan to start her own business by purchasing a trading kiosk and having the funds needed to serve people who need to access financial services.

loans.use: To generate enough capital to start a mobile money transfer business in Lusaka, Zambia.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer from Dauro village. As a Babban Gona member, Dauda is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Dauda can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dauda no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Dauda hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Phin Group

texts.en:
Somdee understands how a water filter can make a difference in the lives of her family and her group’s families. In Somdee's area, local water sources require boiling before consumption and this consumes natural and financial resources.

The TerraClear water filter Somdee purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water. Somdee is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years, so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mairo

texts.en:
Mairo is maize farmer from Galadima village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mairo is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mairo would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mairo can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Mairo is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. She hopes to use her increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a maize farmer from Galadima village. As a Babban Gona member, Salamatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Salamatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Salamatu can store the maize she harvests, and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when she can obtain the best price for her maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Salamatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Salamatu hopes to realize better yields. She plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sol Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
In a city located on the shores of Lago Atitlán, in the outskirts of San Lucas Tolimán, a small town in Western Guatemala with a hot climate, close to the coastal region, where coffee and delicious fruits grow in abundance on industrial farms, live the seven members of Sol y Esperanza, or Sun and Hope trust bank. Between 25 and 50 years of age, the majority of these women could only study a few grades of primary school, and now have a vision of making change through their children, to whom they are providing education.

Felisa is 27 years old, and studied through 6th grade, taking advantage of the chance to receive education until her family could no longer provide it for her. She is married and cares for two children who are 7 and 9 years old and are in first and third grade in primary school. She is very busy running her various businesses in addition to the responsibilities she has to her family. Felisa has a convenience store where she sells basic everyday items, as well as warm snacks like little tamales, and warm drinks like atol. In addition to her store, she also weaves and embroiders huipiles, traditional blouses, to sell near and far. With her loan, she will invest in her store, buying items such as rice, sugar, pasta, soda, corn, and soup to restock. Throughout her three years working with Friendship Bridge, Felisa has seen decent gains in her profit, which motivate her to dream big for the future. In the next few years, she would like to open more stores to expand her sales.

Thanks to Kiva, this dream can come true!

loans.use: in buying items such as rice, sugar, pasta, soda, corn, and soup to restock.

loans.name: Segundo Julio

texts.es:
Segundo Julio con 46 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 hectáreas de variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación está en segundo año de producción,con una experiencia en el rubro hace 20 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca) para su consumo, en ocasiones para la venta y además trabaja como peón agrícola. El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar calidad de vida de él y de su familia.

Segundo Julio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.El firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Segundo Julio, 46, lives in his own home constructed of rustic materials with his wife and children in the district of Santo Tomas, Cutervo Province, in Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good personal and professional references from local people in his area. The people in his town mostly earn their livings through agriculture and the livestock trade.

He earns his living in agriculture, specifically by growing coffee. He has 2 hectares of a variety called Catimor, which is resistant to disease and pests in its second year of production. He has more than 20 years of experience in the coffee business. He also breeds small animals (chickens, guinea pigs) and grows staple crops (cassava, banana, and tubers) for consumption and sometimes for market. He also works as an agricultural laborer. The loan is for the maintenance and cultivation of 1 hectare of coffee, ensuring good production for the 2016 season, which will be reflected by a higher volume of sales. He will have more income to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

Segundo Julio is a recurring borrower from Edpyme Alternative. His wife also signed the loan.

loans.use: to maintain and harvest one hectare of coffee

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es una madre cabeza de familia de 48 años de edad, toda una guerrera, una luchadora la cual ha sacado a su familia adelante sola, tiene dos pequeños que son su principal fuente de energía e inspiración, son ellos el motivo por el cual la cliente trabaja con tanto esfuerzo diariamente para vender sus productos los cuales son ropa y calzado.
Con el entusiasmo que siempre la caracteriza, con su sonrisa, con  humildad quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecerse de surtido de prendas y calzado juvenil para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Graciela is a mother and the head of her household. She is a strong 48 year old, working hard to bring up her family on her own. She has two young children who are her main source of energy and inspiration. They are the reason why she works so hard everyday to sell her products (clothing and footwear).

With her characteristic enthusiasm and humility, and her smile, Graciela wants to apply for a loan to increase her stock of assorted garments and footwear for young people in order to take advantage of the year-end season.

loans.use: to stock up on an assortment of clothing and shoes for young men and women

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angela is 32 years old and married with a male child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Angela has a store in the Teshie market where she sells tigernut both at wholesale and at retail. She is requesting a Kiva loan of GHS 1,500 through ID-Ghana in order to buy more stock of tigernut to sell.

She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Angela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tigernut to sell.

loans.name: Rabo

texts.en:
Rabo is a maize farmer from Gwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Rabo is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Rabo will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling her to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Rabo no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Rabo hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Grace has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Grace would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Grace can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Grace will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Grace is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, Rahila is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Rahila had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can store the maize she harvests and sell it later in the season, when she can earn up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the potential to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Rahila now has the opportunity to actualize her dream of growing her agriculture business for herself and her family members. She would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abigail has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abigail would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Abigail can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abigail will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Abigail is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Vernhongkham Group

texts.en:
Phuthong is excited that the TerraClear water filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Phuthong and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. They also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease.

After totaling up the costs, Phuthong and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. The water filter they purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nakhanor Group

texts.en: Donely’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Donely and her group are excited that the TerraClear water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time and Donely can now shift these resources to other pursuits. Donely's group understands the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; during this 2 years, filter users like Donely’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is a hard-working man who earns a living by operating a local mode of transportation known as "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport services. He is 44-year old married man and has nine children, whom four are still attending school.

He transports passengers from one place to remote areas. In addition to that, he also engages in farming. He also grows and sold rice.

He has requested loan from CEVI to buy motor oil, tires and fertilizers. In this way he hopes to improve his financial income. In that way he could improve the yield of his farm and produce bountiful harvest. In that way, he would be able to augment his income and continue to manage it successfully.

With his previous loan,he was able to repaid it back successfully and now he is requesting a new loan, to continue rebuild his business.

loans.use: to buy motor oil, tires and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una microempresaria de 27 años, madre de dos hijos menores de edad que reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio de la capital del país, ella inició su negocio de venta de materias primas e insumos para artesanías en el año 2014, en alianza con su cónyuge quien es docente en una escuela para formar artesanos; él promociona y les ofrece precios de oportunidad a sus estudiantes.  Elizabeth maneja un amplio surtido de pieles, hilazas, hilos, taches, tinturas y herramientas de mano, sin embargo desea elaborar billeteras, fajones, y bolsos de temporada con los que incrementará su ingreso, por ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para contar con el capital necesario para su proyecto. Elizabeth planea vender sus productos al detal y al por mayor, pues cuenta con la demanda necesaria.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 27 years old, is a small business entrepreneur and mother of two younger children who lives with her partner in a neighborhood of the capital city in Colombia. 

She started her business selling raw materials and supplies for crafts in 2014 in partnership with her husband who is a teacher at a school that trains artisans. He promotes the business and offers special pricing to his students.

Elizabeth uses a wide range of skins, yarns, threads, designs, paints and hand tools. However, she wants to make wallets, watches and seasonal handbags, which will increase her income. 

Because of this, she applied for credit, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to connect her financial wellbeing to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in order to have the needed capital for her project. Elizabeth plans to sell her products in retail stores and wholesale as she has the necessary demand.

loans.use: to make wallets, watches and handbags.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is married and has no children.  He is a helpful and ambitious man who is working hard to help his wife with the ‎sale of provisions.  ‎His wife owns her own shop at their residence.

Marlon requested a loan to help his wife to buy more products such as soap, soft-drinks,canned tomato paste, toothpaste and others to attain customers needs for much income.‎

loans.use: To buy more products such as soap, soft-drinks,canned tomato paste, toothpaste and others to attain customers needs for much income.‎

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with six kids, none of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Asha operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. In addition she also operates a an open air food selling business that earns her another source of income .

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Kingsley Ofori

texts.en:
Kingsley is a caterer who trades in the preparation of meat pies, burgers, and pizza in the province of Osu Accra. He is a single, humble and hardworking young man who is very zealous in his business, with the desire of establishing two branches.

He seeks the loan from Kiva through ID-Ghana for the establishment of his business. He is currently facing financial difficulty, especially in the festive Christmas season, which is approaching. He therefore seeks a loan of 600 GHS to purchase more foodstuffs so as to increase production to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs so as to increase production to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a maize farmer from Dantani village. As a Babban Gona member, Amos is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Amos would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Amos can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Amos no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Amos hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a Babban Gona maize farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, Isah is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Isah had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Isah can store the maize he harvests and sell it later in the season when he can earn up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the potential to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Isah now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to build a better home for his family and buy land.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of sewing at her home as her husband (also shown in the photo) income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Noreen is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of PKR 20000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase sewing materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time.  She hopes to get an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is maize farmer from Mahauta Gimba village. As a member of Babban Gona, Sulaiman is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Sulaiman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Sulaiman can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Sulaiman is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Yakubu had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Yakubu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yakubu has the potential to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Yakubu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to feed his family and children. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sesawang Group

texts.en: Maneechan understands the difference that a water filter can make in the lives of her family and her group’s families. In her area, local water sources require boiling before consumption and this consumes natural and financial resources. The TerraClear water filter Maneechan purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Maneechan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years, so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sindy Aracely

texts.en:
Sindy Aracely is 33 years old, married with two children and has a 6th grade education. She lives in the town of Guardianía del Hato, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. Her business is a small store from which she sells basic food products such as water, corn, sugar, chicken, oil, etc. Her dream in life is to provide a better education for her children. And her husband actively supports her business and her goals.

Sindy is starting her fourth loan cycle with Namaste. When she started working with Namaste, she had a monthly net profit from her store of 1,500 Guatemalan Quetzales and was cleaning houses to supplement her income. Now, 27 months later, she has completed the three cycles of the Namaste Basic Business Development Program and has had many hours of instruction in how to manage a business. She has also worked for all these months with a Business Advisor who has given her advice on what she can do to grow her business. With each cycle she received a slightly larger loan, which she invested in her business with the guidance of her business advisor.

Sindy has worked hard and was an excellent role model for the other women in her group. She listened carefully and put the advice of her Business Advisor into practice. She has learned to visualize her goals and achieve them one step at a time. Through the three cycles she increased her monthly net profit to 7,900 Guatemalan Quetzales.
The fourth cycle that Sindy is now entering is an eighteen month Namaste pilot program for women who have the potential to grow their businesses beyond what they accomplished through the three cycles of the Basic Business Development Program, to the point of creating jobs for others in their communities. She will receive even more education and advice and an even larger loan. She plans to use this loan to buy additional products for her store and she wants to learn to evaluate the sales of each item so as to maximize her profits. Her goal is to increase her profits by 29% during this cycle.

loans.use: buy additional products for her store

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric has over 16 years experience in real estate doing property management, selling, rehabbing and development. He is passionate about the field and has gained a lot of knowledge in real estate over the years. Eric lives with his wife and children in Florida, and soon, he’ll be completing his MBA in Management Strategy.

The largest difficulty Eric has had thus far has been getting the funds necessary to get the equipment he needs to grow his business. He is currently seeking a loan to invest in a pressure washer, air compressor, paint sprayer and monthly supply of materials such as paper, plastic, tape, brushes and rollers.

His vision for the future is to have a turnkey operation that allows him to be financially secure to run in multiple areas in Florida.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment and materials, such as a pressure washer, air compressor, paint sprayer and monthly supply of materials such as paper, plastic, tape, brushes and rollers.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулнора заботливая  мать двоих детей. Дочкам 20 и 14 лет. Гулнора сейчас одна воспитывает дочерей, потому что она разведена с мужем. Гулнора занимается шитьем женской одежды. Ей удобно шить на дому. Она научилась шить 5 лет назад и уже имеет хороший опыт. 
В настоящий момент Гулнора планирует купить современную швейную машинку. Она накопила немного сумму денег, но для купли желаемую швейную машинку не хватает денежных средств. Желаемая швейная машинка стоить дорога. Чтобы достичь своих целей Гулнора обратилась за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать сейчас эту прекрасную женщину, и она будет благодарна Вам за поддержку!
texts.en:
Gulnora is the loving mother of two children. Her daughters are 20 and 14 years old. Gulnora is currently raising her daughters alone, as she divorced from her husband.

Gulnora works with sewing women's clothing. It is convenient for her to sew at home. She started sewing five years ago and already has great experience. Currently she plans to purchase a modern sewing machine. She saved some money, but does not have enough to purchase the sewing machine she wants. The one she wants is expensive.

In order to reach her goal, Gulnora applied for a loan. You can support this beautiful woman now, and she will be thankful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 19-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband and her two children, all of whom are still studying. She is a housewife who is dedicated to her home and family. Her husband is the main income provider; he owns a small mobile shop in his town. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; she will be utilizing the loan to pay the school educational fees for her children.  She said that this loan will surely help her to insure the school year for them, which makes her very joyful.

loans.use: to pay the school educational fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: travel to Guinea to buy  buy clothing materials, bags of rice etc

loans.name: Ekome Feemo 2 Group

texts.en:
They are united with one zeal and focus. They deal in the sales of cloths, fried chicken and banku (a Ghanaian dish), maize, fish, bowls and corn dough in the localities of Teshie.
This group is called Ekome Feemo 2. Ruby is the group representative. She is a 47-year-old married woman with two children who are in elementary level of education. She sells chicken intestines and cloths at her residence.
As she supports her husband with regards to the upkeep of her household, Ruby and her counterparts seek help from Kiva through ID-Ghana for a loan sum of 6,100 GHS, where she will use her portion of loan to buy more cloths and food stuffs to sell in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cloths and food stuffs to sell in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Jairo Alfonso

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre el cual el emprendimiento le cambio la vida, anteriormente se ganaba la vida trabajando temporalmente en diferentes sitios, dichos empleos le daban para ganar lo suficiente para alimentar a su familia y nada más. Cansado de este estilo de vida, decidió usar un pequeño capital que tenía guardado y comprar una moto o bueno parte de ella, con la que presta servicio de transporte en el municipio de San Pedro de Urabá.
Desde que tiene su motocicleta ha logrado generar mayores ingresos para su familia, la cual es  conformada por 3 hijos y su amada esposa.
Jairo quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual usara para terminar de pagar la motocicleta y que sea de su propiedad.
Para Jairo es una bendición tener ese negocio, a sus 62 años de edad le es más fácil trabajar en una motocicleta y no realizando grandes esfuerzos físicos que son muy perjudiciales para su salud.
texts.en:
Jairo is a man whose life has been changed by entrepreneurship.  Previously he made a living working temporary jobs in different areas that paid him only enough to feed his family and nothing more.  Tired of this lifestyle, he decided to use a small amount of money he had saved to pay for most of the cost of a motorcycle, which he uses to offer transportation services in the town of San Pedro de Urabá.  Since he has had his motorcycle he has been able to generate better income for his family, which includes his three children and beloved wife.

Jairo wants to request a loan that he will use to finish paying off his motorcycle so it will become his property.  

For Jairo it is a blessing to have this business.  At 62 years old, it is easier for him to work on a motorcycle and not make a great physical effort, which would be very damaging to his health.

loans.use: to pay off the motorcycle he uses for work

loans.name: Eredis Judith

texts.es:
Eredis es una humilde mujer de 38 años de edad, se dedica a al cría de cerdos, un negocio que inicio por necesidad económica para apoyar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar.
Eredis actualmente se encuentra solicitando una ayuda financiera que le permita crecer como empresaria, ella está cansada de solo trabajar para sobrevivir, quiere arriesgarse, busca compradores, mover su negocio, ella sabe que está en sus manos progresar o seguir con un ciclo interminable donde genere solo lo suficiente para vivir.
El dinero del préstamo será para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y materiales para ampliar la porqueriza donde ubicara los cerdos.
texts.en:
Eredis is a humble woman of 38 years. She earns her living breeding pigs. She started this business out of economic necessity to support her husband and help with household expenses.

Eredis is currently seeking a loan for financial assistance to enable her to grow as a business woman. She is tired of working just to survive. She wants to take a risk, seek more buyers, and move her business ahead. She knows that it is up to her to continue on or stay in the endless cycle in which she generates only enough to live.

The loan money will be invested in pigs and materials to expand her pig pen, where the pigs live.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and improve construction of her pig pen

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a widowed woman with eight children  all of whom do not attend school because they are all grown -ups .She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water .Her greatest monthly expenses is food.
She has operated a business of keeping livestock and farming selling  as retail .
With the loan is she is requesting she wants to purchase a solar energy to use at home and even  in her business at night .She decided to join yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy to use at home and even  in her business at night

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Deborah has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Deborah would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Deborah can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Deborah will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Deborah is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family. She looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en:
Nageena started her business selling animals by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation. Nageena is 37 years old; she is a married woman shown in the photo, with her husband. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a Murabaha loan of PKR 30000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Alyasau

texts.en:
Alyasau is a maize farmer from Liman village. As a Babban Gona member, Alyasau is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

texts.en:
Alhaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alhaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Soad

texts.en: Soaad is 48, married, and has three sons and one daughter. She has a small fattening project. She previously requested three consecutive loans and successfully repaid them on the due dates. She is requesting a fourth loan (20,000 EGP) to buy two head of cattle to increase her sales of milk, cheese and butter to more diary labs. She believes she will be able to run both of her projects since it is easy for her and she has a long experience in both projects.

loans.use: To buy two head of cattle.

loans.name: Vengkham Group

texts.en:
Inphone is excited that the TerraClear water filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Inphone and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. They also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease.

And after totaling up the costs, Inphone and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for their families. The water filter they purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали из Хуросона трудолюбивый и миролюбивый человек. Ему 43 лет. Он женат и у него 7 детей, и всех их обеспечивает один Курбнали. Он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно - рогатых скотов. Для этого он просит кредит. В данный момент здоровое питание является дефицитом. Он хочет, разводит телят, чтобы получить по больше молока тем самым обеспечить молоком свою семью и  деревню. Курбонали за здоровое питание и хочет, что бы другие питались правильно. Он желает сделать мир лучше.
texts.en:
Qurbonali from Khuroson is a hardworking and peace-loving man. He is 43 years old. He is married and has seven children, who he provides for alone.

He works with livestock breeding; he breeds cattle. He requests a loan for this. Currently there is a shortage of healthy food. He would like to breed calves in order to get more milk, thereby providing milk both to his family and the village. Qurbonali also wants the healthy food so that others can eat healthily. He wants to make the world a better place.

loans.use: to increase his herd to get more milk and provide a healthy diet for his children

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a single parent with a daughter in school and she describes herself as determined.

Vida operates a retail business selling cassava dough and she has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the GHS 700 loan to buy more stock of cassava dough for sale.

This is her first loan with ID-Ghana. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cassava dough for sale.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, Dauda is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Dauda had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can store the maize he harvests and sell it later in the season, earning up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the potential to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Dauda has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and his family. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer from Danlawal village. As a Babban Gona member, Dauda is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dauda can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dauda no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Dauda hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
Maria is a 34-year-old woman. She is currently married to a loving husband and has three young children who are 12, 8 and 6 years old. They are all studying. Maria describes her family as very loving and strong.

To make their living, Maria and her husband work at hardware stores that they own. They currently have two different stands (in different places) and both of those do well, but Maria feels that they could do better and increase the profit by increasing their stock size. Therefore, she is looking for a 21,053 MXN, which will allow them to buy construction materials, plumbing materials and other items. She is willing to buy stuff like paint, concrete, and tools among other items.

Maria is certain the she will succeed. She is constantly moved by the idea of providing her daughters with a better future.. Her biggest accomplishments are to establish to successful business and raising her wonderful kids.

loans.use: to restock her hardware store.

loans.name: Jaime Enrique

texts.en:
Jaime is a 47 year old man, who is married with a wife and two sons, one of them works and contributes to the house income, the other is still attending school.

Jaime is the main economical support of his household. He provides for them by working at a petrol company and he also makes an extra income by running a taxi stand.

Jaime and his family live in a house that Jaime owns. Jaime has been building different parts of the house as years pass, so now he is willing to install new windows and replace some of the old ones. He also wants to replace another kind of floor, so he is looking for a 21,053.00 MXN which would allow him to keep on improving his house.

According to people interviewed by Kubo, Jaime is a very responsible man who always pays his debts on time and like to spend his free time with his family.

loans.use: to replace the windows of his house and change the floor .

loans.name: Manizha

texts.ru: Эту молодую девушку зовут Манижа. Ей всего 19 лет. В селах и деревнях Таджикистана девушки рано выходят замуж. И Манижа тоже не стала исключением. Она по велению родителей вышла замуж. Но ее семейная жизнь не сложилось. Манижа вернулась обратно в родительский дом. Сейчас Маниже 19 лет, у нее трое маленьких детей на руках, и сломанная семейная жизнь. Манижа постепенно поправляется и начинает жизнь заново. На сегодняшний день у ее семьи есть не большое виноградник, где она сама выращивает виноград. Теперь она хочет самостоятельно посадить лук, продать урожай, помочь семье и не быть обузой для своих родителей. Для приобретения минеральных удобрений и семян лука она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
This young woman is called Manizha. She is 19 years old. In the rural areas and villages of Tajikistan girls get married early, and Manizha is not an exception. She got married at the command of her parents. However, her family life did not work out. Manizha returned to her parents' house. Currently Manizha is 19 years old and she has three small children on her hands, and a broken family life. She is recovering step by step and starting life anew.

Manizha's family has a small vineyard where she grows grapes. Currently she would like to plant onions too, by herself, and sell the harvest to help her family and not be a burden to her parents. She requests a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and onion seeds.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and onion seeds
